If these companies were obliged to pay to clean up the air pollution, they would at least make an effort to reduce the amount of air pollution they cause.Second, private individuals cause air pollution in several ways such as inessential use of cars and house heating. As house heating is a major need in the winter time, some households do not consider to use filters to reduce the amount of pollution that the heating causes. Instead of this, some expensive vehicles cause a huge amount of pollution. In my opinion, by charging private individuals for causing air pollution, that will at least contribute to reduce the amount of the pollution. On the other hand, I believe that governments should restrict the use of products that cause air pollution for both individuals and companies. Governments also should use an amount of money from their budgets to clean up the air, instead of putting all the responsibility to companies and private individuals. In conclusion, due to the fact that governments are responsible to provide a healthy environment for their inhabitants and they should be responsible from cleaning up the air pollution, both companies and private individuals should take the main part to clean up the air pollution.
llm: The issue of environmental cleanup has sparked a debate between those who believe the government should take responsibility and those who think companies and private individuals should bear the burden. In my opinion, while the government plays a crucial role in setting regulations, more responsibilities should be placed on private individuals and companies, particularly when it comes to air pollution.Air pollution is a pressing concern that affects the environment in numerous ways. The release of pollutants into the atmosphere contributes to the depletion of the ozone layer, exacerbating global heating. This, in turn, has devastating consequences, including more frequent natural disasters, rising sea levels, and unpredictable weather patterns. Given the severity of this issue, it is essential that we hold private individuals and companies accountable for their role in perpetuating air pollution.One effective way to do this is by implementing a system where individuals and companies pay to clean up air pollution. This could take the form of a carbon tax or a cap-and-trade system, where companies are required to purchase permits for their emissions. This would provide a financial incentive for individuals and businesses to reduce their reliance on polluting activities and invest in cleaner alternatives.On the other hand, governments should restrict the use of products that cause air pollution for both individuals and businesses. This could involve banning the sale of fossil fuels, implementing strict emissions standards for vehicles, and promoting the use of renewable energy sources. By setting these regulations, governments can create an environment that encourages sustainable practices and discourages polluting activities.In conclusion, while governments play a vital role in setting regulations, private individuals and companies should take more responsibility for cleaning up the environment, particularly when it comes to air pollution. By implementing a system of payment for pollution and restricting the use of polluting products, we can work towards a more sustainable future and mitigate the devastating effects of air pollution.

question: High sales of a product are mainly due to good advertisment strategies. To what extend to you agree or disagree?
human: Everyday, companies offer a huge number of different products to consumers. The most effective way to convince consumers to purchase a product is through advertising. However, it is not sufficient in itself. The product also should satisfy the needs of the consumers. In my opinion, advertising is the major reason for high sales of a product for several reasons. We are mainly introduced to products through advertisements. Therefore, advertisers push the limits of creativity to dispose the consumers to purchase the product. When the consumers are impressed by the way a product is advertised, they can be convinced to consider that the product is a need in some cases. Recently, there is a very creative advertisements of a soft drink product on TV. The story delivers a desired call to drink that soft drink that people tend to drink when the weather is too hot. As a result of this, the number of that product being sold will increases. Also, the more an advertisement of a product takes place in mass media, the more popular the product becomes. Advertisement is the most effective way to create a well-known product. Consumers tend to purchase the most known product when it comes to picking one out of two different brands of the same product. When a product is commonly used, it becomes trustworthy for the society, no matter what quality it is. However, it also has to be affordable for the consumer. Considering this fact, advertisements have undeniable affects on the society about the product being advertised. They make the product preferable. In conclusion, as I believe that consumers should consider major needs when they purchase goods, high sales are obviously a reflection of the powerful advertisements.
llm: High sales of a product are often attributed to various factors, with advertising strategies being one of the most significant contributors. To a certain extent, I agree that good advertising strategies play a crucial role in driving sales, but I also believe that it is not the sole determining factor.On one hand, advertising is indeed an effective way to convince consumers to purchase a product. Through various media channels, advertising can create awareness, build brand recognition, and shape consumer perceptions. Well-crafted advertisements can captivate audiences, generate interest, and ultimately drive sales. Moreover, advertising allows companies to differentiate their products from competitors, making them more appealing to potential customers.On the other hand, advertising is not sufficient in itself. A product must also satisfy the needs of consumers to achieve high sales. No matter how effective an advertising campaign may be, if the product does not meet consumer demands or expectations, sales will ultimately suffer. Consumers are increasingly savvy and will not be swayed by advertising alone. They require a product that delivers value, quality, and functionality.In conclusion, advertising is a reflection of a product's overall appeal and value proposition. While good advertising strategies can undoubtedly contribute to high sales, they are not a guarantee of success. Companies must also focus on developing products that meet consumer needs and expectations. Effective advertising can amplify the appeal of a well-designed product, but it cannot compensate for a product's shortcomings. Ultimately, the interplay between advertising and product quality is crucial in driving sales and achieving business success.

question: Some people believe a country will benefit greatly by a high percentage of young people go to university. Others argue that it only leads to unemployment. Discuss both and give your own opinion.
human: Persistent deliberation is happening as to whether it is desirable for the youth to go to university. In regard to the development of the country, some people believe that it is essential for young students to get high quality of education in universities, while others think that it is only one of causes to increase the rate of unemployment. In this essay, I will analyze both views first in order to come up with a fool-proof decision.To begin with, those who advocate the impracticability of university have several reasons. From their point of view, the fact is that there are numerous job opportunities for those who do not have the certification of university graduation, such as mechanics, sales persons, or engineers, and, furthermore, labors for graduates are in short supply. What is worse, the labor market for highly educated students is now too competitive to get a job after finishing their studying. In this regard it is a loss of national productivity that young people spend much time on searching for high salary jobs, even can be a sheer time-consuming.However, on the other side of the coin are voices in the opposition, saying that universities provide not only skills for careers, but also academic knowledge for the human race, such as bio science, politics, and medicine. These academic values are necessary to the progress of the world. More importantly, many researches in the ivory-tower have created ingenious discoveries and achievements for the development of modern society. Another significant factor of universities is that diverse experiences in the campus life can make the young generation more competently because there are a number of chances through internships, deeper discussion, independent life, and exchange scholarships.To sum up both contentions about the necessity of universities' education have reasonable justifications; however, I agree with the latter view. Although higher education does not guarantee young students' success, the benefits of learning in universities are the vital factor in creating more possibilities for the development of society through advancing academic fulfillment and the young generation who have experiences and challenges.
llm: The debate about whether a high percentage of young people attending university is beneficial to a country has sparked intense discussion in recent years. While some believe that it will lead to numerous benefits, others argue that it will only result in unemployment. In this essay, I will analyze both views in order to come up with a fool-proof decision.Those who advocate the impracticability of university have several reasons to support their claim. Firstly, they argue that the job market is not able to absorb the large number of graduates, leading to a surplus of skilled workers who cannot find employment. This is particularly true in countries where the economy is not growing rapidly enough to create new job opportunities. Secondly, they claim that the cost of university education is prohibitively expensive, leading to a significant burden on students and their families. Finally, they argue that many skills can be acquired through vocational training and apprenticeships, which are often more effective and less costly than a university degree.On the other side of the coin are voices in the opposition, saying that universities provide not only skills for careers, but also academic knowledge that is essential for a country's development. They argue that universities foster critical thinking, creativity, and problem-solving skills, which are invaluable in many areas of life. Furthermore, they claim that university education is essential for the development of a country's research and innovation capabilities, which are crucial for economic growth and competitiveness.In my opinion, while both views have valid points, the benefits of university education far outweigh the drawbacks. University education is essential for the development of a country's human capital, and it provides individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to succeed in an increasingly complex and competitive world. However, it is also important to note that vocational training and apprenticeships should also be encouraged, as they provide an alternative path for those who do not want to pursue a university degree. Ultimately, a balanced approach that combines university education with vocational training is likely to be the most beneficial for a country's development.

question: There are social, medical and technical problems associated with the use of mobile phones. What form do these problems take? Do problems of using mobile phones outweigh the benefits?
human: Nowadays, the popularity of mobile phones has brought about a lot of convenience but at the meanwhile a variety of problems as well, such as social, medical and technical problems. However, I do not think these disadvantages will outweigh the advantages brought by cell phones. In this essay, I would like to analyze these three issues in order to support my viewpoint.First of all, almost everything that changed our lifestyle a lot will also cause some social problems. Mobile phones are not out of expectation. Speaking loudly on the phone in public areas, such as schools, libraries and hospitals appears to be very impolite and offensive. What is worse, some students utilize their cell phones as an effective cheating tools in examinations in which they can send and receive answers by texting each other. Nevertheless, it is not impossible to solve these problems, as long as some regulations and rules can be effectively implemented.It is also worth mentioning that some harmful effects on our health are lethal. It has been proved that overusing of the electronic devices including mobile phones could lead to higher possibility of suffering hearing loss and even cancers, although the further investigation are needed.Another debatable problem is about techniques. There is panic among people that their conversation can be intercepted by the third party. This possibility exists all the time. But a more efficient and reliable system can also be invented to guarantee the private information of users.Moreover, the mobile phone has become a dispensable multifunctional tools in people's daily life. Not only used for communication, but it also functions as an Internet browser, a music player, a personal organizer and so forth.In conclusion, nothing can be overused without side effects. The contribution of the mobile phone to our modern society is prominent and people's dependence on it is irreversible, although it has a number of problems that should be well handled.
llm: The widespread use of mobile phones has revolutionized the way we communicate, access information, and navigate our daily lives. However, this increased popularity has also brought about a multitude of problems that affect various aspects of our society. In this essay, I will analyze the social, medical, and technical problems associated with mobile phone use, and argue that these issues do indeed outweigh the benefits.Social problems are one of the most noticeable consequences of mobile phone use. Speaking loudly on the phone in public areas, such as schools, libraries, and hospitals, appears to be very impolite and offensive. This behavior not only disrupts the peace and quiet of these spaces but also shows a lack of consideration for others. Furthermore, the use of mobile phones has also led to a decline in face-to-face communication skills, as people increasingly rely on texting and social media to interact with others. Some students even utilize their cell phones as an effective cheating tool in examinations, undermining the integrity of the educational system.Medical problems are another significant concern. The World Health Organization (WHO) has classified mobile phone use as "possibly carcinogenic to humans," highlighting the potential health risks associated with prolonged exposure to mobile phone radiation. Additionally, the constant need to check and respond to notifications can lead to increased stress levels, decreased attention span, and a decline in mental health.Technical problems also plague mobile phone users. The rapid obsolescence of mobile phone technology means that devices become outdated quickly, contributing to electronic waste and environmental degradation. Moreover, the reliance on mobile phones has also created security risks, as users are vulnerable to hacking, identity theft, and other forms of cybercrime.In conclusion, while mobile phones have undoubtedly brought about a lot of convenience, the problems associated with their use cannot be ignored. The social, medical, and technical issues highlighted in this essay demonstrate that the drawbacks of mobile phone use do indeed outweigh the benefits. As mobile phone use continues to evolve, it is essential that we address these problems and strive for a more responsible and sustainable approach to mobile phone use.

question: Using computer every day can have more negative than positive effects on your children? do you agree or disagree?
human: Nowadays, thanks to the development of technology, computer is now indispensable to life. Some people think that computer is good for children and it should be used daily by children but some others think differently. In my opinion, the latter opinion is true.First, using computer constantly has bad influence on children's eyes. When they concentrate on computer for too long, their eyes will get tired, which is the main reason for some eyes problems, typically shortsighted.Moreover, children who play games too much on computer can seriously lack communicating skills, they will know little about the outside life. It is a well-known fact that people who are addicted to games, especially online games, can eventually bear dangerous consequences. For instance, several teenagers play games without rest, which leads to health depression, a typical example is the death of Korean gamer, who had a non-stop playing for 3 days.Finally, even people who are not interested in online game can still be negatively affected by using computer too much. Some social surveys have shown that a few children use computer for studying purpose, most of them are attracted by facebook, blog, etc. instead. Due to this neglect, they will have a bad result in school because when they can not live without internet, they will have no time for their studying.In conclusion, although it is undeniable that computer is a crucial part of human life, it still has its bad side, especially for children. People should learn how to use it properly to make it an effective tool because computer should be used not only for entertaining but also for working and studying purpose.
llm: The question of whether using computers daily has more negative than positive effects on children is a highly debated topic among parents and experts. While some people believe that computers are beneficial for children and should be used daily, others hold a different view. In my opinion, I agree that excessive computer use can have detrimental effects on children's physical and social development.On the one hand, some people argue that computers are essential tools for learning and can provide children with a wealth of educational resources. They claim that computers can enhance children's cognitive skills, such as problem-solving and critical thinking. However, I firmly believe that the negative effects of constant computer use far outweigh the benefits.One of the most significant negative effects of computer use on children is the impact on their eyesight. Staring at a screen for extended periods can cause eye strain, dry eyes, and even myopia (nearsightedness). Children who use computers daily are more likely to experience these problems, which can lead to long-term vision damage.Another concern is the effect of computer use on children's social skills. Spending too much time playing games on the computer can lead to a lack of face-to-face communication and social interaction. Children who spend most of their time playing games online may struggle to communicate effectively with their peers, leading to social isolation and decreased empathy.In conclusion, while some people believe that computers are beneficial for children, I strongly disagree. In my opinion, using computers constantly has a profoundly negative impact on children's physical and social development. Parents and caregivers should be aware of these risks and set limits on their children's computer use to ensure a healthy balance between technology and other aspects of life.

question: Large factory near your community. Advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community.
human: Nowadays, whether to establish large factories nearby housing areas has become a controversial issue in our society. Out of the case of economic development, industrial buildings are a necessary part of modern society. However a vast number of people are against building a factory near their community because of pollution. From my point of view, the advantages of building a factory will outweigh its disadvantages, if we tackle the environmental problems brought by factories.First of all, a large factory can stimulate local economic growth and reduce the unemployment rate. To manufacture goods, there must be the demand of laborers, from which the local residents can benefit. What is more, the factory is not isolated, other industries and business will be quickly established, resulting in economic growth of local area. For example, the estate industry will be boosted in order to satisfy the workers' accommodation need.The main disadvantage is contamination. It is true that some area are suffering the dire consequences caused by overdeveloping the industry, such as water pollution, overcrowded traffic and medical problems. For instance, in some industrial cities, a large proportion of the workers are suffering various breathing problems, such as asthma which can be caused by waste ashes and certain chemical substances.However, it is inevitable that there will be more factories built with the development of our society. Therefore, how to improve the disadvantages of building a factory would be more important than whether to build it. In fact most problems can be avoidable if the factories put in real and great effort to manage their waste well.In conclusion, installation of manufacturing plant is a trend of industrialization for many countries. Its advantages will outweigh disadvantages as long as the factories dispose their waste and pollution in the correct way.
llm: The construction of a large factory near our community has sparked intense debate regarding its impact on our daily lives. While some residents express concern over the potential drawbacks, I firmly believe that the advantages of this new influence will outweigh its disadvantages, provided that we take proactive measures to address the environmental problems associated with factories.On the one hand, the arrival of a large factory is expected to bring numerous benefits to our community. Firstly, it will undoubtedly stimulate local economic growth by attracting new investments, creating job opportunities, and increasing the overall purchasing power of residents. According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, employment rates are likely to soar, reducing unemployment and underemployment rates in the process. Furthermore, the presence of a large factory can elevate the status of our community, making it a more attractive location for businesses and individuals alike.On the other hand, it is undeniable that the operation of a factory can lead to environmental concerns, such as air and water pollution. However, if we tackle these issues proactively, the negative impact can be mitigated. Implementing stringent regulations, investing in pollution-reducing technologies, and promoting eco-friendly practices can minimize the environmental damage.Moreover, it is inevitable that there will be more factories built with the development of our society, as industrialization is a natural step in a country's economic growth. Therefore, it is crucial that we learn to coexist with factories and find ways to maximize their benefits while minimizing their drawbacks.In conclusion, the construction of a large factory near our community can be a blessing in disguise. While there are valid concerns regarding its environmental impact, I firmly believe that the advantages of this new influence will outweigh its disadvantages. By addressing the environmental problems proactively, we can harness the benefits of industrialization and create a prosperous future for our community.

question: Food is now easier to prepare. Is this a good thing?
human: Nowadays, more and more people begin to select prepared food as their daily meals, since it can effectively save time which is considered as money in our modern society. However it is obvious that prepared food can bring about some negative influence result from utilizing the artificial ingredients, ignoring the nutrition of food and modifying people's eating habits. In this essay, I would like to explain why this is not a good thing based on the three reasons above.First of all, to make their food easier to prepare and taste delicious, almost every producer adds a wide range of artificial ingredients in to the food that is now purchased by most people. Some ingredients being added have caused dire consequences. For instance, there are usually some articles in newspapers and magazines which report the relationship between certain chemical components in some food and diseases. Thus, easy-to-cook foods sometimes could be dangerous for human's health.Not cooking fresh food will also lead to the lack of nutrition. It is true that cooking prepared food needs much less time in comparison with the fresh food. Whereas some research has apparently demonstrated that prepared food is unable to support enough nutrients we need, especially for children who are growing up.In addition, cooking is one of arts humans create. The more prepared food we eat the more cooking skills we lose. At the increasing living pace, the majority of people tend to choose microwave as their unique cooker that help them prepare a dish in five minutes. But rare people have been aware that this has contributed to a modification of cooking habits, which may cause the loss of our custom and culture about cooking.In conclusion, although the invention of prepared foods definitely satisfies the demand of some people who are busy in their work, it is not a good thing. Cooking is not a waste of time, contrarily, it is crucial for our health and culture.
llm: The rise of prepared and processed food has undoubtedly made meal preparation easier and more convenient. With the increasing demand for quick and effortless meals, the market has responded with a vast array of pre-packaged and ready-to-eat options. However, this trend has also raised concerns about the negative consequences of relying heavily on prepared food.One of the primary concerns is the use of artificial ingredients in many prepared foods. Preservatives, flavor enhancers, and coloring agents are commonly used to extend shelf life and improve appearance, but these additives can have detrimental effects on our health. Consuming high amounts of processed foods has been linked to various health problems, including obesity, diabetes, and heart disease. Furthermore, the emphasis on convenience often leads to a disregard for the nutritional value of food, with many prepared meals lacking essential vitamins, minerals, and fiber.Another issue with the prevalence of prepared food is its impact on our eating habits. The convenience of pre-packaged meals can lead to a lack of mindfulness when it comes to food, causing us to overlook the importance of a balanced diet and the joy of cooking and sharing meals. Moreover, the more we rely on prepared food, the more we risk losing traditional cooking skills and the cultural heritage associated with food preparation.In addition, the over-reliance on prepared food can result in a decline in cooking skills, as people are no longer required to prepare meals from scratch. This not only leads to a loss of culinary knowledge but also limits our ability to adapt to changing circumstances, such as food shortages or special dietary needs. By relying on prepared food, we are also denying ourselves the satisfaction and creativity that comes with cooking and preparing meals for ourselves and our loved ones.In conclusion, while prepared food may offer convenience and ease, it is essential to acknowledge the potential negative consequences of relying too heavily on these options.

question: The best and only way to assist developing countries is to provide them with financial aid. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: As is commonly understood, there is an increasingly gap between developed countries and developing countries. It can be seen that some developed countries and organization are proving financial assistance to the impoverished countries. However, it is disagreed that this can be the best and only way to assist developing countries. This will be proven by analyzing the necessity of developing their education and the real objective of supporters.Firstly, education is an essential part in development. For instance, most developing countries are lack of educational resources, such as experienced teachers, evaluation systems and teaching facilities, which is usually neglected by local authorities. From this example, it is obvious that if the developed countries are unwilling to share their successful experience in education, the developing countries will remain undeveloped, even though they gain a great deal of economic support. Thus, the critical method to improve the condition of poor countries is to help them build up a complete educational system instead of financial aid.In addition, it is well acknowledged that there is no free lunch in the world. This means some powerful countries provide financial support in order to acquire the right to exploit the local resources and target the local labour market. Indeed, they rarely provide local residents with any technological aid and even cause contamination in some areas. Therefore, developing countries should not totally depend on the financial support from powerful countries.In conclusion, financial aid is not the only way to assist poor countries. And it has been proven that developing education and improving national technology and science level are the path they have to undergo if they really want to alter current situation.
llm: The notion that the best and only way to assist developing countries is to provide them with financial aid is a contentious issue. While some argue that financial assistance is the most effective way to alleviate poverty and stimulate growth, others contend that it is not a panacea for the complex problems faced by developing countries.On the one hand, there are numerous examples of developed countries and organizations providing financial assistance to impoverished nations. For instance, the United States Agency for International Development (USAID) and the World Bank have been instrumental in providing financial aid to developing countries. This assistance is often directed towards education, a sector that is critical for the development of human capital. By investing in education, developing countries can build a skilled workforce, increase productivity, and ultimately, accelerate economic growth. The necessity of developing education in these countries is evident, and financial aid from developed countries and organizations can play a vital role in achieving this objective.However, it is also acknowledged that there is no free lunch in the world. Financial aid often comes with strings attached, and recipient countries may be required to adopt certain policies or reforms that may not be in their best interests. Moreover, financial aid can create dependency, rather than promoting self-sufficiency and sustainability. Additionally, financial aid may not address the underlying structural issues that contribute to poverty and underdevelopment in these countries.In conclusion, while financial aid can be an important tool for assisting developing countries, it is not the only solution. A more comprehensive approach that addresses the underlying causes of poverty and underdevelopment, and promotes sustainable development, is necessary. Developed countries and organizations should provide financial aid as part of a broader package of support that includes technical assistance, capacity building, and policy support. Ultimately, the objective of supporters should be to empower developing countries to take ownership of their development, rather than perpetuating dependency on financial aid.

question: Society should ban all forms of the advertising because it has no purpose and causes damages. Do you agree or disagree?
human: It is no secret that advertising become inseparable part of our modern life. We come across with ads almost everywhere and everyday. Some people argue that companies by advertising their goods or services spend their money for nothing. Other critics say that ads have no purpose, they only cause damages to society and all forms of advertising should be banned. On my part I would like to solve this issue on a different way. Society does need an advertising but it is our responsibility to control the content and what kind of goods and services we would like to offer to our customers.First of all, I do support the idea that advertising alcohol, cigarettes, goods and services with adult content should be prohibited because these kind of ads will have negative effect to our children. Youngsters might be tempted to buy cigarettes or alcohol and later to start consume it on a daily basis. Fortunately, some countries take this issue seriously and advertising alcohol, cigarettes and materials with adult content is banned on those countries.On the other hand by advertising companies, businesses, firms and individuals promote their goods and services. Thanks to ads we learn about new products, we can compare them and choose what’s the best for us.These days, not only many businesses, but also governments have to rely on advertising. For example, tourism makes up one-third of the Czech Republic's economy. In order to promote the country's attractions, the Czech government has to advertise and sell its services to foreign consumers. Only well planned and well targeted advertising will bring more foreign tourists to the country.In conclusion, I think that modern society needs advertising. Ads will keep us well informed about new products and services, but we should also bear in mind that advertising cigarettes and alcohol will definitely affect our children in negative way.
llm: I disagree with the notion that society should ban all forms of advertising. While it is true that some forms of advertising can be detrimental to society, particularly when they promote harmful products such as alcohol and cigarettes, a complete ban on advertising would be an overreaching solution.Advertising is a crucial means of promoting goods and services, allowing companies and individuals to reach their target audience and showcase their offerings. Without advertising, many businesses would struggle to survive, as they rely heavily on this form of promotion to stay afloat. Moreover, governments also benefit from advertising, as they use it to raise awareness about important issues, promote public services, and encourage civic engagement.It is true that some types of advertising can have a negative impact on society, particularly on children. Advertising for alcohol, cigarettes, and products with adult content can be particularly damaging, as they can promote unhealthy habits and behaviors among young people. Therefore, it is reasonable to restrict or ban advertising for these products, especially in media that is targeted towards children.However, this does not mean that all advertising is inherently bad. In fact, many advertisements promote positive values and behaviors, such as environmental sustainability and social responsibility. Moreover, advertising can also be a valuable source of information, helping consumers make informed decisions about the products and services they use.In conclusion, while there are valid concerns about the impact of advertising on society, a complete ban would be an overreaction. Instead, a more nuanced approach would be to regulate advertising, restricting or banning ads that promote harmful products or behaviors, while allowing businesses and governments to continue using advertising as a means of promoting their goods and services. This would strike a balance between protecting society from the negative effects of advertising, while still allowing it to serve its valuable purposes.

question: Nowadays there are more opportunities for women than there were in the past. Some people think that women should work to earn money whereas other people belief that women should care about household. What's your opinion?
human: Personally, I believe that married women nowadays have right to take up jobs like men when employment discrimination based on gender have been erased significantly. Working outside home will bring a lot of benefits to both married woman and their household. I will mention some basic reasons as following.Firstly, extra income that women earn will contribute to their family's expenses. By taking up a job, a wife can earn more money to support her family life. This is really necessary in cases of her husband's low salary and the difficulty of getting a good job at the present. So, it is a normal practice for women to be helpmates in earning money.Secondly, working outside the house creates opportunities for married women to contact with the outer world, strengthen their character and show their capacity. These things in turn will make them more confident, independent. These women will set a good example for their children. Therefore, it is no doubt that they play roles as a mother and as a wife better.Last but not least, nowadays, there are many supporting conditions that help women balance housework and work. Besides the gorvernment's policies on limited families and their husbands' sharing in the housework, many employers are willing to offer part-time jobs for women.In conclusion, a well-organized home does not need the housewife's presence the whole day long and married women could go to work in order to enjoy the working life outside the home.
llm: In today's society, the opportunities available to women have increased exponentially compared to the past. The debate surrounding the role of women, whether they should prioritize their careers or focus on household responsibilities, is a contentious one. In my opinion, women should have the freedom to choose their path, and I firmly believe that working outside the home is not only beneficial for them but also for their families and society as a whole.One of the primary advantages of women working is the financial stability it provides. With the eradication of employment discrimination based on gender, married women now have the right to take up jobs alongside men. This allows them to earn a steady income, which can significantly support their family life. By contributing financially, women can alleviate some of the economic pressures on their spouses, ensuring a more comfortable and secure life for their loved ones.Moreover, working outside the house offers numerous personal benefits for married women. It provides opportunities for them to interact with the outer world, broadening their perspectives and experiences. This, in turn, strengthens their character and enables them to demonstrate their capabilities, fostering a sense of independence and self-worth. Furthermore, working mothers set a valuable example for their children, showcasing the importance of hard work, dedication, and pursuing one's passions. This can have a profound impact on the next generation, encouraging them to be ambitious, resilient, and open-minded.In conclusion, I firmly believe that women should have the option to work and pursue their careers. Not only does it provide financial stability and personal growth, but it also sets a positive example for future generations. As society continues to evolve, it is essential that we recognize the value of women's contributions, both within the home and in the workforce, and strive to create an environment that supports and empowers them to make their choices freely.

question: The government has to provide primary and secondary education, but for university education either students or their parents should pay. To what extent do you agree?
human: Primary and secondary education provide a basic knowledge and skills to the people in this world. I completely agree that government should provide those education to their people; however, for the more higher education like university, the students or their parents should pay for the fees.Some parents might not have enough money to pay for their children university fees. In the other hand, I don't think it is also fair for the government as the government has been paying a lot of money for their students' primary and secondary education. It is better for them to use the money to pay for the other students' education so that all people in their country could receive the same education.Moreover, students that already have a basic knowledge and education can get a part-time job and they can pay for their own studies when their parent could not afford to pay it. They will be more responsible with their studies when they pay the fees themselves. In addition to that, the students will become more independent and it will build their characters in the marketplace as well.Furthermore, this will encourage all the parents to think of the way to help their children to achieve more in their lives as they need to make some contribution too for their children future.In conclusion, I completely agree that government should not pay for the university fees because this will make both the parents and students in charge for their future themselves not just depend on the government to do all their responsibilities for them.
llm: The provision of education is a fundamental responsibility of any government, and it is widely acknowledged that primary and secondary education should be provided free of charge to all citizens. However, the question of whether university education should also be funded by the government is a topic of ongoing debate. In my opinion, while the government has a duty to provide primary and secondary education, university education is a different matter, and students or their parents should be responsible for paying the fees.On the one hand, providing free university education is a significant financial burden on the government. The costs of funding universities, including faculty salaries, infrastructure, and resources, are substantial, and it is unfair to expect taxpayers to foot the bill for the education of a select few. By having students or their parents pay for university fees, the government can redirect these funds to other important public services and priorities.On the other hand, there are valid concerns that requiring students or their parents to pay for university fees can create barriers to access for those from lower-income backgrounds. Many parents may not have the financial means to support their children's university education, and this can perpetuate inequality and limit social mobility. However, there are also arguments that universities should offer scholarships, grants, and other forms of financial aid to support students who cannot afford the fees.In conclusion, while there are valid arguments on both sides, I believe that the government should focus on providing primary and secondary education, and university education should be funded by students or their parents. The government has a significant financial burden in providing education, and it is unfair to expect taxpayers to fund the education of a select few.

question: The first car appeared on British roads in 1888. By the year 2000 there may be as many as 29million vehicles on British roads. Alternative forms of transport should be encouraged and international laws introduced to control car ownership and use. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: Recently, a great deal of attention has been paid to means of transportation. Some state that automobile is the most convenient transportation, while others assert that alternative forms of transport should be considered in view of environmental pollution. In my opinion, I strongly agree that alternative means of transportation and international laws in controlling automobiles should be introduced. In this essay, several reasons will be described carefully in the following passages.Firstly, an increase in the number of automobiles brings about environmental pollution. Since automobile exhaust and carbon dioxides emission have bad impacts on the air, the air gets to be polluted and it causes respiratory disease of the local inhabitants. Therefore, it is crucial to alter automobiles to the other means of transportation and to legislate to control automobiles.Secondly, an increase in the number of automobiles causes terrible traffic congestion. Once we get into the traffic jam, it forces us to waste our time for a while. What is worse, traffic congestion irritates drivers and as a result, it leads to an increase of traffic accidents. Thus, the methods to reduce the number of automobiles and to control car ownership and use should be immediately planned and implemented.In order to solve these problems, alternative forms of transportation and international laws to control automobiles ownership and use can work effectively. With regard to the former, alternative forms which emit less carbon dioxides and gasses than automobiles are ideal. For example, rental bicycle system has been introduced in several European countries. This system is that at the corner of each district, the rental bicycles are placed and the people can ride it to the other districts with a small fee. Since bicycle expels neither carbon dioxides nor harmful gasses, it is a better form to protect environment than automobile. As for the latter point, the introduction of international laws can be also effective. For instance, there are some regulations to limit the use of automobiles by time and to allow the people possess one car only. Thus, these attempts to reduce automobiles can ease traffic congestion and environmental pollution.In summary, even though some people claim the convenience of automobile, I would state that alternative forms of transport and international laws on controlling automobiles are necessary due to the environmental protection and the alleviation of traffic congestion.
llm: The rapid growth of vehicles on British roads, from the first car in 1888 to the projected 29 million by the year 2000, has sparked intense debate on the need for alternative forms of transport and international laws to control car ownership and use. In my opinion, I strongly agree that alternative forms of transport should be encouraged and international laws introduced to control car ownership and use.A great deal of attention has been paid to means of transportation in recent years. While some state that the automobile is the most convenient mode of transportation, others assert that alternative forms of transport should be considered in view of environmental pollution. In this essay, several reasons will be described carefully in the following passages to support the notion that alternative forms of transport are a necessity.Firstly, the alarming rate of environmental pollution caused by vehicles on the road is a compelling reason to encourage alternative forms of transport. The emission of greenhouse gases and other pollutants from vehicles has severe consequences on the environment, including climate change and air pollution. Alternative forms of transport, such as cycling, walking, and electric vehicles, offer a cleaner and more sustainable solution.Secondly, the increasing traffic congestion on British roads is another reason to promote alternative forms of transport. With 29 million vehicles projected to be on the road by the year 2000, traffic congestion will only worsen, leading to wasted time, increased fuel consumption, and decreased productivity. Alternative forms of transport, such as public transport and carpooling, can help alleviate traffic congestion and reduce travel times.Finally, the introduction of international laws to control car ownership and use is necessary to address the global issue of transportation. With the increasing globalization of trade and commerce, the need for a coordinated approach to transportation policy is crucial. International laws can help set standards for emissions, safety, and efficiency, promoting a more sustainable and environmentally-friendly transportation system.In conclusion, the rapid growth of vehicles on British roads necessitates the encouragement of alternative forms of transport and the introduction of international laws to control car ownership and use. The environmental, economic, and social benefits of alternative forms of transport, combined with the need for a coordinated approach to transportation policy, make a compelling case for a shift away from car-dominated transportation systems.

question: Rich countries should provide financial help to poor contries. To what extend to you agree or disagree?
human: In this world, there is no one who does not know this world 'globalization', which means the world are more closer, and every single countries affects each other more than before in many ways. That is why governmental and non-governmental organizations have been focus on being harmony and contribute to aid to poor countries. It is true that just giving aid to impoverished countries could be manipulated by big power countries. In addition, a great amount of materials and money have poor countries being corrupted and politically dependent on other countries. However, I agree that aiding poor countries has positive effects, overweighing its side-effects for the several reasons.First of all, poor counties suffer from shortage of basic materials and facilities to start businesses and make it richer. To be out of poverty, it is fundamental to support basic industry related factors such as light, electricity, load, highways, natural resources, technology and buildings for companies. Aiding help poor countries in this situation solve their economical problems and run their own business. In actual, republic of Korea used to be the poorest country even compared to others in Africa in 1960's. Now that it has became strong economy country aiding poor countries after 10 years of aid from other counties.Secondly, aiding campaign gives a chance to considerate about poor people. If people in rich countries ponder poor people suffering from poverty and diseases, they would never take their abundance for granted. It not only raises the notice the meaning of harmony and love, but also be a good chance to learn humane doctrine of globalization.Third, the campaigns might include practical benefits. In globalized world, the economies of several countries are in a big network and must influence on each others. When America mortgage loan system went bad, several economies of European and Asian countries fluctuated, even any countries had to be gotten international supports to block its bankrupt.In conclusion, there are abovementioned three key points of positive effects of aid; supporting poor countries to make its economy strong and building humane concepts to people, keeping strong global economy. I strongly believe that being a global neighbor by aiding poor countries would be continues by many organizations and volunteers, and it will make the earth a better place to live.
llm: The notion that rich countries should provide financial help to poor countries has been a topic of discussion for years. While some argue that this aid can create dependency and undermine local economies, I firmly believe that the benefits of providing financial assistance to poor countries far outweigh the drawbacks.First and foremost, many poor countries lack the basic resources and infrastructure necessary to stimulate economic growth. Providing financial aid can help bridge this gap, enabling these countries to invest in essential services such as healthcare, education, and infrastructure. This, in turn, can create a conducive environment for businesses to thrive, generating employment opportunities and increasing the overall standard of living. For instance, a country like Bangladesh has benefited significantly from foreign aid, which has helped to improve its healthcare and education systems, leading to a significant reduction in poverty rates.Secondly, aid campaigns often raise awareness about the plight of people living in poverty, encouraging consideration and empathy from the global community. This heightened awareness can lead to increased support and pressure on governments to take action, ultimately benefiting those in need. The "Live Aid" campaign in the 1980s, for example, brought attention to the devastating famine in Ethiopia, prompting a massive global response and saving countless lives.Thirdly, many aid campaigns include practical benefits that go beyond mere financial assistance. These may involve skills training, capacity building, and technology transfer, all of which can have a lasting impact on a country's development. For example, the "One Laptop per Child" initiative has provided millions of children in poor countries with access to education and digital skills, bridging the technology gap and opening doors to new opportunities.In conclusion, while there are valid concerns about the potential drawbacks of providing financial aid to poor countries, I firmly believe that the benefits far outweigh the costs. By providing essential resources, raising awareness, and offering practical support, rich countries can play a significant role in alleviating poverty and promoting sustainable development. It is our moral obligation to help those in need, and I strongly advocate for continued financial assistance to poor countries.

question: Even though globalization affects the world's economics in a very positive way, its negative side should not be forgotten. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: During the history of the world, every change has its own positive and negative sides. Globalization as a gradual change affecting all over the world is not an exception. Although it has undeniable effects on the economics of the world; it has side effects which make it a controversial issue.Some people prefer to recognize globalization as a threat to ethnic and religious values of people of their country. They think that the idea of globalization put their inherited culture in danger of uncontrolled change and make them vulnerable against the attack of imperialistic governments.Those who disagree, believe that globalization contribute effectively to the global improvement of the world in many aspects. Developing globalization, people can have more access to many natural resources of the world and it leads to increasing the pace of scientific and economic promotions of the entire world. In addition, they admit that globalization can be considered a chance for people of each country to promote their lifestyle through the stuffs and services imported from other countries.Moreover, the proponents of globalization idea point out globalization results in considerable decrease in global tension due to convergence of benefits of people of the world which is a natural consequence of globalization.In conclusion, I would rather classify myself in the proponents of globalization as a speeding factor of global progress. I think it is more likely to solve the problems of the world rather than intensifying them.
llm: The impact of globalization on the world's economies has been a subject of intense debate in recent years. While some people believe that globalization has numerous benefits, others argue that its negative effects should not be overlooked. In my opinion, I agree that the negative side of globalization should not be forgotten.On the one hand, globalization has indeed had a positive impact on the world's economies. It has enabled the free flow of goods, services, and ideas across borders, leading to increased economic growth, job creation, and cultural exchange. Many countries have benefited from globalization by attracting foreign investment, improving their infrastructure, and increasing their competitiveness in the global market.On the other hand, some people prefer to recognize globalization as a threat to the ethnic and religious values of people in their country. The influx of foreign cultures and ideas can lead to cultural homogenization, where local customs and traditions are lost in favor of more dominant global cultures. For instance, the spread of Western culture and values has led to the erosion of traditional practices and beliefs in many non-Western societies. Furthermore, globalization has also been criticized for perpetuating inequality and exploitation, as multinational corporations take advantage of cheap labor and natural resources in developing countries.Others, however, believe that globalization contributes effectively to the global improvement of the world in many aspects. They argue that globalization has facilitated the sharing of knowledge, ideas, and technologies, leading to advancements in fields such as medicine, education, and environmental sustainability. Moreover, globalization has also promoted understanding and cooperation among nations, fostering diplomacy and peaceful resolution of conflicts.In conclusion, while globalization has undoubtedly had a positive impact on the world's economies, its negative side should not be forgotten. It is crucial to recognize the potential risks and challenges associated with globalization, such as cultural homogenization and economic exploitation, and work towards mitigating them. By acknowledging both the benefits and drawbacks of globalization, we can strive towards a more equitable and sustainable globalized world.

question: Many children are forced to stay at school and study subjects that will be of little value to them in the future. These children may disrupt the education of the majority and should be allowed to leave school early to find a themselves a job. What are your views?
human: Many people believe that children should study at school to have more knowledge that prepare better for their future. Others, however, think that these children may disrupt their school work and should be allowed to leave school early to find a job. Personally, I tend to agree with the point of view that student have to be forced to study at school.First of all, schools offer to students a good environment with experienced professors and high quality programs for studying. It creates the best conditions for students education and can force them to focus on their school work instead of wasting their time to do useless things. Second of all, schools provide lots of academic knowledge to students. Students may learn professional skills, expand their understandings and gain experiences. Therefore, they have more opprotunities to find a job and to be successful in the future. For example, as we know, employer always prefer to hire an employee of high degree who have professional skills.Nevertheless, it is not unreasonable that some people think that children should interrupt their school work and get a job. Whether children can learn a lot at school, there are many subjects that will be of little value to them in the future. Furthermore, children can learn social skills when they have a job. They can get more experiences that can not be obtained at school. Working helps children be more independent and teach them to esteem and manage the money that they've earned.Overall, I believe that students should study at school. Even though there are some advantages of leaving school to find a job, studying at school is always the best choice for children's future. There are many ways that can train children to learn independent and social skills instead of getting a job.
llm: The debate about whether children should be allowed to leave school early to find a job has sparked intense discussion among educators, policymakers, and the general public. While some people argue that students who are not interested in academics should be permitted to drop out and pursue employment, others believe that staying in school is essential for their future success. In my opinion, I concur with the latter view, emphasizing the importance of compulsory education.On one hand, many people believe that children should stay in school to acquire knowledge and prepare better for their future. Education is a vital aspect of a person's life, providing them with essential skills, critical thinking, and problem-solving abilities. By staying in school, students can explore various subjects, discover their passions, and develop a strong foundation for their future careers. Moreover, education is a key factor in breaking the cycle of poverty, as it enables individuals to secure better-paying jobs and improve their socio-economic status.On the other hand, others argue that students who are not interested in academics may disrupt the learning environment and should be allowed to leave school early to find a job. They claim that these students would be better off gaining practical experience and skills in the workforce, rather than wasting their time in a classroom.However, I strongly disagree with this perspective. While it is true that some students may not be academically inclined, it is still essential for them to receive a basic education. Compulsory education ensures that students acquire fundamental skills in reading, writing, and mathematics, which are necessary for everyday life. Furthermore, education helps individuals develop important life skills, such as teamwork, communication, and time management, which are valuable in any profession.In conclusion, while some people may argue that students who are not interested in academics should be allowed to leave school early, I firmly believe that compulsory education is crucial for their future success. By staying in school, students can gain essential knowledge, skills, and values that will benefit them throughout their lives.

question: Today, the high sales of popular consumer goods reflect the power of advertising and not the real needs of the society in which they are sold. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Nowadays, we can see advertisements everywhere, from television set to posters on the streets. Some people believe that these various advertisements get people to buy products that are unnecessary and only look good on television. I tend to agree with this view.To boost their sales and win over customers, companies pour a great amount of money into advertising. Most of the time, it is not about the function or quality of the commodities themselves but really the promotion of the good feeling of possessing the product. By which I mean, huge cooperation hire celebrities as the face of their product. By casting famous singers in their television advertisement, motorcycles or clothes for example, sales increase significantly since youngsters, as the target consumers, love celebrities. Since having these products shows their status, the quality obviously is not relatively important.However, despite the fact that advertisements can be falseful and exaggerated, it is also true that it plays and important role economically. They introduce new products, and provide various choices, not to mention they are often visually enjoyable, since they aim to grab your attention. Advertising also helps to keep prices at reasonable levels, creates a fair environment for commercial competition. Otherwise the market may be monopolistic, and the price as well as the choice will not be so selective.The power of advertising maybe over-rated, we can not deny that the final decision is on the hands of us consumers. No matter how appealing the advertisements are, we should be able to make the decision on our own.
llm: The notion that the high sales of popular consumer goods are a reflection of the power of advertising rather than the real needs of society is a contentious issue. On one hand, it is undeniable that advertisements have the ability to influence consumers' purchasing decisions, often convincing them to buy products that they do not necessarily need. Some people believe that advertisements create a false sense of need, making people desire products that are unnecessary and only look good on television. For instance, commercials often portray idealized scenarios where products solve problems that may not exist in reality, leading consumers to believe that they need these products to improve their lives.On the other hand, despite the fact that advertisements can be misleading and exaggerated, it is also true that they play an important role economically. Advertisements introduce new products to the market, providing consumers with various choices and allowing them to make informed decisions about their purchases. Furthermore, advertisements often entertain and engage audiences, making them a valuable form of media consumption in their own right. They can be visually enjoyable, creative, and even artistic, providing a welcome break from the monotony of daily life.In conclusion, while it is true that advertisements have the power to shape consumer behavior and create artificial demand, it is also important to recognize their positive contributions to the economy and society. Ultimately, the impact of advertising on sales reflects a complex interplay between the power of advertising and the real needs of society.

question: Why should the ownership of guns be limited?
human: Gun is definitely not a kind of normal good in our society, which is strictly controlled in most countries. However, gun control in some countries is relatively loose than others. Therefore, this is still a controversial topic around the world. From my point of view, it is sensible to enforce the gun control.The first factor considered is the risk of accidents with guns. The accidents cannot be completely avoided although only those who have gun licenses can purchase guns. For example, we hear some news from time to time that someone was hurt by accident during the hunting. So the fewer guns possessed, the fewer accidents would happened, our surroundings would be safer with lower accident rates.Secondly, most violent crimes are related to the abuse of guns, especially in some countries where guns are available for people. Eventually, guns will create a violent society if the trend continues. Take an example, in American, young adults and even juveniles can get access to guns, which leads to the tragedies of school gun shooting. What is worse, some terrorists are able to possess more advanced weapons than the police, which makes citizens always live in danger.Thirdly, the possession of guns can also raise the rates of suicide. In the US, firearms remain the most common method of suicide, accounting for about 50 per cent. Unfortunately, there is an increasing trend of adolescent suicides and suicides among those age 75 and over.In conclusion, considering the rise in accident rates, violent crime rates and suicide rates, I support that the guns should be strictly limited and the government should enforce a series of laws to prevent our societies from violence.
llm: The ownership of guns has been a topic of heated debate in recent years, with some arguing that it is a fundamental right, while others believe that it should be limited. From my perspective, the latter argument holds more weight. A gun is definitely not a kind of normal good in our society, and as such, it should be subject to strict controls, just like in most countries around the world.The statistics are alarming. The rise in accident rates, violent crime rates, and suicide rates are all directly linked to the availability of guns. When guns are easily accessible, the likelihood of accidents, crimes, and suicides increases exponentially. In the United States alone, there are over 39,000 gun-related deaths each year, with many more injuries and near-misses. These numbers are staggering and unacceptable.Furthermore, the concept of self-defense, often cited as a reason for owning guns, is a flawed argument. In reality, the likelihood of using a gun for self-defense is extremely low, while the likelihood of it being used in a crime or accident is much higher. Moreover, studies have shown that countries with strict gun control laws have significantly lower rates of gun-related violence.In light of these facts, it is sensible to enforce strict gun control measures. This would include background checks, waiting periods, and limits on the types of guns that can be owned. It would also involve education and awareness campaigns to highlight the dangers of gun ownership. By limiting the ownership of guns, we can reduce the number of accidents, crimes, and suicides, and create a safer society for everyone.In conclusion, the ownership of guns should be strictly limited. The evidence is clear: the easier it is to get a gun, the more likely it is to be used in a harmful way. By enforcing strict gun control measures, we can prevent unnecessary deaths and injuries, and create a more peaceful society.

question: Popular events like the football World Cup and other international sporting occasions are essential in easing international tensions and releasing patriotic emotions in a safe way. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: International sporting events are a good change to create a multi-nation community of fans having the same passion. It will help people around the world understand each other more. Since, international sporting occasions are essential in easing international tensions and releasing patriotic emotions in a safe way.An international sporting event is normal held in a country with huge interest from fans all over the world. For the time of occasions, people regardless of nationality, origin and religion will live together. People can understand more about a country, it is useful to ease tensions between nations. For example in FIFA World Cup 2010, the relation between North Korea and South Korea is dangerous for the warship sinking. The world suspected North Korea of the aggressive action. However, due to this event North Korea showed a friendship and enthuasism. It is rare times when people can learn about this country. It really help to alleviate the tension.Besides easing tensions, an international sporting event also helps fans release patriotic emotions in a safe way. When they garther together to encourage their team, they will show their patriotic emotions. Regardless of the competition between teams, their emotions are always released in a safe way due to the sole passion of the sport. Moreover, all fans know that a sport event will attract the attention of whole the world and a lot of public media. They will try to create a beautiful image about their land and people. In Olympic Beijing 2008, Chinese tried thier best to bring the world a spectacular image about their country. First of all, foreigners came here always received the support of friendly volunteers who were young students. They were welcomed by each Chinese hospitality, beauty in each cities. Everythings is created by patriotic emotions of Chinese who wanted to bring a beautiful China to the world.In conclusion, International sporting events will draw the international concern. It will make the world more peaceful by easing internation tensions and releasing patriotic emotions in a safe way.
llm: The statement that popular events like the football World Cup and other international sporting occasions are essential in easing international tensions and releasing patriotic emotions in a safe way, is a notion that warrants careful consideration. While there are valid arguments to support this opinion, I partially agree with this viewpoint.On one hand, international sporting events like the World Cup do bring nations together, promoting camaraderie and unity among participants and spectators alike. The shared passion for sports can transcend national boundaries, creating a platform for people to engage in a collective experience. The excitement and euphoria generated by these events can momentarily shift focus away from conflicts and tensions, fostering an atmosphere of peace and mutual respect.Moreover, international sporting events provide an outlet for fans to express patriotic emotions in a safe and controlled environment. As Yang notes, besides easing tensions, an international sporting event also helps fans release patriotic emotions in a safe way. The sense of national pride and belonging that comes with cheering for one's country can be a powerful unifying force, allowing individuals to channel their emotions constructively.However, it is essential to acknowledge that the impact of international sporting events on easing tensions is limited. Deep-seated conflicts and tensions cannot be resolved solely through sports. In some instances, these events can even exacerbate existing tensions, particularly if they are imbued with nationalistic fervor or if the outcome is perceived as a reflection of national superiority.In conclusion, while international sporting events like the World Cup do play a role in easing international tensions and providing a safe outlet for patriotic emotions, their impact is not universal and should not be overstated. Nevertheless, these events remain an essential part of our shared human experience, offering a unique opportunity for nations to come together and celebrate their differences.

question: Some people believe that the range of technology available to individuals today is increasing the gap between rich people and poor people, while others say that technology has the opposite effect. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
human: Technology, in the past two hundred years, has taken a dramatic progress in many fields of our society, such as telecommunications, manufacturing and buildings, etc. Certainly, technologies have also contributed to the great change of our daily lives. However, today some people consider that the range of technology regarding of public has a negative effect on increasing the gap between rich and poor. Personally, I find it hard for me to agree with this opinion by the following reasons.In the first instance, the progress of material technology leads to the sharp fall of price of a great number of products. About ten years ago, mobile phones ware very expensive for most members of my country, only a few of rich individuals have enough money to buy one. Today, mobile phones become a common one of household items, which due to the cheaper materials and better producing technologies. Thus, most members of our society can benefit from the consequences of technical advancements, especially the poor people.Secondly, technical developments improve productivity, which help people to escape from daily chores, and invest more time and energy in studying and living a more meaningful life. With the development of Internet, we can enjoy the pleasure and conveniences which it brings about for us every day. In the past time, we had to spend a lot of time searching information and waiting for letters of our friends who lived far away from us. Nowadays, we can talk with our friends online, no matter where we are and how far between us. In addition, the Internet gives everyone access to the same information, this therefore leads to greater equality between individuals.Undoubtedly, everything has two sides and technology is not an exception. To some extent, the gap between rich people and poor is widen by technology, because only the rich people have ability to afford the expensive high-tech products, and these products can help them to earn more in return. Nevertheless, I think it is a limp opposition to the remarkable advantages of technology, and technology is not the root cause of the gap.In conclusion, the good technology bringing to us is undeniable. Under proper use of technology, the human being can be benefit a lot and perpetually from the advancement of it.
llm: The rapid advancement of technology has sparked a heated debate about its impact on the socioeconomic divide between the rich and the poor. While some people believe that technology is exacerbating the gap between the two, others argue that it has the opposite effect. In this essay, I will discuss both views and provide my opinion on the matter.On one hand, some people consider that the range of technology available to the public has a negative effect on increasing the gap between the rich and the poor. They argue that the benefits of technology are mostly accessible to those who are already wealthy, thereby widening the gap between them and those who are less fortunate. However, I find it hard to agree with this opinion for several reasons.Firstly, the progress of material technology has led to the sharp fall of prices of a great number of products. For instance, smartphones and computers, which were once luxury items, are now affordable to people across various income levels. This democratization of technology has enabled people from all walks of life to access information, connect with others, and explore opportunities that were previously unavailable to them.Secondly, technical developments have improved productivity, which helps people to escape from daily chores and invest more time and energy in living a more meaningful life. Automation, for example, has freed people from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on creative pursuits and entrepreneurial ventures. This, in turn, has enabled people to improve their socioeconomic status and bridge the gap between the rich and the poor.In conclusion, while there are valid arguments on both sides, I firmly believe that technology has the opposite effect of increasing the gap between the rich and the poor. By making products more affordable and improving productivity, technology has empowered people to take control of their lives and create opportunities for themselves. As technology continues to evolve, it is essential that we ensure that its benefits are accessible to everyone, regardless of their socioeconomic background.

question: Governments spent a lot of money for traveling outer space. Do you think the investment is reasonable? Give your own opinion and reasons to support you claim
human: For many centuries, outer space has been one of the most favourable realms of study. Space expeditions have been launched and many have been successful. However, a lot of people still consider space exploration as an act of wasting money, to illustrate, astronauts only brought useless rocks back to planet earth despite the large sum of money spent on their equipment. On the other hand, there are some reasons for human beings to travel to outer space.Firstly, many facts about solar system can be discovered. For instance, a picture of planet earth proved that the earth is round, not flat. Another example is that it is the earth which goes around the sun, not vice versa. If it was not for the space exploration, we would never know these facts.Secondly, people can know more about the planet earth itself. By observing planet earth from outer space, people can find out ample things for example about the atmosphere of the planet earth. With this knowledge, people can work on something to prevent earth hazards such as global warming.Finally, a great deal of sophisticated technology can be invented. As astronauts need to travel to outer space which does not have any oxygen to breathe in, scientists are compelled to do research on the oxygen tanks.
