human: There is a hotly debated issue over whether universities should spend money on improving facilities is more than hiring famous teachers, and this topic can be approached from several different angles due to its complexity. Some people tend to prefer that schools should invest in renewing facilities, while other seem to believe that famous teachers is more conducive to students. After deeply pondering over this issue, I develop my own perspective as well. I favor the former; that is, I prefer to spend money on improving facilities. The first and foremost reason lies in an inevitable fact that the more advanced facilities we have, the more chances we can increase our knowledge. For example, library is a good place for students to study or research. They can concentrate on the subjects with a tranquil ambience; also, there are a lot of references for students to utilize. With this convenient and versatile facility, students can improve their learning condition. Therefore, we can commence to agree that certain facilities are beneficial to students. Moreover, another equally crucial aspect is that students are not always staying in classrooms. They have numerous activities in school. Consider a circumstance in which a student who is a member of jazz ensemble in their school. He must need a better auditorium for him to have an extraordinary performance. With this distinguished performance, the student would acquire an unforgettable and valuable experience burring deeply in his mind. Hence, from this case, we are capable of stating that students would prefer school to spending on improving facilities.Admittedly, on the other hand, there might be some people proclaiming that schools should spend money on hiring prestigious teachers because they can impart their students well. However, according to my limited understanding, I just doubt the credibility of that saying owing to its imprudence. A student is good or not do not depend on whether he has a good teacher but is decided by his effort on study. It is useless to hire a super famous teacher to teach those who behaviors as sluggards. Based on the reasons demonstrate above, I believe that improving facilities is the best way for school because the advantages of this are relatively greater than that of the other. In other words, students can procure more advantages from better facilities. It is not to say, of course, that other points of view are completely without merit. Still, I an firmly convinced that the reasons I have proposed in favor of my sentiment are much more tenable and cogent.
llm: The age-old debate about how universities should allocate their resources has sparked intense discussion among educators and students alike. While some people tend to prefer that schools should invest in hiring famous teachers, others seem to believe that improving facilities is the way to go. After careful consideration of both sides, I firmly believe that universities spend their money more effectively by improving facilities, rather than hiring famous teachers.On the one hand, proponents of hiring famous teachers argue that they can bring prestige and recognition to the university, attracting more students and enhancing the institution's reputation. Famous teachers can also provide students with valuable connections and networking opportunities. However, I would counter that these benefits are largely intangible and short-term. Moreover, the cost of hiring and retaining famous teachers can be prohibitively expensive, diverting resources away from other essential areas of university life.On the other hand, investing in improving facilities offers a multitude of benefits that far outweigh the advantages of hiring famous teachers. State-of-the-art laboratories, libraries, and recreational facilities can provide students with hands-on learning experiences, enhance their research capabilities, and promote a healthy work-life balance. Moreover, modern facilities can also contribute to a safer and more comfortable learning environment, which is essential for students' overall well-being and academic success. Furthermore, improved facilities can also benefit the university in the long run, as they can attract more students and faculty, and enhance the institution's reputation in a more sustainable way.In conclusion, while hiring famous teachers may have some benefits, I firmly believe that improving facilities is the best way for universities to spend their money. The advantages of this approach, including enhanced learning experiences, improved research capabilities, and a better quality of life, far outweigh the benefits of hiring famous teachers. By prioritizing facility improvement, universities can create a more supportive and conducive learning environment that benefits students, faculty, and the institution as a whole.

question: Do you agree or dis agree with the following statement? High schools should allow students to study the courses that students want to study. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: Some people state that high schools should allow students to study what they want to. They believe this motivates students to study. I think, however, students should study a broad range of subjects from literature to mathematics. I believe that tertiary education should make students prepare for specialization at university. In addition, it should be to some extent paternalistic to prevent students from avoiding hurdles.To begin with, students have to find one or more fields of study in which they are really interested. They should not decide their future major without trying a broad range of subjects, otherwise they might miss valuable encounter with the subject. For instance, a would-be mathematician student may be strongly intrigued by philosophy and make a success in the field.Next, students should obtain knowledge from a variety of academic fields. General education plays a significant role in specialized education. Science today, for example, is said to be more and more specialized, but in order to solve a problem scientists have to combine knowledge from chemistry to physics. In addition, although textbooks used in higher education are labelled particular subjects, in fact they require basic understanding of other subjects. For instance, you sometimes need knowledge about physics to read a text on chemistry. Therefore, high school students should learn broadly and prepare future learning at university.Last but not least, students have tendency to shun difficulties. They might avoid tough courses, but instead attend mainly Mickey Mouse courses and enjoy themselves too much. This might result in limited choices in the future. Therefore, schools should be responsible for their future and protect them.In summary, students should find interesting subjects and acquire general knowledge to prepare higher education at tertiary education. Besides, high school must be responsible for their future with well-planned curriculum.
llm: High schools play a crucial role in shaping the educational and professional trajectory of students. A contentious issue that has garnered significant attention in recent years is whether high schools should allow students to study the courses of their choice. In my opinion, high schools should indeed grant students the autonomy to select their desired courses, albeit with some caveats.On one hand, it is essential for students to find one or more fields of study that genuinely captivate their interests. When students are passionate about a particular subject, they tend to excel in it and develop a deeper understanding of the material. By allowing students to pursue their desired courses, high schools can foster a love for learning, increase student motivation, and ultimately, lead to better academic outcomes. For instance, a student who is enthusiastic about mathematics may choose to take advanced courses in calculus, statistics, and computer science, laying a strong foundation for a future career in data science or engineering.On the other hand, it is equally important for students to explore a broad range of subjects before deciding on their future major. High schools should ensure that students are exposed to various disciplines, enabling them to discover their strengths and weaknesses. This exploratory phase is vital in preventing students from prematurely specializing in a field that may not align with their aptitudes or interests. By providing students with a well-rounded education, high schools can help them make informed decisions about their academic and professional pursuits.However, it is also crucial to acknowledge that tertiary education is designed to prepare students for specialization at the university level. High schools should, therefore, strike a balance between allowing students to pursue their interests and providing them with a comprehensive education that prepares them for the rigors of specialized study. By doing so, high schools can equip students with the necessary skills, knowledge, and adaptability to succeed in their chosen fields, while also nurturing their passions and interests.In conclusion, high schools should indeed allow students to study the courses they desire, but with a nuanced approach that balances student autonomy with the need for a well-rounded education and preparation for specialization. By adopting this approach, high schools can empower students to make informed decisions about their academic and professional futures, ultimately leading to greater success and fulfillment.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Games are as important for adults as they are for children. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: As people grow up, the arguments about the importance of games arise. Some people think that, adults need playing games as children do. However, in my opinion, games are no longer too important for them for several reasons.The first reason is that games become unnecessary for people when their careers begin. Someone may argue that games help adults relax and become more balanced in life. But, more often, the pressure of work and family commitment force them to abandon their lifelong hobbies, and as a result, they cannot spend enough time and effort to their favorite games as they did in 15 or 20 years ago. For example, in my country, except for a minor part of professional athletes, the majority of people stop playing games seriously as soon as they find a decent job. They often feel that such games become more troublesome than enjoyable for their daily lives.Another reason should be mentioned is that adults often do not pursue games as a competitive activity, while children are always keen on competition and winning. For youngsters, maintaining their desire to win often develops many outstanding characteristics whether they participate sport events or not. For example, my younger sister likes fencing, and thanks to her desire to win, she never gives up when facing a difficult situation, or even becoming hurt. On the other hand, adults often consider such behaviors as childish and drop them immediately. In fact, a competitive person usually finds it difficult to cooperate with friends and colleagues. Because of that, they no longer play games for any moderate achievements, and gradually lose their interest in such activities.To sum up, I think adults do need to play games, but their styles are often distinct from children's, which are often less competitive and more enjoyable. Along with the high requirement for family and work, games are just some leisure activities for adults, not something necessary as they are meant to be for children.
llm: The notion that games are as important for adults as they are for children has garnered significant attention in recent years. While some people think that adults need playing games as children do, I strongly disagree with this statement. In my opinion, games are no longer too important for adults for several reasons.First and foremost, the pressure of work and family commitments forces adults to abandon their lifelong hobbies, including playing games. As people grow older, their priorities shift, and responsibilities such as career advancement, family, and financial stability take precedence over leisure activities. Adults often have to juggle multiple roles, leaving little time or energy for gaming. Furthermore, the demands of modern life can be overwhelming, making it difficult for adults to find the mental and emotional space to engage in gaming activities.Another reason why games are less important for adults is that they serve different purposes. For children, games are essential for cognitive development, socialization, and emotional growth. They provide a platform for kids to learn, explore, and express themselves. In contrast, adults have already developed these skills, and their needs are different. While some adults may enjoy gaming as a form of relaxation or socialization, it is no longer a crucial aspect of their development.Additionally, the consequences of excessive gaming can be more severe for adults than for children. Adults who spend too much time playing games may neglect their work, family, and health responsibilities, leading to negative outcomes such as job loss, relationship problems, and decreased physical and mental well-being.In conclusion, while some people may argue that games are equally important for adults and children, I firmly believe that this is not the case. The pressures of adult life, the different purposes of gaming, and the potential consequences of excessive gaming all support the notion that games are no longer as important for adults as they are for children.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Modern technology is creating a single world culture. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: There are many different opinions regarding world culture. Some people think that all the countries in the world cannot have a single culture. However, in my view, a single modern culture is being created by modern technology for the following reasons.Firstly, most of the countries have the same educational system based on technology. Teachers give topics to the students who should research on the internet to find data, and then students should type their research by using computer and even give a presentation by using PowerPoint. For example, students who are studying in Iran use the same software, Microsoft, to type their homework or have presentation compared to Canadian students.Secondly, new technology has created some similar jobs all around the world. Computer technology is a growing job in most of the countries, and students are being encouraged to study in this field. For example, many immigrants in Canada who have the degree in computer technology fields can easily go to Canadian universities and find jobs with good salaries. This example shows that jobs that are related to technology are in demand in most of the countries.Some people might argue that there are some cultures such as making foods which are unicq in each culture, and technology cannot affect them. This point has some merits on the surface; however, many countries such as Canada, the USA, and British have many restaurants which serve many foods form different countries and cultures. In fact, cooks can find many new food recipes easily on the Internet. For example, two days ago, I went to a Canadian restaurant, and I ate noodle, sushi, which are Chinese foods, and Greek salad.To sum up, new technology has affected cultures of the world, and we can see many similarities in many cultures. In fact, new technology has influences on educational system, jobs and foods in the world.
llm: The advent of modern technology has revolutionized the way people communicate, interact, and live their lives. The statement "Modern technology is creating a single world culture" is a topic of debate among scholars and experts. In my opinion, I agree with this statement, and here's why.New technology has indeed affected cultures of the world, bringing them closer together and creating a sense of homogenization. We can see many similarities in cultures that were previously distinct and unique. For instance, students who are studying in Iran use the same software, Microsoft, to type their homework or give a presentation compared to Canadian students. This is not an isolated example, as people from different cultures are using the same social media platforms, such as Facebook and Instagram, to connect with each other and share their experiences.A single modern culture is being created by modern technology for several reasons. Firstly, the internet has made it possible for people to access information and ideas from all over the world, creating a shared knowledge base that transcends geographical boundaries. Secondly, social media has enabled people to connect with each other and form global communities that are not limited by cultural or national identities. Finally, modern technology has created a global market place where people can buy and sell goods and services, creating a shared consumer culture.For example, the rise of e-commerce platforms such as Amazon and Alibaba has created a global market place where people can buy goods and services from all over the world. Similarly, the spread of fast food chains such as McDonald's and KFC has created a global food culture that is recognized and consumed by people from different cultures.In conclusion, modern technology is indeed creating a single world culture. The similarities in cultures that were previously distinct and unique are a testament to this fact. As technology continues to advance and spread, we can expect to see even more similarities in cultures and a further homogenization of the world culture.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: Nowadays it is much easier to achieve success with the help from one's family than what is like before
human: There are many factors that contribute to one's success. However, which factor is the most influential one is open to debate. Some people believe that nowadays the assitance from family is quite a essential factor in one's success. It seems that one can achieve success more easily with the help from his or her family. I agree with this statement. In my opinion, family plays a more important role in helping one to pursuit success. There are a couple of reasons.First of all, more and more people have the opportunity to receive education from university. Since our parents receive better education than our grandparents did, they can provide more advices and helps in our career. In the past, seldom people have the chance to attend a collage. For example, my grandparents did not get a education even in high school, so when my father had difficulty in solving a problem in his childhood, he had to go to his teacher for help. Things have changed a lot. I grow up in a better condition than my father did. Whenever I have problems, I can always ask my parents for help. They can solve the problem quickly because they have learned quite a lot. What is more, family members can help us in many other aspects. For example, when I did not know what major to choose when I attend university, my father told a lot about different majors. He shared his own experience with me, which helped me quite a lot. Parents are quite experienced than their child, they can guide them toward the right direction. Besides, parents can told their children as many as they can. What they want is help their child to make a progress.In a word, our parents and other family members can help us a lot in our life. I believe that with the help of our family, we can achieve success quite easily.
llm: The idea that family support is crucial in achieving success has gained significant attention in recent years. Some people believe that nowadays, the assistance from family is quite an essential factor in one's success. In my opinion, I strongly agree with this statement, as family plays a more important role in helping one to pursue success. There are a couple of reasons that justify this stance.Firstly, the financial support provided by family has become a vital aspect in pursuing one's goals. With the rising costs of education, career development, and starting a business, it has become increasingly difficult for individuals to rely solely on their own resources. Family support can provide the necessary financial backing, enabling individuals to take risks and invest in their future. For instance, many successful entrepreneurs have attributed their success to the initial financial support they received from their family, which allowed them to launch their businesses and navigate the initial challenges.Secondly, emotional support from family can also play a significant role in achieving success. The encouragement, guidance, and motivation provided by family members can help individuals stay focused and driven, even in the face of adversity. Having a supportive family can also provide a sense of security and stability, allowing individuals to take calculated risks and pursue their passions without fear of failure. This emotional support can be particularly crucial during times of uncertainty or self-doubt, helping individuals to stay committed to their goals and overcome obstacles.In conclusion, I firmly believe that family support is a crucial factor in achieving success in today's world. The financial and emotional backing provided by family can make all the difference in helping individuals pursue their goals and overcome challenges. As such, I strongly agree that nowadays, it is much easier to achieve success with the help from one's family than it was before.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Reading fiction (such as novels and short stories) is more enjoyable than watching movies. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
human: There are many different opinions regarding hobbies. Some people would rather watch TV. However, in my view, reading fiction is more enjoyable than watching movies for the following reasons.Firstly, fiction books pay more attention to details. In fact, we can know characters, places, and times of a novel very well during reading it. Most of the novels describe not only main characters but also other people in the novels, where each scene is happening. For example, after I read animal farms which is a story of Russian revolution, I could understand the leaders and different segments of the Russian people. However, a movie just gives us a very small review of its stories and characters.Secondly, reading a novel is more convenient. Some novels have around 100 pages and readers cannot finish them in just one hour. Yet these people can continue to read their novels wherever they find free time such as in bus or trains. For example, I have started to read a novel since last week. I do not have enough time to read a novel in one day, so I usually read it when I am coming home from English class. In contrast, I cannot watch a complete movie because I can just sit in front of TV for 15 minutes and after that, I have to study.Some people might argue that people enjoy watching TV when they know they can learn many things such as learning a language by watching movies. This point has some merits on the surface; however, movies are not a good idea to learn a language for beginners since characters in movies speak very fast and unclear for language learners. For these learners it is better to start by reading some novels which are more comprehensible and enjoyable.To sum up, reading fictions is more pleasant because these books have more depth, are much easier to use, and more useful for language learners.
llm: The age-old debate between reading fiction and watching movies has sparked intense discussions among book lovers and film enthusiasts alike. While some argue that the thrill of the big screen cannot be replicated, I firmly believe that reading fiction is more enjoyable than watching movies. Two primary reasons that substantiate my stance are the attention to detail in fiction books and the convenience of reading a novel.Firstly, fiction books pay more attention to details, allowing readers to immerse themselves in the narrative more thoroughly. Novels and short stories provide an in-depth exploration of characters' thoughts, emotions, and backstories, which are often glossed over in movie adaptations. For instance, J.R.R. Tolkien's "The Lord of the Rings" trilogy is renowned for its intricate world-building and character development, making it a more engaging read than the film versions. The level of detail in fiction books enables readers to form a deeper connection with the story, fostering a more enjoyable reading experience.Secondly, reading a novel is more convenient than watching a movie. Many novels, such as novellas, have around 100 pages, making them easy to finish in a few sittings. In contrast, movies typically require a significant time commitment, often lasting over an hour. For individuals with busy schedules, like students, finding a two-hour block to watch a movie can be challenging. In my own experience, I often find myself with only 15-minute windows of free time, which is insufficient for watching a complete movie. However, I can easily pick up a book and read a chapter or two during these brief intervals, making reading a more flexible and enjoyable option.In conclusion, the attention to detail in fiction books and the convenience of reading a novel make reading fiction a more enjoyable experience than watching movies. While films have their own unique charms, the immersive and flexible nature of reading fiction makes it the superior choice for those seeking a more engaging and convenient form of entertainment.

question: Several languages die every year. Many people feel this is a positive trend and that a world with fewer language promotes harmony and understanding between people. Analyze both sides of this argument and provide your opinion.
human: Today, English is commonly used language across the world. Its usage is increasing day by day. As a consequence, various local languages are becoming extinct. Some people argue that, this is a positive change and would help people to easily communicate. While there are others who disagree with this and are more concerned about dying local languages. In my opinion, I believe using single language through out the world is a positive change which is helping the world to become a better place to live.A world with fewer languages helps us interact with each other in a better way. Due to globalization, many people are traveling for professional trips. So, communicating in single language will reduce the problems of travelers in daily activities like ordering food in a restaurant or in going around places. Furthermore, students who migrate for better education would not have to go through lot of stress as they can easily make new friends and can be part of any discussions which is otherwise not possible in a world with multiple languages; this in turn makes it easy to adjust in new environment. Single language also reduces misunderstandings between people. Adding to that, exchange of knowledge in different sectors of research like electronics, medical, astronomy etc would become easier.On the other hand, few people are worried about the dying local languages. These languages are the basis for the origination and initial communication between different cultures. They represent local culture. As the usage of these languages decrease, culture also changes accordingly. Further, these languages are tightly coupled with history; all the olden day literature and scripts will be impossible to decipher if these languages are lost.To conclude, I believe change is inevitable and that usage of one language across the world is a positive one. We have to accept these changes for a world to be a better place. Communication in single language would improve the productivity of the world and brings everyone on to the same page.
llm: The decline of languages has sparked a debate on whether a world with fewer languages promotes harmony and understanding among people. While some argue that it's a positive trend, others strongly disagree. In this essay, we will analyze both sides of the argument and provide an opinion on the matter.On the one hand, some people argue that the decline of languages is a positive change that is helping the world become a better place to live. They believe that having a single language used throughout the world will simplify communication and reduce barriers between people. For instance, travelers will no longer struggle with daily activities such as ordering food in a restaurant or navigating unfamiliar places. With a single language, misunderstandings between people will decrease, and interactions will become more efficient. This, in turn, will promote harmony and understanding among people from different cultures and backgrounds.On the other hand, others argue that the decline of languages is a loss of cultural diversity and heritage. Languages are not just a means of communication; they are also a part of a community's identity and history. When a language disappears, a part of the community's culture and traditions is lost forever. Moreover, languages are not just a tool for communication; they also shape the way people think and perceive the world. A world with fewer languages may be more efficient, but it will also be less rich and diverse.In my opinion, while having a single language may simplify communication and reduce misunderstandings, it is not worth the cost of losing cultural diversity and heritage. Languages are an essential part of human identity and culture, and their loss is irreparable. Moreover, technology has made it easier for people to communicate across languages, reducing the need for a single language. Therefore, I believe that preserving linguistic diversity is essential for promoting harmony and understanding among people, rather than reducing the number of languages.

question: Elderly people think that the way they spent their life was simpler and better than today. Do you agree or disagree? Provide you reasons and real life example
human: Changes are inseparable parts of this world which normally humans are responsible for by manipulating the environment they live in. Sometimes these changes adversely affect our lives that make elderly people think they used to live in a better world than the modern world the younger generation are experiencing. I utterly disagree with this opinion due to technological and medical reasons.We live in an era that technology is developing in the speed of light, steering the world toward a much more convenient place. A clear-cut example that supports this idea is the invention of smart phones. The strong navigation system installed on the phones has been rescued lives of many who left alone in remote areas like forests or deserts. Moreover, some people criticize social networks as tools that have ruined true relationships and friendships by reducing face-to-face communication. In my opinion though, social networks such as Facebook could foster the ties between friends and family members who are obligatorily far away from each other by keeping them in touch, the thing that was impossible less than 20 years ago. The phenomenal progress in medical science in the last decade was a huge achievement for human being to make the world a healthier and, thus, a happier place to live in. Today, even some disabled people with serious vertebral injuries can start doing physical activities like walking again thanks to the continuingly efforts of biomechanical engineers and neurologists. The advancement in drug delivery systems is another example that could save lives. To be specific, scientists could invent ways to lead drugs directly to the damaged organs of the body, which is a miraculous breakthrough. In general, the increase in the average age of human from 50 to around 75 years through last decades is a strong evidence to show how successful human was in medicine.In conclusion, even though the people from older generation may claim they had better life as there were stronger bonds between family members and friends, I think they are wrong, since they judge the contemporary age through a personal prejudice. In light of the above-mentioned facts, one can easily conclude that in the current world living standards stand in a much higher level and people are in better conditions socially and physically.
llm: The notion that elderly people believe their past experiences were simpler and better than the present day is a common sentiment shared by many. However, I disagree with this assertion. While it is true that the past had its charm and simplicity, the rapid advancements in technology and medical science have significantly improved our lives.We live in an era where technology is developing at an unprecedented rate, steering the world towards a more convenient place. With the rise of the internet, smartphones, and social media, people can now access information, connect with others, and perform various tasks with ease. For instance, online shopping has revolutionized the way we shop, allowing people to purchase goods and services from the comfort of their own homes. This convenience was unimaginable in the past, where people had to physically visit stores to make purchases.Moreover, the phenomenal progress in medical science over the last decade has been a huge achievement for humanity. Advances in medical research and technology have led to the development of new treatments, medications, and vaccines, making the world a healthier and, thus, a happier place to live in. For example, the development of vaccines against diseases such as COVID-19, HPV, and influenza has saved countless lives and improved the quality of life for many. In contrast, in the past, people had limited access to healthcare, and many diseases were incurable.While it is natural for elderly people to nostalgically reminisce about their past experiences, I believe that the advancements in technology and medical science have greatly improved our lives. These developments have not only increased our convenience and accessibility but also significantly improved our health and well-being. Therefore, I disagree with the notion that the past was simpler and better than the present day.

question: Some people say that all secondary school and higher school students should be taught how to manage money as its an important life skill. Do you agree or disagree with this argument?
human: There is no doubt that money has become key ingredient in various walks of our life than before. Teaching financial management to juvenile students is always a topic of debate. Some people feel that teaching money management skill to teenage students will help them realise the importance of money, while few feel that exposing children to money math at this age may turn fatal. In my view, I agree to that fact that higher school students should be made aware of the money management.The reason why I think teenage students need to understand the money management basics is, primarily when secondary school students attain the age of undergoing graduation, students ought to stay in hostels or with friends and away from family, during such situations when money management is taught at an early age students will have increased sense of responsibility and confidence. For example, while I was a kid my father used to maintain expense log for the month, I was asked to do the same for my keep track of my pocket money expenses, during my future course of life this became a practice and helped me in planning my expenses.In addition, if financial management is taught at an early age, students will have better sense of understanding of their family financial background and status, students coming up with unrealistic whims and fancies are minimized. For example, buying a gaming console may not be a big deal for a student from an affluent financial background. However, for a student coming from middle class buying a gaming console may not be the need of the hour. Hence, having exposed to money management at a high school level will help them in prioritizing the financial commitments efficiently.In conclusion, I think students understanding the money management techniques will have more positive effects than negative impact. However, the teaching should be in a constructive manner and students should not feel that they are being bullied for every expense.
llm: The idea of teaching financial management to secondary and higher school students has sparked intense debate among educators, policymakers, and parents. Some individuals strongly believe that imparting money management skills to juveniles may have unintended consequences, while others, like myself, firmly agree that higher school students should be equipped with this essential life skill.On one hand, there are valid concerns that introducing financial management to young minds may lead to an excessive focus on material wealth, potentially harming their innocence and creativity. Some argue that exposure to complex financial concepts at a tender age may lead to undue stress, causing students to prioritize wealth accumulation over other vital aspects of their development.On the other hand, I firmly believe that teaching financial management to higher school students is crucial for their future success. As they transition into adulthood, they will inevitably encounter financial decisions that will significantly impact their lives. By learning how to manage money effectively, students will develop a critical life skill that will benefit them in numerous ways. They will be better equipped to make informed decisions about budgeting, saving, and investing, ultimately leading to greater financial stability and security.Moreover, incorporating financial education into school curricula can also promote responsible spending habits, debt management, and entrepreneurship. By teaching students how to navigate the complexities of personal finance, we can empower them to make wise choices and avoid common financial pitfalls.In conclusion, while concerns about introducing financial management to young students are valid, I strongly agree that higher school students should be taught this essential life skill. By doing so, we can equip them with the knowledge and expertise necessary to thrive in an increasingly complex financial world, ultimately leading to greater financial stability, security, and success.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Smoking should not be permitted in restaurants, and state laws that prohibit it should be upheld.
human: Generally speaking, smoking is never been good for human's body. There are so many researches done to prove that a cigar contains harmful ingredients for human's body. Although many smokers claim that they need to smoke in order to work more effectively or to think more creatively, those reasons never proves that smoking has any benefits for human's body. In my opinion, smoking should not be permitted, especially in public places like restaurants because it will make the non-smokers breathe uncomfortably.First of all, restaurants are places where people come and pay some money to enjoy their meals. Smoking in restaurants will absolutely disturb other people in enjoying their meals. They will not be able to enjoy their meals while breathing in smoke around them. Secondly, restaurants are places that people usually come with their families. This means, there will be children, grandparents, as well as pregnant women inside the restaurants. Smoking in restaurants can give a bad example to the children. Children have a high potential to imitate what adults do because they have really high curiosity towards something. Smoking in restaurants also can affect the elders' health, especially if they have problems with their hearts and lungs. The most dangerous people that would be affected by smoke are the pregnant women because they will breathe in the contaminated air and it will disrupt the growth of the babies.Last but not least, passive smokers will have a lot of health risks. When they are around the active smokers, they will inhale hazardous smoke. Stroke, heart disorders, hearing loss, and cancers are some diseases that can attack passive smokers. Personally speaking, it is unfair for passive smokers because they do not smoke but they have same health risks as the active one.In conclusion, smoking should not be permitted in restaurants because there will be a lot of people get disadvantaged. State laws that prohibit it should be upheld so the restaurant' management can make a clear rule in their restaurants because everyone has a right to enjoy their meals.
llm: I strongly agree with the statement that smoking should not be permitted in restaurants, and state laws that prohibit it should be upheld. There are several compelling reasons that support this stance.First and foremost, smoking in restaurants can be a significant nuisance to non-smokers. When smokers light up in an enclosed space, the smoke can spread quickly, making it difficult for others to breathe comfortably. This can be especially problematic for people with pre-existing respiratory conditions, such as asthma. Restaurants are places where people come to enjoy their meals, and the presence of cigarette smoke can be a major distraction from the dining experience.Moreover, smoking in restaurants can set a bad example for vulnerable populations, such as children, grandparents, and pregnant women. Children, in particular, are impressionable and may view smoking as a normal and acceptable behavior if they see adults smoking in public places. Grandparents may be exposed to second-hand smoke, which can exacerbate age-related health issues, while pregnant women may be putting their unborn babies at risk of health complications.Another critical consideration is the impact of second-hand smoke on passive smokers. Research has shown that passive smokers are exposed to the same health risks as active smokers, including lung cancer, heart disease, and other respiratory problems. It is unfair to subject non-smokers to these risks, especially when they have not chosen to smoke themselves.In conclusion, smoking should not be permitted in restaurants, and state laws that prohibit it should be upheld. The negative impacts of second-hand smoke on non-smokers, vulnerable populations, and the overall dining experience make it essential to maintain smoke-free environments in restaurants. By upholding these laws, we can promote a healthier and more considerate environment for everyone.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Growing violence in films has affected youngsters in a negative way?
human: It's obvious that violent behavior is growing more in films in recent 20 years. This matter has been considered as a way to advertise a film. From my point of view, I believe that violence in movies has negative effects on youngsters mostly on their behaviors, emotions & study.In the first place, children behaviors are the most concerning matter which parents are always trying to do their best. Nowadays children are more involved in TV programs. Imagine an actor who is a child’s favorite is doing violent roles. In this case, the child would imitate the actor's behaviors in order to look like to him. Thus, unexpectedly the violent behavior has effected on child’s behaviors.Meanwhile, human beings are very sensitive, especially of youngsters. For instance, dying is always a disappointing happening. Furthermore, killing is worse. Therefore, if these scenes are in TV, they would probably have their negative effects on the viewer who could be a child.Finally, beside all above mentioned items, the study of youngsters shall always been controlled. For example, a child watches a frightening movie. On the other hand, he has to study for the exam. In this condition, because he is thinking about the movie or whatever has happened in it, it is obvious that he wouldn’t be able to concentrate on his study perfectly. Hence, the study of a youngster would affected terribly.In conclusion, I certainly can say that growing of violence in films have definitely negative effects on youngsters mostly on their study, emotions and behaviors. Therefore, I think this matter should be controlled by parents or somehow by directors.
llm: The Influence of Violent Films on Youngsters: A Negative ImpactIn recent years, the depiction of violence in films has increased exponentially, with many movies relying on intense action sequences and graphic content to captivate audiences. This trend has raised concerns among parents, educators, and mental health professionals, who argue that the growing violence in films has a negative impact on youngsters. From my perspective, I strongly agree with this statement, as the exposure to violent films can have detrimental effects on the behavior, emotions, and academic performance of young viewers.Over the past two decades, the film industry has witnessed a significant surge in violent content, with many movies incorporating gruesome and disturbing scenes to attract larger audiences. This shift in cinematic content has been exploited as a marketing strategy, with filmmakers using violence as a means to advertise their films and generate buzz. However, this approach has led to a desensitization of audiences, particularly youngsters, to the consequences of violence.The impact of violent films on youngsters is multifaceted. Firstly, exposure to violent content can lead to aggressive behavior, as children may imitate the actions they witness on screen. This can result in increased bullying, fighting, and other forms of antisocial behavior. Secondly, violent films can have a profound impact on the emotional well-being of youngsters, causing anxiety, fear, and stress. Finally, the constant exposure to violent content can distract youngsters from their academic pursuits, leading to decreased attention span, lower grades, and reduced interest in learning.In conclusion, the growing violence in films has indeed had a negative impact on youngsters. It is essential for parents, educators, and filmmakers to be aware of this issue and take steps to mitigate its effects. By promoting responsible filmmaking practices and encouraging critical thinking in young viewers, we can reduce the negative influence of violent films and foster a more positive and empathetic generation of youngsters.

question: Agree or disagree: In order to be well-informed, a person must get information from many different news sources.
human: Nowadays information plays an important role in our world. It has become a product, which can be sold, bought, or stolen. Some people say: "information is power". That's why it is so important to be well-informed. I consider the statement above to be right for several reasons.The first reason is that by using different sources of information we can guarantee its reliability. Some people may disinform you on purpose, that's why it is rather unwise to make conclusions before you are confident of the information. For example, Russian news announced that the war between Osetia and Georgia had been initiated by Georgia, however, european news announced that it was initiated by Russia. After a while the situation became clear, but before that a lot of people had already condemned the actions of Russia.Secondly, it is very important to know facts about some events or problem, not only estimations, because it can help you to make your own conclusion or estimate. Sometimes it can be really difficult to find out the facts, especially in the internet, that's why you have to look through different sources before you manage to find some reliable facts. It is possible to make a wrong decision because you have just used someone's personal opinion as a source of information, but it was actually wrong. For example, several years ago in Moscow salt became two times more expensive only in one week, because people thought that soon there would be no salt in the shops. The gossip-based information dramatically influenced the prices and only after official announcement the "salt-panic" was over. To conclude, I want to say that it is very important to be confident of the information, which you use, especially when your conclusion or decision may have a great influence.
llm: In today's information age, staying well-informed is crucial for making informed decisions and being an active participant in society. The notion that "information is power" holds significant weight, emphasizing the importance of being knowledgeable about current events and issues. In this context, I strongly agree that to be well-informed, a person must get information from many different news sources.One of the primary reasons for seeking information from diverse sources is to ensure the reliability of the information. When news is reported by a single source, there is a risk of bias or inaccuracy. By consulting multiple sources, individuals can verify the accuracy of the information and gain a more comprehensive understanding of the issue. This is particularly important when it comes to factual reporting, where knowing the facts about an event or problem is essential, rather than relying on estimations or assumptions.Furthermore, different news sources often provide unique perspectives and insights, allowing readers to gain a more nuanced understanding of the issue at hand. For instance, a news article in a local newspaper may provide a more detailed account of a local event, while a national news outlet may offer a broader perspective on the issue. By consulting multiple sources, individuals can gain a more complete picture of the situation, rather than relying on a single, potentially limited, viewpoint.In conclusion, being well-informed is crucial in today's society, and to achieve this, it is essential to seek information from many different news sources. By doing so, individuals can guarantee the reliability of the information, gain a more comprehensive understanding of the issue, and stay informed about current events and issues.

question: Some people argue that there is no point in persevering old buildings when land is so valuable in our cities. Others believe that old buildings are important part of our heritage and should be preserved. Discuss both these views and state your opinion.
human: The preservation of old buildings always is a large question for governments because conflict between the issues of housing for citizens and the protection of our culture. In my opinion, all of the old building which contribute to our sense of culture should be conserved.There are different reasons which persuade that people should not restore old buildings. As a result of the rapid urbanization process, in which rural people must go to urban centers to look for job opportunities, the question of the preservation of old buildings has become more pressing. Because of that need, governments can construct more accommodation instead of preserving old buildings. Besides that, the preservation is very expensive because all components of old buildings have historical values. Old buildings are an essential part of history. Tourist often decide to discover the culture of a country when they visit through those old buildings. Therefore, managers of cities can earn more money from the attraction provided by old buildings and that amount can be spent on their conservation. Furthermore, the preservation of old buildings is also a ways to conserve our culture and everyone can learn much from them. Old buildings should be used as the culture museums and provide accommodation with more convenient for people who live there. . Many cities have development strategies as a city contains both unique and modern beauty, and that preservation help to finish half of work.	Overall, both of those view have strong arguments: the need for housing or the expense of restoration contrast with our desire to conserve culture and attract tourism. So I think we should restore those building because old buildings process the most outstanding feature of areas which contain them.
llm: The debate surrounding the preservation of old buildings in urban areas has been a longstanding one. On one hand, some argue that these structures occupy valuable land that could be utilized for modern development, providing much-needed housing and infrastructure for a growing population. They contend that the cost of maintaining and restoring old buildings is often prohibitively expensive, and that resources would be better allocated towards creating new, more functional spaces.On the other hand, there are those who firmly believe that old buildings are an integral part of our cultural heritage, and that their preservation is essential for maintaining a sense of history and identity. These individuals argue that the cultural significance of these structures far outweighs their practical value, and that they provide a tangible link to our past.In my opinion, all old buildings that contribute to our sense of culture should be conserved. These structures are a window into our collective past, offering a glimpse into the lives of those who came before us. By preserving them, we can learn from our mistakes, appreciate our progress, and gain a deeper understanding of who we are as a society. Moreover, these buildings often serve as tourist attractions, generating revenue and promoting cultural exchange.Governments are often faced with the difficult task of balancing the needs of their citizens with the desire to protect our cultural heritage. However, I firmly believe that the preservation of old buildings is essential for maintaining a sense of national identity and community. While it is true that the cost of preservation can be high, I believe that the long-term benefits far outweigh the expenses. By preserving our cultural heritage, we can create a sense of continuity and shared history, which is essential for building strong, cohesive communities.

question: Nowadays, many young people say that mobile phones are the most important thing in their life. Do you think the popularity of mobile phones to young people is a good or bad development? Give relevant examples from your own experience.
human: Nowadays, many young people consider mobile phone as the most important thing in their lives as it keeps them constantly organized and it provides much convenience for them to reach out their families and friends. Despite all these positive aspects, I think that the popularity of mobile phones to the young generation is a bad development.First of all, many young owners of cellular phones are struggling at school because they are distracted most of the time with their phones. Games and applications installed in phones have occupied much of their time, leaving them lesser time for their studies and other school activities. Similarly, internet capable phones help influence the young ones to become more interested in chatting and social sites rather than doing school works. In my college days, I was once addicted to a certain game on my cellular phone. I have spent most of my time trying to reach a higher level to show-off to my friends. That goal has led me to my lost in interest on doing my homework and I ended up failing one subject in that semester.Secondly, juveniles who possess mobile phones have great tendencies to become materialistic. They would not only purchase a phone because of its functionality but also for its brand. Relatively, these do not come at a significant and inexpensive cost. Furthermore, most of these juveniles are students so they would need their parents to support them financially for what they want. An illustration of this unfortunate trend can be seen almost everywhere these days, wherein most teens at an early age own phones which are worth twice the salary of their parents. This clearly shows that the negative impacts brought about by mobile phones are harmful to a person’s education and character. Therefore, I highly discourage the young ones to be overly dependent on mobile phones.
llm: The widespread use of mobile phones among young people has become a ubiquitous phenomenon in today's society. Many young individuals consider their mobile phone as the most important thing in their lives, relying on it for various aspects of their daily life, from communication and information to entertainment and socialization. Despite all these positive aspects, I think that the popularity of mobile phones to the young generation is a bad development.Firstly, many young owners of cellular phones are struggling at school because they are distracted most of the time with their phones. For instance, I have noticed that many of my classmates are often caught texting or browsing through social media during lectures, which hinders their ability to focus on the lesson and absorb the information being taught. This distraction can lead to poor academic performance, which can have long-term consequences on their future prospects.Secondly, juveniles who possess mobile phones have great tendencies to become materialistic. The constant exposure to advertisements and social media platforms showcasing the latest gadgets and trendy products can create a sense of desire and dissatisfaction with their current possessions. I have seen many of my friends, who are barely teenagers, already flaunting their latest smartphones and bragging about their expensive accessories. This obsession with material possessions can lead to an unhealthy sense of self-worth and a distorted view of what is truly important in life.In conclusion, while mobile phones have undoubtedly made life easier and more convenient for young people, their popularity among this age group is a bad development. The distractions and materialistic tendencies they promote can have serious negative impacts on their academic and personal growth. It is essential for young people to maintain a balance between their mobile phone use and other aspects of their life to avoid these pitfalls.

question: Some people believe that there should be fixed punishments for each type of crime. Others, however,argue that the circumstances of an individual crime, and the motivation for committing it, should always be taken into account when deciding on the punishment.
human: Generally reason behind punishment is to reduce the crime from a nation and to build a fear in the mind of offenders. Some people think that it does not matter what is reason behind committing a crime therefore there should be fixed punishment for a specific crime. Alternatively I believe that it should taken into consideration the situation and conditions, that forces to a person to be a criminal.First of all if there will be a fixed punishment for each type of crime then it will lead to increase the crime because the punishment will be clear in the mind of professional criminals and they will not feel fear while committing a crime. Secondly, laws and rules are there for people therefore it is necessary to have a look behind crime for instance "a women steals feed for her child should be treated same as a women, who steals for her drug addiction". The person who committed crime first time and the professional criminals should not be imprisoned at same place.On the contrary, fixed punishment will reduce the time taken by judges to give their judgement and it will be effective economically for the Government. Everyone should be treated equally because sometimes we see that a poor person who do not have much money for hiring a good lawyer they get imprisoned even without committing a crime and when they come back to the society they become a professional criminal. Therefore fixed punishment will reduce the space between poor and rich people and everyone will understand the importance of each other.To conclude, Government should decide for punishment case by case basis. In doing so crime can be eliminated from a nation and it is a responsibility of every individual to be in the favor of truth and respect the laws of our constitution.
llm: The debate surrounding fixed punishments for crimes has garnered significant attention, with proponents on both sides presenting compelling arguments. While some believe that a one-size-fits-all approach to punishment is the most effective way to maintain law and order, others contend that the unique circumstances and motivations behind each crime must be considered.On one hand, implementing fixed punishments for each type of crime may seem like an efficient solution. It would undoubtedly reduce the time taken by judges to deliver judgments, as the sentence would be predetermined. This, in turn, would be economically beneficial for the government, as it would save time and resources. However, this approach has a significant flaw. Professional criminals, aware of the fixed punishment, would be more likely to commit crimes, as they would know exactly what to expect in terms of consequences. This could lead to an increase in crime rates, as individuals would be more willing to take risks knowing the exact punishment they would face.On the other hand, considering the circumstances and motivations behind each crime allows for a more nuanced approach to justice. While this may require more time and effort from judges, it ensures that each individual is held accountable for their actions in a way that is fair and proportionate to their crime. This approach also acknowledges that each crime is unique and that a one-size-fits-all solution may not always be the most effective way to address the underlying issues that led to the crime.In conclusion, while fixed punishments may seem like a straightforward solution, they have the potential to increase crime rates among professional criminals. A more balanced approach, taking into account the circumstances and motivations behind each crime, is necessary to ensure that justice is served in a fair and effective manner.

question: Many people think that cheap air travel should be encouraged because it gives ordinary people the freedom to travel further. However, others think that this leads to environmental problem, and so air travel should be more expensive in order to discourage people from having it. Discuss both sides and give your own opinion.
human: In recent years, many airlines offer to their customers more and more number of cheap flights. People have various different views about cheap air travel. Although there are good arguments in favour of this trend should be encouraged, I personally think that cheap flight can make many serious problem.It is undeniable that cheap air fares have broadened travel possibilities for many people, particularly for the lower income group. These days, millions of people can travel around the world for work or pleasure. They can develop their careers, broad their knowledge, and interact with many other people from varied cultural backgrounds. Moreover, travels also help to promote the tourist industry development, boost the economy and job markets of many countries.On the other hand, growing of cheap flights really have negative impact on environment. Apparently, more flights could mean bigger and busier airport that may be grown the air pollution for people who live and work close to it. However, the biggest concern is the effect on global warming. Burning plane fuel can releases carbon dioxid into environment that cause the Earth to heat up. In fact, while many efforts are being made to reduce CO2 emissions from cars and factories, nothing is being done to reins the airlines. In conclusion, I would argue that the drawbacks of cheap air fares outweigh the benefits. However, it does not mean that air travel should be more expensive. Instead, people should be aware of their responsibility to reduce the emissions caused by their lifestyle choices.
llm: The advent of cheap air travel has sparked a contentious debate about its impact on society and the environment. On one hand, proponents of affordable air travel argue that it has democratized travel, enabling ordinary people to explore distant destinations that were previously inaccessible. This is particularly true for the lower-income group, who can now enjoy the freedom to travel further, broadening their cultural and social horizons.However, critics of cheap air travel contend that the environmental costs far outweigh the benefits. The proliferation of flights has led to the construction of bigger and busier airports, resulting in increased air pollution that affects people living and working in close proximity. Moreover, the burning of plane fuel releases significant amounts of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere, contributing to global warming. This is a pressing concern, as climate change poses an existential threat to our planet.In my opinion, while cheap air travel has undoubtedly opened up new possibilities for many, the environmental consequences cannot be ignored. A more sustainable approach would be to make air travel more expensive, thereby discouraging unnecessary flights and encouraging alternative modes of transportation. This could also lead to investments in cleaner technologies and more efficient flight routes, mitigating the environmental impact of air travel.Ultimately, striking a balance between accessibility and sustainability is crucial. Governments and airlines must work together to find innovative solutions that minimize the environmental footprint of air travel while still making it accessible to a wide range of people. By doing so, we can ensure that the benefits of air travel are not outweighed by its ecological costs.

question: Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific examples to support your answer.Ê
human: There are undeniable advantages to both life in a big city and in a small town. The former offers more excitement and convenience while the latter offers a cleaner, quieter and often friendlier place to live. However, despite the advantages of small town life, I prefer to live in a big city for several reasons.On the one hand, I have always wanted to find a job in a big company which locates in a prosperous city area. To make it convenient, I will absolutely choose a place to live that is not too far from my workplace. What's more I can save plenty of money on transportation if I choose to live in the city.On the other hand, life in a big city will not be so dull as in a small town. You can enjoy modern life and have more access to the advanced facilities. For instance, you can visit museums to learn history, and go to a more equipped library to enjoy reading, or you can go to a sports center for exercising. But a small town may be less developed to satisfy all these kinds of needs.Furthermore living in big cities means more exposure to stimulation, like all kinds of information. If one can efficiently acquire the information, then, there might come along more opportunities for him to achieve his goals. For example, there are various advertisements here an there, whether on the leaflets or on the big screen showing things of all sorts in commercial zones. If one is seeking a job right in the city or planing somewhere to travel, or just wants to buy a product in a dependable store, he might refer to what he has seen or heard from the advertisements to make a relatively wise choice. There is also another obvious advantage of living in a big city considering the chance of receiving better education of our offspring. Schools in big cities may receive more funds from whether the local comities or the government, which may make them more equipped with advanced teaching facilities and attract more excellent teachers. Our children thus will have a better chance of pursuing high-quality education which is very important for their future development. In conclusion, if I want to live a more convenient life with more access to modern facilities as well as with more exposure to various opportunities, and have my children receive a better education, a big city is the place to live in.
llm: Some people prefer to live in a small town, while others prefer to live in a big city. As for me, despite the advantages of small town life, I prefer to live in a big city for several reasons.On the one hand, if I have always wanted to find a job, a place to live that is not too far from my workplace is a must. Big cities typically have more job opportunities and a wider range of industries to choose from, increasing the chances of finding employment. For instance, cities like New York and London are hubs for various sectors such as finance, technology, and healthcare, offering numerous job openings. Moreover, living in a big city often means that I can enjoy modern life and have more access to advanced facilities like public transportation, healthcare, and entertainment options.Living in big cities also means more exposure to stimulation, like all kinds of information. Cities offer a diverse range of cultural events, museums, and libraries, providing endless opportunities for learning and personal growth. For example, cities like Paris and Tokyo are renowned for their rich cultural heritage, with numerous museums, galleries, and historical landmarks that offer a wealth of knowledge and inspiration. Furthermore, the fast-paced and dynamic environment of big cities encourages innovation, creativity, and progress, allowing individuals to stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements.

question: Salary increases and promotions to new positions are not the only ways to reward employees for good work. What other rewards for good work can be effective in encouraging further good work? Use specific examples to support your response.
human: It is unquestionable that salary increases and promotions to new positions are very common way to reward employees for good work. Besides the methods, from my point of view, providing professional training can be effective in encouraging further good work. My arguments for this point are listed follows.Firstly, training time can provide employee interesting time outside working office to refresh their mind. Clearly, in company we always have to deal with so many stressful situations such as negotiating with difficult customer, complaining from boss, etc. Therefore, we can unleash uncomfortable in training classes by making new friends, joking in class, enjoying new knowledge.Secondly, employees fell that they are valuable if they are trained. In this case, the employees know that their company is investing on them for future development of their company. So obviously, they will think about develop long term career with their company. For another thing, employees will be very proud of themselves when they are provided training while others don't have this opportunity. Thirdly, providing training will make employees happy with their current job because it help them improve their professional business knowledge. Having professional training help employees gain more confidence in their business, so I believe that they will finish their jobs with excellent result. Of course, excellent working result will make them very happy as well as their boss.In conclusion, providing professional training as a reward for good work has many advantages. Training can help employees refresh their mind as well as make them happy, focus on work. Taking into account of all these factors, we may reach the conclusion that training can be effective in encouraging further good work.
llm: Salary increases and promotions to new positions are the most common methods used by organizations to reward employees for good work. However, from my point of view, these are not the only effective ways to encourage further good work. In fact, there are several other rewards that can be just as motivating, if not more so.One of the most effective ways to reward employees for good work is to provide them with opportunities for professional development. Providing professional training, for example, can be a great motivator for employees who are eager to improve their skills and advance in their careers. Not only does it show that the organization is invested in their growth and development, but it also gives them the tools and knowledge they need to take on new challenges and responsibilities. For instance, a company like Google provides its employees with various training programs and workshops to enhance their skills and knowledge, which motivates them to perform better and be more productive.Another effective way to reward employees for good work is to offer flexible work arrangements. With the rise of remote work, employees are no longer tied to traditional office hours and locations. By offering flexible work arrangements, such as telecommuting or flexible hours, organizations can demonstrate their trust and appreciation for their employees' hard work and dedication. This can lead to increased job satisfaction, reduced turnover rates, and improved work-life balance.Additionally, recognizing employees' achievements publicly can also be an effective way to reward them for good work. A simple "thank you" or acknowledgement of an employee's hard work and achievements can go a long way in motivating them to continue performing at a high level. For example, a company like Amazon has a recognition program called "Kudos" which allows employees to recognize and reward their peers for their hard work and contributions.In conclusion, while salary increases and promotions to new positions are common ways to reward employees for good work, they are not the only effective ways to encourage further good work. Providing professional training, offering flexible work arrangements, and recognizing employees' achievements publicly can be just as motivating, if not more so. By offering these alternative rewards, organizations can demonstrate their appreciation and investment in their employees' growth and development, leading to increased job satisfaction, productivity, and retention.

question: Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
human: Attending university's classes is one of activities that students have to do. However, class is not the only source of knowledge. Students also learn from other sources such as experience, libraries and other people. I think going to classes should be optional for students for the following reasons.Firstly, the reason why university students should not be required to attend class is sometimes the students in the university can learn better from other sources outside the class room. Student can also study by themselves in the library and focus on only the topic they do not understand. For example, I have a close friend who was in the same department with me in the university. She learned quickly and understood everything in class so fast. Thus, she rarely went to class but spent most time to understand confusing topic. Finally, she got very good grade when she was graduation.Secondly, students should not be required to attend classes because they can manage the time spending on classes to do other benefit things if they already understand topic in the class very well. In my experience, many times I did not attend biology class because my university does not require the students to attend classes. Also, I had already studied all biology topics before attending university. As a result, I spent the time of biology class to do my Chemistry research and got A+ for both biology and chemistry. In conclusion, I think the students should know what activities they should do at the time and have good management for their learning time. Also, they have to know how to deal with the effects from not attending classes. So that, attending classes in the university will not be required to the students anymore.
llm: The debate surrounding whether university students should be required to attend classes has sparked intense discussion. While some believe that mandatory attendance is essential for academic success, I firmly agree that attending classes should be optional for students. This perspective may seem counterintuitive, but it allows students to take ownership of their learning process, utilizing alternative sources and self-directed study.In today's digital age, students can access a vast array of educational resources outside the traditional classroom setting. Online lectures, tutorials, and educational websites provide valuable learning opportunities that can be tailored to individual learning styles and pace. For instance, students can watch video lectures, online tutorials, or podcasts that cater to their specific needs, allowing them to learn at their own convenience. This flexibility is particularly beneficial for students who may have conflicting schedules, family commitments, or learning disabilities that make traditional classroom attendance challenging.Moreover, students can also utilize the university library as a productive study space to focus on topics they struggle with. Without the distraction of a classroom environment, students can immerse themselves in their studies, taking the time to review and understand complex concepts at their own pace. This self-directed learning approach enables students to take ownership of their academic success, developing essential skills such as time management, self-motivation, and critical thinking.In conclusion, making class attendance optional allows students to explore alternative learning methods that may be more effective for them. By giving students the autonomy to choose their learning approach, universities can foster a more inclusive and flexible learning environment that caters to diverse needs and preferences. Ultimately, this approach can lead to improved academic outcomes, increased student satisfaction, and better preparedness for the demands of the modern workforce.

question: Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in big city. Which place would you prefer to live in?
human: In a few years I will finish my studying in the university and I will have to decide whether to live in a small town or a big city. As I am eager to get a good job and explore different places, I think I would prefer to live in a city.Big city life provides many opportunities. First of all, it will be easier for me to find an engineering job in the city. Electrical engineering deals with problems concerning electricity supply. Therefore, a big city can offer me many more vacancies than a small town.At the weekends, there is a great number of things to do in the metropolis. There are numerous bars, cafes and restaurants where I can go with my friends. Multinational cities have restaurants with different national cuisines. I am fond of Italian food, and if there is an Italian restaurant in the city, I will definitely visit it.A night club is an interesting place to visit for young people. There a person can listen to music, make new friends or enjoy a a drink alone. Cultural life of a metropolis is always an entertaining one.
