Moreover, space exploration can provide us with valuable resources, such as minerals and energy sources, which can sustain human life for generations to come.Additionally, space exploration has been used as a tool for military power, especially during the Cold War era. However, this does not diminish its importance for the greater good of humanity. In fact, the technological advancements made through space exploration, such as GPS and telecommunications, have greatly benefited society as a whole.Furthermore, space exploration can also serve as a catalyst for international cooperation and peaceful resolution of conflicts. By working together to explore space, nations can put aside their differences and achieve common goals. This, in turn, can lead to greater global understanding and cooperation, ultimately benefiting humanity as a whole.In conclusion, while some may view the investment in space exploration as a luxury, I firmly believe that it is a necessary investment for the future of humanity. The potential benefits, from disaster prevention to resource discovery, and from technological advancements to international cooperation, make it a worthwhile endeavor.

question: Do you agree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.Ê
human: Television is one of the greatest innovations that we use every day. Besides, watching television has some cons and at the same time has very good pros. However, while some people argue that TV has devastated communication among friends and families, I believe it has done the opposite. I think TV programs are among the popular topics in every day talk as well as a great time for gathering. In addition Modern TV has smart system that let you be connected with people.First, it's true watching TV take a lot of your day, nevertheless it makes people meet and start a conversation about what they watch at other times like weather forecast and sport programs.Second, people like having meals while they are watching TV. Families usually tend to watch television either with each other or friends. For example my friends and I used to sit together and enjoy watching movies using VHS player at nights. It was fun and a little bit similar to the cinema. Third, TV can be one of communication ways. Moreover, TV can be connected to multimedia devices that have smart operating system like Google TV, WDTV using Skype, tango and other apps. In addition Teenagers can play games online with their friends; therefore we can communicate with each other through TV. To sum up, TV may take some of your time away from your family and friends but it can also make family get together and help to get in conversation. As well as it's one way of recent communications, based on that I think TV helps you to get connected with people.
llm: The advent of television has revolutionized the way people consume information and entertainment, making it one of the greatest innovations of our time. While some people argue that TV has devastated communication among friends and families, I firmly believe that it has done the opposite. In fact, television has played a significant role in fostering communication and strengthening relationships among loved ones.Firstly, television provides a common platform for discussion and sharing of experiences. Families and friends can watch the same shows or news programs, generating topics for conversation and debate. For instance, popular TV shows like "Game of Thrones" or "The Walking Dead" have sparked numerous discussions and theories among fans, encouraging social interaction and bonding. Moreover, TV shows and movies often depict real-life scenarios, prompting viewers to reflect on their own relationships and experiences, thereby promoting empathy and understanding.Secondly, television has made it possible for people to connect with others across geographical distances. With the rise of video conferencing and live streaming, friends and family can now share experiences and communicate in real-time, regardless of their physical location. For example, international sporting events like the Olympics or the World Cup have brought people together, transcending borders and fostering a sense of global community.Finally, television has also provided a platform for families to spend quality time together. Watching TV shows or movies can be a fun and engaging activity, allowing family members to bond and create shared memories. In fact, many families have made TV time a part of their daily routine, often discussing their favorite shows over dinner or during family gatherings.In conclusion, while some people may argue that television has destroyed communication among friends and families, I strongly believe that it has done the opposite. By providing a common platform for discussion, enabling long-distance connections, and fostering quality family time, television has actually strengthened relationships and promoted communication among loved ones.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship.Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: There is an argument regrading weather letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship. It is widely accepted by many people that a mistake will return sometimes terrible result. However, I believe that friendship is more important than mistake by a friend, although mistake is terrible. In this essay, I will present two reasons supporting my opinion. First of all, a mistake does not last for a long time but a friendship lasts forever. Anybody does not remember mistakes. If someone remembers mistake, he or she has a closed mind. I want to say that mistakes will be forgotten quickly. For example, my friend Lee made a mistake that he broke my precious gift. However, I forgot about it just after two days, and I felt at peace with him. Some people might say I am silly, but I think mistake is more forgettable than friendship. Second, Everybody makes mistake. However, if you end a friendship whenever your friend makes a mistake, there will be no friends around you. I agree if a friend makes very a big mistake, we will need to end a friendship. However, when the mistake friend made was not a big problem, we need to understand friend and forgive it because a friend is a gift of our life. According to a research, 85% of people answered that a best gift is a friend.I think that a mistake can not brake friendship if it is not a big because friendship is forever and gift our life.
llm: The argument surrounding whether letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship is a complex one. On one hand, intervening can potentially prevent harm or negative consequences, but on the other hand, it may lead to resentment and damage to the relationship. After careful consideration, I agree that letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship. In this essay, I will present two reasons supporting my opinion.Firstly, letting a friend make a mistake allows them to learn and grow from their experiences. When we make mistakes, we often learn valuable lessons that help us become wiser and more cautious in the future. By intervening, we may deprive our friends of the opportunity to gain this valuable experience and insight. For instance, if a friend is considering quitting their job without having another one lined up, we may be tempted to advise them against it. However, by letting them make this mistake, they may learn the importance of planning and preparation, which can be a valuable lesson for their future career.Secondly, taking action that risks destroying a friendship can be damaging to the relationship in the long run. When we intervene in our friends' decisions, they may feel judged, criticized, or even betrayed. This can lead to feelings of resentment and mistrust, which can be difficult to repair. For example, if a friend is considering investing in a business venture that we think is risky, we may advise them against it. However, if they feel strongly about the investment, our advice may be seen as meddling, leading to a rift in the friendship.

question: One of the best ways that parents can help their teenage children prepare for adult life is to encourage them to take a part-time job.
human: Nowadays, the society has become exceedingly competitive than ever before, parents have the responsibilitis to teach their children to survive and to be indepedent from them, just as animals teach their offspring skills of finding foods. Parents can use many methods to guide them to achieve that, for example, asking them to do some housework or clean the rooms by themselves. In my views, I agree that it is the best way for teenage children to take a part-time job to prepare their adult life for several reasons.First of all, when children get a job, they are able to earn money by themselves, instead of getting pocket money from their parents. Thus, it is an oppertunity to learn how to deal with money. Take me as an example, when I was 16, I found a job during summer vacation and earned some money by own. At the beginning of the semester, I was told to buy a text book. Unfortunately, I spent most of my salary hanging out with my friend. Therefore, I finally realized that I should learn to make a plan before I spend my money, and that did influence me in my life now.Secondly, by taking a part-time job, they certainly have to be responsible for anything they have done. For instance, if a student get a job in a company but he is frequently late for work, the company may reduce his payment or even fire him. To compare with the school life, they might suffer only a small punishment at school. Under the circumstances, he will learn that he has to obey the rule and take responsibility for their work.In conclusion, to help their children to adapt adult life, parents should let them experience it as much as they can. Due to the reasons given above, to encourage children taking a part-time job is a good choice for them to get prepared for adult life.
llm: In my view, it is the best way for teenage children to take a part-time job to prepare for their adult life for several reasons. Firstly, when children get a job, they are able to earn money by themselves, instead of getting pocket money from their parents. This helps them learn the value of money and understand that it is earned through hard work and dedication, rather than simply given to them. Moreover, having a part-time job teaches teenagers the importance of time management and balancing responsibilities. They learn to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and juggle multiple commitments, essential skills for success in adulthood.Another significant benefit of having a part-time job is that it instills a sense of responsibility and accountability. For instance, if a student is frequently late for work, the company may reduce their payment or even fire them. Under these circumstances, they will learn that they have to obey the rules and take responsibility for their work. This helps build their character and teaches them to be punctual, reliable, and dependable. Additionally, a part-time job provides an opportunity for teenagers to develop important life skills such as communication, teamwork, and problem-solving. They learn to interact with people of different ages, backgrounds, and personalities, preparing them for the diverse and dynamic nature of the adult world.Furthermore, having a part-time job can also enhance a teenager's resume and college applications. Many universities and employers value applicants with work experience, as it demonstrates their ability to balance work and academic responsibilities. In conclusion, encouraging teenage children to take a part-time job is one of the best ways for parents to help them prepare for adult life. It teaches them valuable life skills, responsibility, and the importance of hard work, setting them up for success in their future careers.

question: It is better for children to grow up in the countryside than in a big city. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to develop your essay.
human: It’s certainly better for children to grow up in a big city. Of course you need to choose a good neighborhood. I hold this belief because of two main reasons, academic and social reasons.Some people thinks that if a child grows up in a big city they will be all day at home at the computer or at the video-game, but this is not true if you live in a neighborhood with other people about your age as I did. My friends and I used to play soccer, bike, climb trees and do a lot of other stuff every day. We did play video-games, but that wasn't our main activity. In a big city there are more kinds of people and more things to do.I have a friend that grew up in the countryside. He said that he had to study a lot to pass the test to enter the university. This is another downside of growing up in the countryside. In a big city you have more qualified teachers and a better access to technology.Growing up in the countryside is not such a good experience, you won’t know a lot of people, there are gossips everywhere, and your life will be really limited. If someday I have children, I’m absolutely sure that they will grow up in a good neighborhood of a big city and they will be very happy about it.
llm: The debate about whether children should grow up in the countryside or in a big city has been ongoing for years. While some argue that the countryside offers a more peaceful and serene environment for children to grow, I firmly believe that it is better for children to grow up in a big city. There are several reasons that support this argument.Firstly, big cities offer a diverse and vibrant environment where children are exposed to people from different cultures, ethnicities, and backgrounds. This exposure helps shape their worldview, broadens their perspectives, and teaches them valuable lessons about tolerance and understanding. In contrast, the countryside can be isolating, with limited opportunities for socialization.Secondly, cities provide a wide range of activities, amenities, and services that cater to children's physical, emotional, and intellectual development. From parks and playgrounds to museums and libraries, cities offer endless possibilities for children to learn, play, and explore. In contrast, the countryside often lacks these amenities, forcing children to rely on limited resources and their own imagination for entertainment.Moreover, the countryside can be a breeding ground for gossip and rumors, where everyone knows each other's business. This can be stifling for children, who need freedom to make mistakes, learn from them, and grow without the weight of constant scrutiny. In a city, children can enjoy a relatively anonymous existence, free from the prying eyes of neighbors and the constraints of small-town life.Personally, if I were to have children, I would want them to grow up in a city. I believe that the city offers the perfect balance of opportunities, diversity, and freedom that are essential for a child's development. While the countryside may offer a peaceful environment, I believe that the benefits of city life far outweigh the drawbacks. In conclusion, while the countryside has its advantages, I firmly believe that it is better for children to grow up in a big city, where they can thrive, learn, and grow into well-rounded, open-minded individuals.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: I completely agree that parents are the best teacher. Children normally think that their parents are somehow special and that makes them the most important people in the children’s lives.Firstly, the things that parents say have great power to their child. More power than any friend or other adult could have. For example, if someone tells a kid that something is wrong and they shouldn't do it, but his father told him/her that it was right, the kid will listen to the father instead of the other person, even if his father is wrong.Secondly, a child normally spends more time with their parents than with other people, so their parents have more time to teach him/her than anybody else. They have more contact and more intimacy with their children. Lastly, children usually mirror themselves on their parents. That’s as important thing because even if the parents don’t intend to teach their children something, they are always observing and learning by themselves. So, if there is a man that beats his wife and treats her bad, his child probably is going to be rude and treat girls bad.All in all, I agree that parents are the greatest teachers and I think that they should be very careful with what they say and do in front of their child, because it can define who he is going to be.
llm: I agree with the statement that parents are the best teachers. Parents have a profound impact on their children's lives, and their influence extends beyond the classroom. One of the primary reasons parents make excellent teachers is the power of their words. What parents say to their children has a lasting impact, carrying more weight than anything a friend or other adult could say. Children look up to their parents as role models and authorities, and their words are absorbed and internalized.Another significant advantage parents have is the amount of time they spend with their children. Typically, a child spends more time with their parents than with any other person, including teachers or peers. This extensive time allows parents to teach and guide their children in a way that no one else can. They can impart values, morals, and life skills through daily interactions, conversations, and shared experiences.Furthermore, children often mirror themselves on their parents, emulating their behavior, attitudes, and habits. This phenomenon is known as social learning theory, where children learn by observing and imitating their parents. Parents, therefore, have a unique opportunity to shape their children's character, work ethic, and relationships by modeling the behavior they wish to see in their child.In conclusion, parents are indeed the best teachers due to the significant influence they wield over their children's lives. Their words have power, they have ample time to teach and guide, and their children look to them as role models. By recognizing the importance of their role, parents can make a conscious effort to teach their children valuable lessons, values, and life skills, ultimately shaping them into capable, compassionate, and responsible individuals.

question: Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: The Technology has developed a lot. With that development, food can be prepared more easily and it can taste a lot better than it used to. With that change, people’s lives are a lot better for several reasons. Some good reasons are about having more time and being able to prepare better food without being a good cook.Firstly, people normally have lots of things to do. Because of that, they don’t have much time to spend in the kitchen. But being able to prepare a tasty food just putting it into the microwave or into the oven is awesome. For example, if an engineer needs to make a project, but he needs to deliver it tomorrow, he could save hours preparing a food with the microwave instead of cooking everything from scratch.Secondly, when someone wants to prepare a good food alone for some reason, some time ago he/she would need to be a very good cook to prepare that food, but nowadays is very easy to prepare a healthy and tasty food. For example, if a guy wants to prepare a dinner to his girlfriend, he could just buy some food that comes with instructions. Normally you just need to put it into the oven and wait some time.All in all, that ease to prepare food has improved people’s lives. And that happened mainly because of the development of the technology. But people should be careful with what they eat, because some industrial foods are very bad for their health, so they should buy only food from well known brands.
llm: The advent of modern technology and industrialization has revolutionized the way people prepare and consume food. With the development of pre-packaged meals, microwave ovens, and a plethora of cooking gadgets, food has become easier to prepare than ever before. This change has undoubtedly improved the way people live in many aspects, but it also poses some concerns that need to be addressed.On the one hand, the ease of food preparation has saved people a significant amount of time and effort. With the availability of ready-to-cook meals and online grocery shopping, individuals can now allocate more time to other aspects of their lives, such as work, leisure, or personal development. Moreover, modern cooking techniques and ingredients have enabled people to create a wide variety of dishes that are not only delicious but also visually appealing. Food has become more than just a necessity; it has become an art form that brings people together and provides a sense of satisfaction and enjoyment.However, the convenience of modern food preparation also comes with a warning. Many industrial foods are high in unhealthy ingredients, such as preservatives, artificial flavorings, and excessive sugar and salt. Consuming these foods regularly can lead to a range of health problems, including obesity, diabetes, and heart disease. Furthermore, the over-reliance on pre-packaged meals can also result in a lack of essential nutrients and a diminished appreciation for traditional cooking methods.In conclusion, the development of easier food preparation has undoubtedly improved the way people live, providing more time, variety, and enjoyment. Nevertheless, it is crucial for individuals to be mindful of their food choices and strike a balance between convenience and health.

question: Students should be required to take regular standardized tests to prove that they are learning
human: The issue at hand is if the schools should require students to take regular standardized exams. This issue is important because nowadays many people cast doubt on it. However, I believe that standardized tests are valuable option for educational system as long as it would help teachers to know if the students are really getting knowledge.Firstly, standardized tests are preferable due to the fact that they help teachers to fairly grade the students. For example some students are not so active on the lessons, cause they are already familiar with the issue. Therefore, exams could be the only way for teachers to see the real abilities of those students. In addition, many teachers rely only on the exam results while grading the class, so the usage of standardized tests is the superior option for them.Additionally, standardized tests can be good chance for students to apply their knowledge on practice. Since, some students may get used to simply rewriting solved problems from the blackboard, so they will never try to solve problems on their own. However, standardized tests offer them such chance. Thus, it is clear that schools should require students to take standardized tests, as long as this option helps to both sides.Finally, I think that requirement to take standardized tests is the right choice, since in this case teachers can compare the level of knowledge of different students. In any class there will be students who will show low academic performance, so teachers could work with them more intensively. I support the points of those who say that standardized tests are required over those who don’t because if the teacher would know the level of each student he would fairly share his time to all of them.Ultimately I feel that schools which obligate their students to take standardized tests are right. I belive this, due to the fact that these schools can qualitatively check if they are giving an appropriate education to their students.
llm: The debate on whether students should be required to take regular standardized tests has been ongoing for years. While some argue that these tests are an unnecessary burden on students, others believe that they are essential in measuring a student's learning. In this essay, I will argue that students should be required to take regular standardized tests to prove that they are learning.First and foremost, standardized tests provide a fair and objective measure of a student's knowledge and understanding of a subject. Unlike other forms of assessment, such as classwork and projects, which can be subjective and biased, standardized tests ensure that all students are held to the same standards and are graded based on their performance alone. This is particularly important for teachers who rely heavily on exam results when grading their students. By administering regular standardized tests, teachers can get an accurate picture of a student's strengths and weaknesses, which informs their grading decisions.Another advantage of standardized tests is that they provide a common language and framework for measuring student learning. This allows teachers to compare student performance across different classrooms and schools, which is essential for identifying areas where students may need extra support. Furthermore, standardized tests help to prepare students for the rigors of higher education and the workforce, where they will be expected to perform well on standardized assessments.In conclusion, requiring students to take regular standardized tests is essential for ensuring that they are learning and meeting the expected standards. These tests provide a fair and objective measure of student knowledge, inform teacher grading decisions, and prepare students for the demands of higher education and the workforce. While some may argue that these tests are too stressful or burdensome, the benefits of standardized testing far outweigh the drawbacks.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A university education should be provided free of charge to all interested scholars
human: A famous proverb “Knowledge is power” has demonstrated the value of education. I believe that universities should provide free of cost education to the interested scholars because now-a-days universities with good name charge high fees and this leads one to think about affordability. I have observed that many of the interested scholars failed to get the admission in good universities because they have to think about work along with the studies, and this left them with only one choice, which is work.University is more likely to become a money making business, the issue of affordability has become crucial to the students. In today’s world education is getting expensive, and people are tending to apply for self-finance education in order to get the admission. Whereas, the scholars are facing a lot of difficulties apart from their high requirements of previous education, they has a lot to face the other difficulties and burden while getting admission such as accommodation, food, traveling, clothing, etc.Moreover, it is hard to get manage two things at a time for instance, working and studying is not an easy job for the scholars, they need to concentrate on their studies. MPhils and PhDs scholars are probably engage in the research work, which takes their full concentration and surveys. The idea of free of charge education inspires those scholars who really want to put their efforts and get a degree from best universities.Therefore, universities have to look over the issues face by most of the scholars; their message should be spread education, not making money, and motivate those scholars who want to get education. Their notion should be inspirational in such a way which makes our society educative and increase our literacy rate.
llm: In today's world, where knowledge is power, a university education is becoming increasingly unaffordable for many aspiring scholars. The escalating costs of higher education have led to a surge in self-financed education, where students are forced to take on debt to pursue their academic dreams. However, I firmly believe that a university education should be provided free of charge to all interested scholars.The notion of free education has the potential to unlock the true potential of students who are eager to learn and contribute to society. When education is free, it inspires scholars to focus on their studies without the burden of financial constraints. This, in turn, fosters a culture of intellectual curiosity, creativity, and innovation, as students are empowered to explore their passions without worrying about the cost. Furthermore, free education promotes social mobility, as it provides opportunities for students from disadvantaged backgrounds to compete on an equal footing with their peers from more affluent families.In contrast, self-financed education can be a significant deterrent for many aspiring scholars, particularly those from low-income families. The weight of debt can stifle their enthusiasm and limit their career choices, as they are forced to prioritize high-paying jobs over their true interests. By providing free education, we can create a more equitable society where every individual has the chance to succeed, regardless of their financial background.In conclusion, I strongly agree that a university education should be provided free of charge to all interested scholars. It is an investment in the future of our society, and it has the potential to unlock the true potential of students, promote social mobility, and foster a culture of intellectual curiosity and innovation. By making education accessible to all, we can create a more enlightened, productive, and equitable society.

question: Some people think university professors should spend more time doing research while others think they should spend more time educating students. What is your view?Ê
human: Although professors in a university are basically teachers who do the most important thing, teaching, we cannot ignore one more influential aspect that they are always busy with, doing research. In my opinion, a professor should spend more time doing research rather than educating students for a few reasons following.A professor means a researcher or an expert of a specific science subject. He or she should always keep the passion in her field so that he or she could push him/herself forward all the time. And then he or she can do better in teaching works. For instance, the most impressive professor during my studying in university is Mr. Yang who keeps in researching and reading. He is also the one who gave us inspiration and taught us the way to study more efficient by ourselves. All of my classmates gave him a rank of AAA, the excellent teacher.As for students, we can get what we want to know from textbooks, webs or teachers. But we can only turn to our professors when we want to take part in a research and to get ourselves promoted. If a professor doesn't get any researching works, he cannot give us the opportunity. In addition, a professor who is concentrate in his or her research is thinking and creating new ideas all the time. He or she may stimulate us students to come up with some creative sugesstions. That is good for both of the professor and students.Finally, all professors in the university are fortune of the society. They are the leaders almost in every fields of science, arts, culture and so on. Without their research, there will be no new technologies come out quickly. Without their research, there will be more artcrafts being ruined by nothing. Without their research, there will be less information of our ancestors to be known on the earth.In conclusion, a professor should do their research all the time during their careers as a teacher in university. And it's worth to spend more time on it than on teaching.
llm: The debate about whether university professors should prioritize research or education has been ongoing. While some argue that professors should focus more on educating students, I firmly believe that they should spend more time doing research. Professors are essentially teachers, and their primary responsibility is to impart knowledge to their students. However, there is another crucial aspect of their role that cannot be overlooked - conducting research.There are several reasons why I think professors should allocate more time to research. Firstly, research is essential for advancing knowledge in various fields. Professors are experts in their areas of specialization, and their research contributes significantly to the development of new ideas, theories, and innovations. By spending more time on research, professors can make groundbreaking discoveries that can benefit society as a whole.Secondly, research experience is vital for professors to stay updated with the latest developments in their field. If they are not actively engaged in research, their knowledge may become outdated, and they may not be able to provide their students with the most current and relevant information. By prioritizing research, professors can ensure that their teaching is informed by the latest research findings, making their classes more engaging and relevant.Thirdly, research is a key factor in a university's reputation and ranking. Universities that prioritize research are generally considered more prestigious and attractive to students, faculty, and funding agencies. By allocating more time to research, professors can contribute to their university's reputation and attract more resources, which can, in turn, benefit their students.In conclusion, while teaching is an essential part of a professor's role, I believe that they should spend more time doing research. Research is crucial for advancing knowledge, staying updated with the latest developments, and contributing to a university's reputation. By prioritizing research, professors can make a more significant impact on their field and provide their students with a more enriching educational experience.

question: How do television or movies influence people's behavior? Use reasons and specific examples to explain your answer.
human: There is no doubt that television or movies influence people’s behavior and they influence us in both bad ways and good ways. But I think in general television and movies influence our behavior in bad ways more than in good ways. They make people to eat more rubbish food, spend less time with their friends and family, and be someone that are not themselves. There are a lot of people eating foods or snacks when they are watching television. Most of the foods they eat are fat foods like chips or pizzas. It is not rocket science to know that these foods are not good for people’s health. Many companies know about this behavior and use advertisements on television to make people buy more of these foods. In turn, people will consume these rubbish foods more and we have to deal with a lot of fat diseases.Television and movies also make people to spend more time on their couch than with their family and friends, especially children. They communicate less with their parents because a lot of their time is used watching television and movies. When people are watching television or movies together, they also talk less to each other, compare to when playing social games, such as parlor games, together.Television and movies nowadays contain a lot of advertisements. These advertisements build ideal images that make people to feel bad about themselves and want to be more like these images. When people see beautiful women and men on the advertisements, they think that they are ugly. Thus they spend a lot of money to buy a lot of beauty products or go to gym to get better appearance or body. When a cool hero characters in a movie smokes and yet a lot of people like him, then people who idolize him may also begin to smoke although they don’t prefer it.I think television and movies are entertaining but most of the time they influence people’s behavior in bad ways. If you want to stay healthy, be yourself and spend time with your family and friends, then you should spend less time watching these media.
llm: The impact of television and movies on people's behavior is a widely debated topic. While some argue that these forms of media have a positive influence, it is undeniable that they often have a more profound negative effect. In this essay, we will explore how television and movies shape our behavior, particularly highlighting the adverse consequences.On the one hand, television and movies can inspire and educate us. For instance, documentaries and historical dramas can raise awareness about significant social issues, promoting empathy and understanding. However, these positive influences are often overshadowed by the negative impacts of excessive screen time. The constant exposure to advertisements for unhealthy foods and drinks has led to a surge in junk food consumption, contributing to the growing obesity epidemic. Children and adults alike are enticed by the colorful packaging and catchy jingles, resulting in a rise in unhealthy eating habits.Furthermore, the rise of social media has been fueled by television and movies, which often portray unrealistic and glamorous lifestyles. This has led to a decline in face-to-face interactions, as people spend more time staring at screens than engaging with friends and family. The fear of missing out (FOMO) and the pressure to present a perfect online persona have created a culture of isolation, where individuals prioritize their virtual lives over real-life connections.In addition, the constant bombardment of idealized characters and celebrities on television and movies has led to a rise in people trying to emulate these unattainable standards. This has resulted in a loss of individuality, as people strive to conform to societal norms rather than embracing their unique qualities. The constant pursuit of an unrealistic beauty standard, for example, has led to a rise in body dissatisfaction and low self-esteem.In conclusion, while television and movies can have some positive influences, it is clear that they often have a more profound negative impact on people's behavior. By promoting unhealthy habits, isolating individuals, and encouraging the suppression of individuality, these forms of media have the power to shape our behavior in detrimental ways. It is essential to be aware of these influences and strive for a balanced and mindful approach to our media consumption.

question: Many people visit museums when they travel to new places. Why do you think people visit museums? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Many people like to visit museums when they travel to new places, other people don't like to visit museums. I personaly tend to visit museums when I'm in a new place because it's good for me know about the culture, tradition and history of other places.The first reason why people are willing to visit museums when they travel to a new territory is that museums provide a tremendous amount of information about different aspects of the history and culture of that place, as I said back. And also taking the chance for making friends. Visit museums can bring you the opportunity to establish relations and knowledge to participate in conversations. And that kind of knowledge speaks very highly of you.However, other people visit museums are the most boring expirience of a trip. My cousin Pedro literaly hates to visit museums but he really enjoyed his visit to the famous London - Madame Tussaud museum, it was kind of art entertainment but also that visit helped him to understand the artist works, and in addition he started to respect and admire other types of arts that offers in other museums.In coclusion, the museums are a visual source to know the history, tradition and culture of any place in the world. I think it's fun and educational.
llm: When traveling to new places, many people make it a point to visit museums. While it may seem like an obvious activity for tourists, the reasons behind this inclination are multifaceted and worth exploring. In this essay, we will delve into the motivations behind visiting museums, highlighting the educational value, social opportunities, and cultural significance.One of the primary reasons people visit museums is to gain a deeper understanding of the local history and culture. Museums provide a tremendous amount of information about different aspects of the history and culture of that place, allowing visitors to gain a more nuanced appreciation of the region. For instance, a visit to the Louvre in Paris would offer insights into French art and history, while a trip to the National Museum of China in Beijing would provide a comprehensive look at Chinese civilization. By immersing themselves in these exhibits, visitors can develop a more informed perspective on the local customs, traditions, and ways of life.Visiting museums also offers an opportunity to meet like-minded individuals and establish new relationships. While exploring exhibits, visitors can engage in conversations with fellow travelers and locals, fostering connections and friendships. For example, striking up a conversation with a fellow art enthusiast in front of a famous painting can lead to a meaningful exchange of ideas and even a lasting friendship. Moreover, visiting museums can bring people the chance to make friends and participate in conversations, allowing them to engage with others who share similar interests.In conclusion, visiting museums is a popular activity among tourists due to its educational value, social opportunities, and cultural significance. By exploring the rich history and culture of a place, meeting fellow travelers, and engaging in meaningful conversations, museum-goers can create lasting memories and connections. Whether traveling alone or with others, visiting museums is an enriching experience that offers something for everyone.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: In a busy and crowded world, we should not expect people to be polite to others.
human: Once a celebrity said: A man's manner is a mirror that reflects his virtues. Recently, the social environment we lived with busy noises and crowded spaces in case that people pay less attentions on their behaviors and manners. They are being rude towards others. Due to this phenomenon, someone suggests that we should not expect people to be polite to other. Obviously, I do not agree with such kind of altitudes, the explanations I explored would be stated as following.First of all, a person with good manner will give others a fine personal impression. Through those impressions, a person was easily to get acquired with others and blended with the community that surrounded him as soon as possible. For example, I worked in a new company, if I am a guy with good manners and treating everyone well, my new colleagues will accept me, even then I will be approved by the employers. In opposite situation if I am being rude, I can not get along well with each other. Finally, I will be fired and have no other choice but lost my job.Secondly, people will get respect from politeness within each other. Politeness and tender words not only can help the speaker to earn a good reputation but also that encourage the listeners who were in need. A successful corporation must have a relationship with respect and pleasure. There are many more facts have improved that people with politeness are easily to be succeed, because from their behaviors, they made their partners or opponents to find their own individual dignity.Finally, the society needs a civilized environment and orders. And a degree of social civilization depend on its people's qualities. In order to create a better living environment for ourselves and our offsprings, our behaviors must be asked with politeness and good manners. Benefit from those effective measures, there may be an obvious effect on the reducing of criminal rate.All in all, I suppose that people should be polite to others in a such busy and crowded world.
llm: In today's fast-paced and crowded world, it's easy to get caught up in our own personal struggles and forget about the people around us. However, I strongly disagree with the statement that we should not expect people to be polite to others. Politeness is a fundamental aspect of human interaction that not only reflects our character but also has a profound impact on those around us.As the saying goes, "a man's manner is a mirror that reflects his virtues." A person with good manners is often perceived as respectful, considerate, and kind. They give others a fine personal impression, which can open doors to new opportunities and foster meaningful relationships. On the other hand, a person with poor manners can come across as rude, insensitive, and unapproachable.Politeness and tender words have the power to not only earn us a good reputation but also to uplift and encourage those around us. A simple "please" or "thank you" can go a long way in brightening someone's day. In a crowded and busy world, a kind word or gesture can be a beacon of hope and comfort to those who may be struggling. Moreover, politeness can have a ripple effect, inspiring others to pay it forward and creating a more positive and supportive community.In conclusion, politeness is not a luxury we can afford to discard in a busy and crowded world. On the contrary, it is a necessity that can make a significant difference in the lives of those around us. We should strive to maintain a culture of politeness and respect, even in the midst of chaos and hurry. By doing so, we can create a more harmonious and compassionate society where everyone feels valued and appreciated.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Most experiences in our lives that seemed difficult at the time become valuable lessons for the future. Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
human: There is a famous old saying that failure is the mother of success. For that reason, some people advocate that some difficulties people met at their early ages will become an invaluable fortune in their future lives. However, some people think it isn't supposed to be that case. From my point of view, I am in favor the former statement that some tough experiences people met before will be helpful in their life path.To start with, hardship makes people realize how to cherish and compliment the common but wonderful little things happened in their life such as, a shining weather, a delicious breakfast and etc. People who have such nice spirit usually know how to find the true love in their life instead of being seduced by greed as to lose themselves in the end. As a result, experiences of difficulties teach them how to keep a nice mood and have confidence all the time.What's more, people who experienced lots of difficulties will be calmer when they are in troubles. Because they already have such experiences of overcoming some difficulties, they are conscious of what to do and how to do when fierce crisis happens. Those people are more likely to achieve their ambitions in their career because they are aware of how to lead people to reach success despite what kind of difficulties are getting in their way.So, to sum it up, both not afraid of difficulties and appreciating common but pleasant things in their lives drive me to believe that most tough experiences in people's life path will be a priceless treasure to them. Remember if you are afraid of encountering difficulties, then you will be in the troubles all the time.
llm: The age-old adage that "when life gives you lemons, make lemonade" resonates deeply with the notion that most experiences in our lives that seemed difficult at the time become valuable lessons for the future. Many people subscribe to the idea that some difficulties people encountered at their early ages will become an invaluable fortune in their future lives. From my point of view, I am in favor of the former statement that some tough experiences people met before will be helpful in their life path.To start with, hardship makes people realize how to cherish and compliment the common but wonderful little things happened in their lives. For instance, a person who has experienced poverty may learn to appreciate the simple joys of life, such as having a warm meal or a comfortable place to sleep. This newfound appreciation can lead to a more fulfilling life, where one is not consumed by material possessions, but by the beauty of everyday experiences.Moreover, people who experienced lots of difficulties will be calmer when they are in troubles. Because they already have such experiences of overcoming some difficulties, they are conscious of their ability to navigate through challenging situations. This sense of resilience can be a powerful tool in the face of adversity, allowing individuals to remain composed and focused, even in the most turbulent of times. For example, a student who struggled to learn a new language may initially feel frustrated, but with perseverance, they will develop a sense of determination and confidence that will serve them well in future academic pursuits.In conclusion, I firmly believe that most experiences in our lives that seemed difficult at the time become valuable lessons for the future. By cherishing the little things and developing resilience, individuals can transform their struggles into stepping stones for success. As the ancient Greek philosopher, Heraclitus, once said, "The way up and the way down are one and the same." It is only by embracing our difficulties that we can truly appreciate the journey and reach our full potential.

question: Life in a city is much better than life in the countryside
human: As far as I am concerned, I agree with the statement that life in a city is much better than life in the countryside.Firstly, in the city there is much better education system. This means, that the schools and the universities have well equipped classes and the famous professors would like to work in such places.In addition, I believe that city provides more work opportunities than the countryside. There are not only more jobs, but they are also well-paid. Of course living in a city is more expensive, but incomes are higher too.Moreover, in the urban areas there are also more citizens what means, that the culture diversity is huge. Meeting and knowing new people's tradition is an unforgettable experience, which could influence on one's previous habits.Furthermore, the city has well-organised lines of transport. The buses and trains are more frequent than in the countryside, so the city provides better communication.However, in the countryside there are many places to rest, because of its location. Moreover, peaceful and close to the nature areas could help to avoid worries and sadness.Taking all into account, I think that living in the city is much better nowadays, because of the opportunities it gives. Today living in the rural places is in most causes connected with agrarian lifestyle, which for me is without perspective. If I could decide I would chose living in the city for sure.
llm: The debate about whether life in a city is better than life in the countryside has been ongoing for centuries. While some people prefer the peace and tranquility of rural areas, others thrive in the hustle and bustle of urban life. In my opinion, life in a city is much better than life in the countryside due to its superior education system, abundant work opportunities, cultural diversity, and efficient communication.One of the primary advantages of city life is its access to quality education. Urban areas typically have better-funded schools, more experienced teachers, and a wider range of academic programs. This results in a more comprehensive education, preparing students for a successful career and a brighter future. In contrast, rural areas often struggle to provide the same level of educational resources, leaving students at a disadvantage.Another significant benefit of city life is the abundance of work opportunities. With a larger population and a more diverse economy, cities offer a wide range of jobs across various industries. This allows individuals to pursue their passions and interests, leading to greater job satisfaction and career advancement. In contrast, rural areas often have limited job opportunities, making it difficult for individuals to find employment that matches their skills and interests.Urban areas also boast a culturally diverse population, which enriches the lives of its citizens. With people from different backgrounds and ethnicities living together, cities become vibrant melting pots of traditions, customs, and ideas. This diversity fosters tolerance, understanding, and creativity, making cities exciting and dynamic places to live.In addition, cities have well-developed public transportation systems, with buses and trains running frequently and efficiently. This makes it easy for citizens to commute to work, school, or social events, connecting them to various parts of the city and beyond. While rural areas may have limited public transportation options, making it difficult for residents to access essential services and amenities.However, it is worth acknowledging that the countryside has its own unique advantages. The peaceful surroundings and natural beauty of rural areas make them ideal for rest and relaxation. The slower pace of life and stunning landscapes can be a welcome respite from the stresses of city life.In conclusion, while the countryside has its own charms, life in a city is generally better due to its superior education system, abundant work opportunities, cultural diversity, and efficient communication. Cities offer citizens a dynamic and exciting environment that fosters personal and professional growth, making them the preferred choice for many people.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Your job has more effect on your happiness than your living environment does.
human: With the development of the economy, people become more and more rich. They start to pay attention to mental requirement like happiness. While I accept that job can offer happiness to some people, I believe that living environment is more important than job for most of us.Admittedly, job can bring us happiness. People can receive a sense of values and respected from job. If people receive respect from others, they will feel achievement and self-confidence. In addition, job can provide money to us. However, people should concern more about their living environment than job. First, for most of us, job is only a tool to maintain our lives. Few people can feel happiness from their job because they have to continue to work more than 30 years. For example, Workers in the FOXCONN factory, which is the main manufacture of APPLE Company, just repeat one action more than 8 hours every day. These labor works cannot provide workers with a lot of happiness because they feel tired and frustrated after long hour work. Second, beautiful environment is one of basic physiological needs, which are the most fundamental requirements for people. Without beautiful environment, people are not able to feel happiness and will fell anxiety. Nowadays, the fast development of economy is gradually destroying our environment very quickly. Factories released a huge amount of wasters into river and soil. In order to build city and factory, people destroy huge forests. In China, some residents who live in nearby some toxic factories became sick because these factories release a lot of toxic water and wasters into environment around people. Even though local residents benefits from an increasing number of jobs which are provided by those factories, they cannot feel happiness from high-paying job yet because most of them suffer from cancer or other diseases.In conclusion, it is far better to protect our living environment rather than focus on job or work since the goal people is for good livers.
llm: The relationship between job, living environment, and happiness has long been debated. Some people argue that their job has a greater impact on their happiness, while others believe that their living environment plays a more significant role. The statement "your job has more effect on your happiness than your living environment does" is a topic of discussion. While I acknowledge that one's job can indeed bring happiness to some individuals, I firmly believe that living environment is more crucial to most people's overall happiness.In recent years, as people's living standards have improved, they have become increasingly affluent. As a result, they have shifted their focus from basic survival needs to mental requirements such as happiness. This shift in priorities has led to a growing awareness of the importance of both job satisfaction and living environment in contributing to one's overall happiness.While some individuals may find their job to be a significant source of happiness, I believe that living environment plays a more substantial role in shaping most people's happiness. A comfortable and secure living environment can provide a sense of stability and peace, which are essential for happiness. On the other hand, a job, no matter how fulfilling, can be stressful and demanding at times, which may negatively impact one's happiness. Furthermore, a good living environment can provide opportunities for socialization, community engagement, and access to amenities, all of which are vital components of happiness.In conclusion, while job satisfaction is important, I firmly believe that living environment has a greater impact on most people's happiness. A comfortable, secure, and supportive living environment is essential for overall well-being, and its importance should not be underestimated.

question: Some people like to communicate by e-mail and voice mail. Other people like to communicate by telephone or face-to-face. Which type of communication do you prefer?
human: Technology has been developing so quickly and becoming more perfect every day. Communication nowadays depends on technology pretty much. Voice mail, e-mail, telephone or just traditional way: face-to-face. However, I prefer e-mail due to 3 reasons: convenience, honest expression and fluency in communicating.Everyone agrees that e-mail has been a great way of communication. You can talk to others from thousands mile. For instance, if you are in Vietnam and another person is in the US - half of the Earth, no matter how far it is, you can keep contact. We will never have to worry if our mails will be sent to the right address. If the address is wrong, then you will know right away. Moreover, e-mail doesn't take too much time: just a click.In addition, writing e-mail helps people express honestly. Some people think that the face-to-face conversations make them feel stupid. Sometimes, their ideas are not expressed as exactly as they expect. For instance, I want to talk to my friend about a ticklish problem like her behavior, it's hard for me to face her and explain what she should do. Therefore, e-mail will be a good tool to help me speak out. She will just read my e-mail instead of listening to my voice which can make her annoyed. I don't have to worry about any other thing can make my opinion become unpersuasive.Last but not least, every communication needs fluency so people can understand each other exactly and remember it for a long time. Voice email or face-to-face conversations sometimes make reserve people feel not very confident. For example, when I face my parents, I can't speak out every idea and express consecutively. They may stop me, speak something against it and that makes me forget what I want to say. Anyone can meet this problem once in any conversation. E-mail helps me arrange my idea perfectly and make it persuasive. On the whole, to compare to all ways of communication, I really think that e-mail is the greatest way for major people to use. Its convenience saves our time. Additionally, honesty is necessary for every conversation and also fluency can't be missing for a persuasive expression.
llm: Communication is a fundamental aspect of human interaction, and in today's world, technology has transformed the way we connect with each other. With the rise of digital communication, people have various options to choose from, including voice mail, email, telephone, and face-to-face conversations. While each method has its own advantages, I personally prefer email as my primary means of communication, and I would like to explain why.Firstly, email offers convenience, which is essential in today's fast-paced world. With email, I can send and receive messages at any time and from any location, as long as I have an internet connection. This flexibility allows me to manage my time more efficiently, as I can respond to emails at my own pace, without being tied to a specific time or place. Whether I am at home, in the office, or on the go, email enables me to stay connected with others without being constrained by geographical or temporal limitations.Secondly, email allows for honest expression. When communicating in person or over the phone, it's easy to get caught up in the moment and say something that might be misinterpreted or regretted later. With email, I have the time to carefully craft my thoughts and choose my words, ensuring that my message is conveyed accurately and without unintended consequences. This allows me to be more authentic and honest in my communication, without the pressure of an immediate response.Lastly, email enables fluency in communicating, especially for non-native speakers. As someone who is not a native English speaker, I find that email allows me to take my time to look up words, phrases, and expressions that I'm not familiar with, ensuring that my message is conveyed correctly and without misunderstandings. This has helped me to communicate more effectively and confidently, which is essential in both personal and professional settings.In conclusion, while different people may prefer different modes of communication, I believe that email is an effective and convenient way to connect with others. Its advantages of convenience, honest expression, and fluency make it an ideal choice for me, and I believe that it can be beneficial for others as well.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: There are many interesting programs on television which anyone can enjoy at little cost. Compared to other hobbies such as going to theater or going to sports stadium, it is a very cost-effective hobby that gives viewer quiet a few indirect experiences. However, from my point of view, television has more bad than good because it has made people not to have conversation each other.To begin with, television shows make people forget what is really important. One who has favorite programs tends to be obessed with them when they are on air. Thus, they cannot make appointment or go out with their family or friends at that time since they think the programs are so crucial to their lives. One of my friends, for example, once cancelled an appointment to play basketball with in order to watch the favorite television show "Infinete Challenges". This is not only about basketball, but also about our friendship, which depends on how often we meet and have a chance to talk to each other. That is, watching television alone at home, my friend lost the opportunity to increase cohesion between us.Moreover, even when people watch television together, there is no chance for them to have conversation in front of television. Watching television program together is not that different from watching same program alone. Thus, it is not good for them to watch television if they want to improve their sense of closeness. To illustrate my point, it is reported that most of people don't converse with their family when they are watching television together. It is natural they behave in that way because television shows don't require any participation.In conclusion, I firmly believe that it is detrimental to communication among members in group, family or friends or whatever, to sit in front of television and just stare forward. It is because television not only makes people be obsessed with it but also makes their mouth close.
llm: The advent of television has revolutionized the way we spend our leisure time, but it has also been accused of destroying communication among friends and family. I agree with this statement, as television has had a profoundly negative impact on interpersonal relationships. In my opinion, television has more bad effects than good, primarily because it has made people less inclined to engage in conversation with each other.Television shows, in particular, have a way of captivating our attention and making us forget what is truly important. When we watch TV, we often become so engrossed in the programs that we neglect our relationships with others. For instance, when a favorite show is on air, people often become obsessed with it, shutting out their family and friends. I have seen this happen in my own family, where my parents would often argue over what channel to watch, completely ignoring each other's opinions and needs.Furthermore, television has become a substitute for human interaction, leading to a decline in face-to-face communication skills. People are more likely to spend hours watching TV than engaging in meaningful conversations with each other. This has resulted in a lack of empathy, understanding, and deep connections among friends and family members. In extreme cases, it has even led to social isolation, where people prefer the company of their TV sets to that of real people.In conclusion, while television has its benefits, such as providing entertainment and education, its negative effects on communication among friends and family cannot be ignored. It is essential to recognize the impact of TV on our relationships and make a conscious effort to strike a balance between TV time and quality time with loved ones.

question: Some people like to communicate by e-mail or voice mail. Other people like to communicate by telephone or face-to-face. Which type of communication do you prefer and why?
human: Although many people prefer communicating by telephone or face-to-face, personally I believe that communicating by e-mails or voice mails is better. There are several reasons to support this idea which I would like to mention in this essay.Firstly, communicating by e-mail is easy. Many people have problems with calling a person that they are not acquainted with. In this case it is not so difficult to write an e-mail or to leave a voice mail because even shy people feel themselves more confident.Secondly, you can write an e-mail at any time of the day. As for me, I work and study at the university and I don't have spare time during the day. I get home at about midnight and I still need to answer some questions and to solve some routine problems. I might not have time to call a person or to meet with him or her in an appropriate time so for me it is better to leave a voice mail.Thirdly, when you write an e-mail you have enough time to think carefully about what you are writing and how it would be better to express yourself. For example, you can change the word order or you can choose more appropriate style to sound more polite. When you speak face-to-face you are not as able to control every word as you are when you write an e-mail.And finally, there is no chance to disturb people by sending them an e-mail. You should not worry about interrupting an important conversation or some other business.To sum up, I would like to say that for me both options of communicating are possible, but if this is an important and not urgent question I would prefer to answer it by means of internet or voice mail.
llm: The preference for communication methods varies among individuals, with some people favoring traditional face-to-face or telephone interactions, while others prefer the convenience of email or voicemail. While many people prefer communicating by telephone or face-to-face, I personally believe that communicating by emails or voice mails is better. There are several reasons to support this idea, which I would like to mention in this essay.Firstly, it is easy. Many people have problems with calling a person that they are not acquainted with. In this case, it is not so difficult to write a voice mail or send an email. This method of communication alleviates the nervousness and anxiety associated with cold-calling someone you don't know. Additionally, emails and voice mails provide a paper trail, which can be useful for reference or record-keeping purposes.Secondly, you can write an email at any time of the day. As for me, I am a night owl and tend to be more productive later in the day. With emails and voice mails, I can communicate at my own pace, without being restricted by traditional office hours. This flexibility is particularly useful in today's fast-paced world, where people's schedules can be unpredictable.Moreover, emails and voice mails allow for more time to think and reflect on the message being conveyed. This reduces the likelihood of misunderstandings and miscommunications, which can occur in face-to-face or telephone conversations. It also enables the sender to articulate their thoughts more clearly and concisely, resulting in more effective communication.In conclusion, while many people may prefer traditional methods of communication, I firmly believe that communicating by emails or voice mails is better. The ease of use, flexibility, and clarity of thought that these methods provide make them an attractive option in today's digital age.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement "haste makes waste" use specific reasons and examples.
human: This saying is stating that every fast and not well thought decision is a wasted one. In my opinion, this statement is completely true, for these few reasons:For one thing, making a quick decision means that it's not very thought out, and that it hasn't been checked from all its aspects. Consequently, making quick decisions leads to probable bad results. For example: if someone decided to quit his job without really thinking about the alternative, or a plan B, he could end up being unemployed, because of his speedy decision.In addition, making a rushed decision could also mean that the person is missing out on a potential opportunity. In another word, if this person had waited and thought his decision through he wouldn't have missed out on the job opening in the same firm, but at a different position. Hence, he wouldn't have been unemployed.Not to mention, that hasty decisions, not only goes to waste, but also, could affect the entire life of the person. To put it differently, is that after this person has quit his job and became unemployed, he can no longer pay his bills nor buy what he needs for his everyday needs, thus, his life had taken a turn to the worst.As can be seen from this, is that a hurried decision is almost never a good one. That's why one should always study his decision carefully and slowly, to ensure that the decision that the person is making is the best for him.
llm: The age-old adage "haste makes waste" is a timeless wisdom that cautions against the perils of hasty decision-making. I firmly agree with this statement, as every fast and not well-thought-out decision is indeed a wasted one. In today's fast-paced world, where instant gratification is the norm, it's easy to fall into the trap of making quick decisions without considering the consequences.Making quick decisions leads to probable bad results, as they are often based on incomplete information, emotions, or impulse. For instance, a person who buys a car on impulse without researching its reliability, fuel efficiency, or maintenance costs may end up with a lemon that guzzles gas and breaks down frequently. Similarly, a student who rushes into a career choice without considering their interests, skills, or job market demand may end up in a dead-end job that leads to frustration and stagnation.Hurried decisions not only go to waste but also could affect the entire life of the person. A hasty marriage, for example, may lead to divorce, financial ruin, and emotional distress. A rushed investment decision may result in financial losses that take years to recover from. In extreme cases, a speedy decision to undergo a medical procedure without fully understanding the risks and alternatives may lead to permanent health damage or even death.In conclusion, the saying "haste makes waste" is a wise warning that encourages us to slow down, reflect, and deliberate before making decisions. By taking the time to gather information, weigh options, and consider the consequences, we can avoid the pitfalls of hasty decision-making and make choices that lead to positive outcomes. As the old adage goes, "patience is a virtue" - and in this case, it's a virtue that can save us from the waste and regret that comes with hasty decisions.

question: Some people think that the automobile has improved modern life. Others think that the automobile has caused serious problems. What is your opinion? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Nowadays the automobile is one of the most significant forms of transportation in everyday life. Many people own cars and use them daily, which clearly shows how important they are. Generally speaking, I definitely agree with the statement that cars have improved modern life, for several reasons.Firstly, people are now able to overcome long distances in a short amount of time, which leads to numerous advantages. For example in relationships. Many people are now able to maintain relationships over great distances because they can visit each other regularly by using their vehicle. From my personal experience I recall that my car has always been a great help to see my childhood friends very often although I lived in another city. I was also able to establish a relationship with a man living 89 kilometers away. Thanks to my car we could see each other at the weekends and are still a happy couple today. Without my automobile we would probably not have been able to develop a relationship.In addition, cars increase the chance of employment because people are able to drive to work and can work further away from home. Furthermore, they are more flexible. My father for example has always been working all around Germany and because of that earned more money. He used his car to drive to the other end of the country, worked there during the week and came home for the weekend. If he had no car, he wouldn't be able to see his family at the weekends so for him his automobile is a great benefit - not only in financial but also in social terms.Finally, the automobile allows people to travel more often and thus get to know the world. If people do not own cars they are likely to stay in their hometown or village most of their life. They are mainly using public transport and are thus limited in accessing certain areas. There are still places in nearly every country in the world that cannot be reached by public transportation and can only be visited by car. As a result, people who own a vehicle have greater access to more places and will see more of the world.In conclusion, the above stated reasons clearly outweigh the fact that cars cause a lot of pollution because they provide flexibility, which is important in nearly all areas of life. Travelling, social life and employment are highly dependent on the flexibility of a person and there is nothing in the world that makes more flexible than an own car.
llm: The automobile has been a staple of modern life for decades, and opinions about its impact vary widely. While some people believe that cars have improved modern life, others argue that they have caused serious problems. In my opinion, the automobile has had a largely positive impact on modern life, and I will provide specific reasons and examples to support this view.One of the most significant advantages of the automobile is its ability to facilitate travel and exploration. With a car, people can travel long distances easily and efficiently, allowing them to experience new places and cultures. This has opened up the world to people who may not have been able to travel otherwise, and has enabled us to connect with others across the globe. For example, many people use their cars to take road trips to national parks, beaches, or cities, which has helped to promote tourism and cultural exchange.Another benefit of the automobile is its impact on daily life. Many people own cars and use them daily, which clearly shows how important they are to our modern way of life. Cars provide us with independence and freedom, allowing us to travel where we want, when we want. This has enabled us to live in suburban areas and commute to work, school, or other activities, which has helped to shape the modern suburban lifestyle.Overall, I believe that the automobile has improved modern life. It has enabled us to travel more often, experience new places and cultures, and live more independently. While there are certainly problems associated with car ownership, such as traffic congestion and air pollution, I believe that the benefits of the automobile far outweigh the drawbacks.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: It is better for children to choose jobs that are similar to their parents job than to choose jobs that are very different from their parents jobs.
human: When choosing a job, one need to consider it thoroughly. Whether to choose a job which is similar to parents' job or not, different people may hold different opinions. As far as I am concerned, I think choosing the job that is similar to parents' jobs could benefit to one's career. First of all, as parents are involved in the same environment, they could thus support much more to their children, such as domain knowledge and industry-related information. For example, my father is a software programmer, and he indeed teaches me a lot in programming and some computer knowledge. Whenever I met a difficulty, I would reach him for consulting. Because he has many experiences, I could save enormous time in finding solution. This truly makes me more competitive than my colleagues. If I worked in the different field from my father, I would have faced much difficulty than I do now.Nevertheless, since parents have worked in tens of years, they have accumulated a rich network in a certain industry. They have a deep insight in it and could provide much support to their children. For instance, they know which company has better welfare or provides better education. Moreover, their friends in the same industry can even help to write recommendation letters to some certain companies.
