In addition, World Wide Web offers humanity to access to information, which they want to know for less than 10 seconds. These are two of the benefits, why IT is useful.Besides, nowadays technology is entering into our society really quick and scientists develop robots, which help people cope with their problems or just invent coffee machines, engines with integrated computers and etc. For example, before centeries, there were not washing machines, which clean your clothes, while a person do another job.Secondly, there are some drawbacks about this issue. Scientists believe that one day people will face their developments, for instance robots, and they will not succeed to control them. All this inventions will try to take control of the Earth.In conclusion, I agree that IT discoveries are likely to have more disadvantages than benefits and people should know how to use their developments properly.
llm: The field of information technology (IT) has witnessed tremendous growth over the past two decades, revolutionizing the way we communicate and access information. The World Wide Web and email have been instrumental in bridging geographical gaps and facilitating global connectivity. However, there is a growing concern that future developments in IT may have more negative consequences than benefits. While I agree that there are potential downsides to IT advancements, I also believe that the positive impacts will continue to outweigh the negative effects.Every day, scientists discover magnificent devices in the field of IT, such as interactive boards, multicore computers, laptops, and tablets, which have an incredible resolution. These innovations have transformed the way we learn, work, and interact with each other. For instance, online educational resources have made learning more accessible and convenient, while video conferencing has enabled remote communication, saving time and resources. Moreover, the widespread adoption of IT has led to significant economic growth, job creation, and improved healthcare outcomes.However, there are some negative aspects of information technology that cannot be ignored. The excessive use of IT devices has led to concerns about screen time, social isolation, and decreased attention span. Furthermore, the rapid pace of IT development has created new challenges, such as cybersecurity threats, data breaches, and the digital divide. These issues need to be addressed through responsible innovation, education, and policy-making.In conclusion, while there are valid concerns about the negative impacts of future IT developments, I believe that the benefits will continue to outweigh the drawbacks. By acknowledging the potential risks and taking proactive measures to mitigate them, we can ensure that IT advancements contribute to a brighter, more connected future.

question: Many people believe that media coverage of celebrities is having a negative effect on children. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: Today, celebrities appear to become a spotlight of the mass media. Almost half of the news coverage on television and the Internet is devoted to the celebrity gossip. Not surprisingly, many people are worried that this attention to the famous people has an impact on them, especially on their children. This essay will compare both negative and positive consequences of this effect on infants.Fame is a great responsibility for public people as their admirers are very sensitive to any acts of their idols. Celebrity scandals and gossips can quickly reach the public which perceive it very negatively. This means that celebrities who received attention for overuse of drugs or alcohol are likely to get public disgrace. Therefore, children may see that this behavior is inexcusable.On the other hand, too much news coverage to famous people seems to have a negative influence on the choice of children of their future professions. As recent surveys showed, inspired by the fame and wealth, children now prefer more to become an actor/actress or a sports star than it was in the past. Many schools for preparation of so-called stars and various advertisements about famous people may mislead with the fact that this profession is highly required and easy reachable. This may confuse children who should not choose their future job because of the influence of the mass media, but from the basis of their own interests.In conclusion, parents should be more worried about their children's attitudes to the 'cult of celebrity'. They should teach their children how to distinguish shortcoming stars from truly talented ones and to put right priorities in life.
llm: The proliferation of celebrity news and gossip has become an integral part of modern media, with many people voicing concerns about its potential impact on children. In my opinion, the extensive media coverage of celebrities can indeed have a negative effect on children, and I agree with this sentiment to a considerable extent.On one hand, the intense scrutiny of celebrities can serve as a double-edged sword. While it can inspire and motivate children to pursue their passions and interests, it also places a tremendous burden of responsibility on public figures. Their every move is under the microscope, and their actions can have a profound impact on their young admirers. As a result, celebrities must be mindful of the influence they wield and conduct themselves in a manner that is respectful and admirable. This can be a challenging task, especially when considering the immense pressure to maintain a public image.On the other hand, excessive media coverage of celebrities can have a detrimental influence on children's career aspirations. The constant bombardment of glamorous and often unrealistic portrayals of fame can lead children to develop unrealistic expectations about the entertainment industry. Many may be swayed into pursuing a career in the spotlight, not for the love of their craft, but for the promise of fame and fortune. This can result in disappointment and disillusionment when reality fails to live up to their lofty expectations. Furthermore, it can also distract from other, more meaningful and rewarding career paths that may be of greater benefit to society as a whole.In conclusion, while celebrity news and gossip can serve as a harmless form of entertainment for many, its impact on children cannot be ignored. It is crucial for parents, educators, and the media to promote a balanced and realistic understanding of fame and its consequences, as well as to encourage children to explore a wide range of interests and career options.

question: Some people argue that the technology such as mobile phone (cell phone) destroys social interaction. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Recently, there has been a social concern in regards to whether mobile phones have a negative effect in our social communication. Indeed, mobile phones have been widely used for people of all ages, bringing convenience and entertainment into our life. However, as far as I am concerned, I strongly agree with the view that this great invention causes many social problems.In the first place, spending too much time on phones may exert adverse effects on social life. In the first place, as people increasingly tend to focus and relay on phones, they may lose their interest on daily activities like meeting with their friends so that distraction may be developed during study or social activities. Moreover, continuous use of mobile phone may damage both eyesight and physical posture of the children.Furthermore, there are many types of games available in the phone and many of them are very aggressive in nature such as "Iron man". In those games, children are rewarded for being more violent, and this violence is repeated again and again. For instance, many games involve children helping their character to kill or shoot, which many lead to increased aggressive feelings, thoughts and behaviours. Therefore, the hardship of communication may be developed.However, other people may perceive this issue from different viewpoint. With rapid development of the internet, people are able to enjoy quick electronic communication via internet. For instance, as lots of chatting apps available online such as "Weichat", people tend to send instant messages free of charge by using their phones rather than face to face communication. Therefore, mobile phones have shortened the distance of communication.After having considered all the problems that I have discussed above, we can finally draw a conclusion that although mobile phones brings convenience of communication, they also contribute to some social problems.
llm: The widespread use of mobile phones has undoubtedly brought about numerous benefits, including convenience and entertainment, into our daily lives. People of all ages have seamlessly integrated these devices into their routines, making it an indispensable part of modern life. However, as far as I am concerned, I strongly agree with the view that this great invention causes many social problems that cannot be ignored.In the first place, as people increasingly tend to focus and rely on their phones, they may lose their interest in daily activities. This can lead to social isolation, where individuals prefer the virtual world to real-life interactions. For instance, many people would rather spend their time scrolling through social media than engaging in face-to-face conversations with friends and family. This not only hinders meaningful relationships but also erodes essential social skills.Furthermore, the continuous use of mobile phones can have severe physical consequences, particularly for children. Prolonged screen time can damage their eyesight, leading to myopia and other vision-related problems. Additionally, the sedentary nature of mobile phone use can result in poor physical posture, contributing to long-term musculoskeletal issues. This is especially alarming, given the crucial role physical activity plays in a child's overall development.In conclusion, while mobile phones have revolutionized the way we live, it is imperative to acknowledge the social problems they pose. It is our responsibility to ensure that we use these devices judiciously, striking a balance between technology and real-life interactions. By doing so, we can harness the benefits of mobile phones while minimizing their detrimental effects on our social fabric.

question: Modern forms of communication such as email and messaging have reduced the amount of time people spend seeing their friends. This has had a negative effect on their social lives. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Undoubtedly, the movement of modern forms of communication has changed better, which help people to interact to others, such as email and messaging without limitation time. I totally agree that using of these soft devices have cut much of time people need to see with their relatives. However, it is had some demerits on their social lives.Mentioned to societies life style, they constantly use these kinds of electronic letter for making fellowship or just continuing theirs what they already had. Obviousness, there are other ways like social media that they could to use it for meeting theirs buddies such as Twitter and Facebook, also make the communication become feasible and limitless of time.Another perspective, using of these facilities has influenced netizens to keep themselves becoming unsociable. It caused they were swept away by virtual atmosphere, so they do not do much social live interactions with others. The consequence of this case made some people become geek, as too much of using email and messaging, without direct contacts. However, people have had own minded to keep connection with their friends as a good relationship, meet them and talk by face to face directly.In conclusion, I admittedly and strongly agree that the merits of email and messaging have reduced amount of ours time to communicate to. Besides, we need to make sure for the real gathering with our colleague.
llm: The advent of modern forms of communication, such as email and messaging, has revolutionized the way people interact with each other. On one hand, these advancements have made it possible for individuals to connect with others across geographical boundaries and time zones, facilitating global communication without the constraints of time and space. This has enabled people to maintain relationships with friends and acquaintances who may be physically distant, thereby expanding their social circles.On the other hand, I agree that the over-reliance on modern forms of communication has had a negative impact on people's social lives. The ease of sending a message or email can sometimes replace face-to-face interactions, leading to a decline in the quality of relationships. People may spend more time interacting with their screens than engaging in meaningful conversations with friends and family. This can result in feelings of isolation, loneliness, and disconnection, ultimately affecting their mental and emotional well-being.Furthermore, the lack of nonverbal cues and depth in digital communication can lead to misinterpretations and misunderstandings, potentially straining relationships. Additionally, the constant availability of messaging apps can create unrealistic expectations of instant responses, leading to stress and anxiety when these expectations are not met.In conclusion, while modern forms of communication have opened up new avenues for social interaction, it is essential to strike a balance between digital communication and face-to-face interactions. By being mindful of the potential drawbacks of excessive digital communication, people can harness the benefits of modern technology while nurturing their social relationships and overall well-being. Ultimately, it is crucial to recognize that technology is a tool, not a replacement, for human connection.

question: Some people think that a sense of competition in children should be encouraged. Other believe that children who are taught to co-operate rather than compete become more useful adults.
human: It is undeniable that children have an innocent mind, and they requires a proper guidance at a specific time to make them understand the value of life. Some people think that it is better to make them competitive, while other believes to make them co-operative. Both these factors have their own values, and have been discussed in detail below:Competitive children are more likely to be confident enough to handle the situations independently. This factor initially arises from the school, where teacher encourages student to feel more competitive through the grading system, and this is the place where children are trying to get on the top by scoring the highest marks. This factor will lead them to be successful in their lives ahead, but will also restrict them in many ways. For example, MNCs are mainly focusing on a team work, and a person with the competitive mind would be having a difficulty in managing the situation with the team.However, those who wants to create a sense of co-operation in their children is a symbol that they want to make them sensible enough in their lives ahead. Although, they will not be having a pace and an eager to get on the top as the competitors do, but they shall have an art of managing different situations of life with the help of a team.In my opinion, though competitive children will be far more clever and faster than the co-operative child in an initial level, but it will not help them to be on the success path for the long run; while on the contrary, co-operative child will have a potential of structuring and implementing new and innovative ideas with the help of a team.To conclude, I would say that people should create a sense of co-operation in their children to make them feel more accomplished in life.
llm: The debate on whether to encourage a sense of competition or cooperation in children has been ongoing for years. While some argue that competition fosters confidence and independence, others believe that cooperation breeds innovative thinkers and team players. In this essay, we will delve into the merits of both approaches and explore their implications on children's development.On the one hand, competitive children are more likely to be confident enough to handle situations independently. Competition drives them to push beyond their limits, strive for excellence, and develop a strong sense of self-reliance. This confidence can translate to various aspects of life, such as academics, sports, and even professional pursuits. Competitive children learn to set goals, work towards them, and take calculated risks, essential skills for success in today's fast-paced world.On the other hand, co-operative children have the potential to structure and implement new and innovative ideas with the help of a team. When children work together towards a common goal, they learn to appreciate diverse perspectives, share ideas, and build on each other's strengths. This collaborative approach fosters creativity, problem-solving, and adaptability, skills that are highly valued in the modern workplace. By working in teams, children develop essential social skills, such as communication, empathy, and conflict resolution, which are vital for effective teamwork and leadership.Both these factors have their own values, and it is not necessarily a question of either/or. Ideally, children should be encouraged to develop both competitive and cooperative skills. By striking a balance between individual achievement and teamwork, children can develop a unique blend of confidence, creativity, and social skills that will serve them well in all aspects of life. Ultimately, the key is to provide children with a supportive environment that nurtures both their competitive and cooperative instincts, allowing them to grow into well-rounded, capable, and innovative individuals.

question: Nowadays the way many people interact with each other has changed because of technology. In what ways has technology affected the types of relationships people make? Has this become a positive or negative development?
human: Nowadays, the variety of communication systems used widely. As technology develops, it has negative influences in many respects. However, I strongly agree with that the technology has large positive effects on relationships between people. The main advantage is that technology has enabled people stay in contact with each other more closely. While public use the Internet or smart phone to share information to each other at different positions. Instead of using letters, technology advanced not only gives us more spare time but also convenient and efficient. More, even if family members who are in different countries, they also can use the Internet to connect each others, especially though the images or videos, they can feel close. Furthermore, technology is also essential for students, live in remote districts, shared the valuable natural resources with friends. Another issue is that in the ever-accelerated updating of science and technology, technology provides opportunities for people to establish the social network. In the past, people might have had pen friends in other countries, but now, thanks to the social networking websites, people can easily to find someone who has similar interests. Also, they can connect with friends who have been out of touch for a long time by using the Internet. In this way, technology is beneficial to humanity develops positive relationships. In conclusion, I agree with that the technology has more optimal effects on people's interaction, because it helps ordinary people to make new friends and to maintain relationships.
llm: The advent of technology has undoubtedly revolutionized the way people interact with each other, transforming the dynamics of relationships in profound ways. While technology has been blamed for eroding traditional forms of communication and fostering social isolation, I firmly believe that its benefits far outweigh its drawbacks, positively impacting the relationships people form and maintain.On the one hand, it is undeniable that technology has negative influences in many respects. The proliferation of social media platforms, for instance, has been linked to increased feelings of loneliness and disconnection. The curated online personas people present often create unrealistic expectations and promote comparison, leading to feelings of inadequacy and low self-esteem. Furthermore, the ease of digital communication can sometimes lead to shallow relationships, where meaningful interactions are sacrificed for the sake of convenience and brevity.However, I strongly agree that technology has large positive effects on relationships between people. Social media, for example, has enabled people to connect with others across geographical distances, fostering global communities and friendships that transcend borders. Video conferencing tools have also made it possible for people to maintain relationships despite physical distance, ensuring that loved ones can stay in touch regardless of their location. Moreover, technology has provided a platform for people to find and connect with others who share similar interests and passions, facilitating the formation of meaningful relationships that may not have been possible otherwise.In conclusion, while technology has its drawbacks, its positive impact on relationships far outweighs its negative influences. By providing a platform for global connectivity, fostering meaningful relationships, and facilitating communication across distances, technology has revolutionized the way people interact with each other. As technology continues to evolve, it is likely that its positive effects on relationships will only continue to grow, enriching our personal and professional lives in ways previously unimaginable.

question: When a country develops its technology, the traditional skills and ways of life die out. It is pointless to try and keep them alive. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: With the development of technology, whether or not it is still necessary to protect the traditional skills and lifestyles leads to a drastic controversy which is becoming a public concern, especially considering the significant impact taken by technology. As far as I am concerned, the importance of traditions should be valued and paid attention to.Traditional skills and lifestyles play important role in modern society, in terms of healthcare, environmental protection and cultural inherit. Although technology takes convenience to humankind, it also contributes to unhealthy behaviors of life, like sedentary lifestyle. Instead, traditional ways of life is a great complimentary for modern life and highlight the importance of work life balance. Meanwhile, due to the fact that traditional skills rely little on fossil energy, it is more environmentally-friendly, which should be promoted to reduce the threat of climate change. Furthermore those tradition-related things convey traditional culture and values. These are important foundation of modern civilization. Protection of tradition can provide the possibility to better understand ancient culture and utilize them to tackle modern problems.Some people who hold different viewpoints may advocate that protecting traditions consume too much financial budget compared with the incoming it takes. In spite of the fact this kind of business bring limited contribution to government finance, it should be emphasized that the expense is trivial compared with the potential value of traditions. Therefore the government authorities and education institutes should work closely together to promote the traditional skills and ways of life, so as to make people to realize the value of them.All in all, protection of tradition is not only important for the entire society currently, but also contributes to the next generation.
llm: The notion that traditional skills and ways of life become obsolete with the advancement of technology is a topic of ongoing debate. While some argue that it is pointless to try and keep them alive, I strongly disagree with this opinion. Traditional skills and lifestyles continue to play a vital role in modern society, contributing significantly to healthcare, environmental protection, and cultural heritage.On one hand, traditional skills and lifestyles offer valuable insights into ancient practices that can be utilized to tackle modern problems. For instance, many indigenous communities have developed unique medical practices that have been proven to be effective in treating various ailments. By studying and preserving these traditional practices, we can gain a deeper understanding of the medicinal properties of plants and develop new treatments for diseases. Furthermore, traditional farming practices have been shown to be more environmentally sustainable, promoting biodiversity and soil conservation.On the other hand, the protection of traditional skills and lifestyles is crucial for preserving cultural heritage. Many traditional practices are deeply rooted in a community's history and identity, and their loss would result in a significant cultural deficit. Moreover, the preservation of traditional skills and lifestyles provides a unique opportunity for cultural exchange and education. By learning about and appreciating traditional practices, we can foster greater cross-cultural understanding and respect.In conclusion, while technology has undoubtedly transformed modern society, it is essential to recognize the value of traditional skills and lifestyles. Rather than allowing them to die out, we should strive to preserve and promote them, recognizing their contributions to healthcare, environmental protection, and cultural heritage. By doing so, we can ensure that our rich cultural diversity is preserved for future generations and that we can continue to learn from and be inspired by the wisdom of the past.

question: Some people think that a sense of competition in children should be encouraged. Others believe that children who are taught to be co-operate rather than compete become more useful adults. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
human: In present educational system there are variety of competitions in academic area and athletic area for children to attend, which could stimulating the will of children to learn and to achieve the best of them, and also be able to teach them teamwork skill. However, some people think it is better to make children be competitive than cooperative, both the values have its arguments.A strong competition sense helps children having urge to learn or to practice for being the best among peers, and this factor is initially arises from the schools and parents, to encourage children to get the highest scores through the grading system. Even though a competitive child is usually more motivated to pursue a goal or to face difficulties independently, but it is also risky that children are becoming too competitive to cooperating with others. Being competitive leads them to success, but could also restrict them in many ways. For example, it might be hard for a competitive person to deal or manage in a team work project.On the other hand, cooperation is also an essential quality for children, no matter in school activities or in communities. Having a good cooperating spirit helps kids to communicate and get along with others, which gives them more possibility to solve problems or to achieve a goal easily by working as a team. After all, in society, there is hardly anyone who could has big achievement by oneself. For example, famous singers or movie stars, despite of their talent to make them successful, there are always a team to manage works or deal with things.In my point of view, though competitive child would have more motivation and perspective that leads them to success, but it would not help them much once they enter to society or company which required more about skill of team work. To sum up, I would say that schools and adults should put a sense of cooperation in children to make them becoming a useful adult whether in society or community.
llm: The debate surrounding whether to encourage a sense of competition or cooperation in children has been a longstanding one. While some people believe that fostering a competitive spirit in children is beneficial, others argue that teaching them to cooperate is more valuable. In this essay, we will discuss both views and provide our opinion on the matter.On the one hand, some people think that it is better to make children competitive than cooperative. They argue that a strong sense of competition helps children develop an urge to learn and practice, striving to be the best among their peers. This competitive spirit can drive them to achieve academic excellence, win sports competitions, and excel in extracurricular activities. Moreover, a competitive environment can prepare children for the real world, where they will face challenges and need to compete for resources, jobs, and recognition.On the other hand, cooperation is also an essential quality for children to develop. By working together towards a common goal, children learn important skills such as communication, empathy, and problem-solving. In school activities and community projects, cooperation is crucial for achieving success. Furthermore, cooperation helps children develop social skills, build strong relationships, and understand the value of teamwork. It also teaches them to appreciate diversity, respect each other's opinions, and resolve conflicts peacefully.In conclusion, both competition and cooperation have their own arguments and benefits. While competition can drive children to achieve excellence, cooperation teaches them valuable social skills and prepares them for teamwork. As a student, I believe that a balance between both is necessary. Children should be encouraged to develop a competitive spirit, but also learn to cooperate and work together towards a common goal. By doing so, they will become well-rounded individuals, equipped with the skills and qualities necessary to succeed in all aspects of life.

question: Some people think that advertising give more harms than good to our society. Other refute this. Discuss both views and give your opinion
human: On these days, with the assistance of advertisement, people easily purchase the best products with detailed information and instruction for their requirement. Although some people claim that the advantages of advertising are outweigh the advantages, I believe that advertisement bring more benefits than harms to our lives.On the one hand, it is clear that most advertisements so exaggerate the quality of their products that they often ignore some negative effects of what they sell. In addition to this, all of things are advertised as the best ones result in the confusing for users in picking out the most suitable goods. For example, some kinds of shampoo, namely Sunsilk, Clear, Dove are publicized as magic items to recreate injured hair with the number of other benefits. However, the fact is that not all customers are satisfied with what they bought under the introduction from advertisement. On the other hand, it is undeniable fact that advertising market gives lots of working opportunities from producers, writers to models and cameramen for all of people as long as their qualification adapt to the demands. Moreover, advertisement enables to support users in getting accustomed to enterprises and know thoroughly items sold from these producers. Take Coca cola for an example, this drinking firm is well-known as one of companies invested a major part of their money in advertising. No wonder why this drinking title becomes more and more familiar with customers around the world. Last but not least, online advertisement is one of the easiest approaches due to their potential gains such as cheaper cost, convenience and easily observing.To sum up, everything has its own gains and losses and advertisement is not an exception. From my point of view, advertising will be better if producers and advertisers are more honest in producing advertisements to give people the general view on one product.
llm: The impact of advertising on our society is a topic of debate among people. While some argue that advertising brings more harm than good, others refute this claim. In this essay, we will discuss both views and present my opinion on the matter.On the one hand, some people claim that the advantages of advertisement outweigh the harms to our lives. They argue that advertising informs consumers about new products and services, helps businesses to reach their target audience, and creates a sense of competition in the market, which can lead to better quality products and lower prices. Furthermore, it is undeniable that the advertising market gives lots of working opportunities to people, from producers and writers to models and cameramen.On the other hand, others argue that advertising has more negative effects on our society. For instance, it can create unrealistic expectations and promote materialism, leading to overspending and debt. Additionally, some advertisements can be misleading or deceptive, which can harm consumers. Others argue that advertising can also contribute to the erosion of traditional values and cultural norms.In recent years, online advertisement has become one of the easiest approaches for businesses to reach their target audience. Online advertisements have several potential gains, including cheaper costs, convenience, and the ability to easily observe the effectiveness of the advertisement. However, online advertising also raises concerns about privacy and the potential for cyberbullying.In my opinion, while advertising can have some negative effects, its benefits outweigh its harms. Advertising is a necessary part of a functioning market economy, and it provides many benefits to consumers and businesses alike. However, it is important for businesses and regulatory bodies to ensure that advertisements are truthful and do not promote harmful products or behaviors.

question: Some modern artists receive huge sums of money for the things they create, while other struggle to survive. Government should take steps to resolve this unfair situation. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: The amount of money people earning sometimes is unfair. In a field of art, modern artist may receive high salary for their masterpiece creation while labors should be break their bone for years to get similar amount of money. Although some people view that government should be take a responsibility for this unfair situation, critics against such view. I agree that in this occasion the government is not granted to hand in.Proficiency brings perfectness in terms of art work. It is true while the modern artists who implement their creative thinking onto high value creation are paid with immense sum by the art collector. Also, the high sum which modern artists receive is related to the quality instead of the quantity and their rare talent. For example, a 15 centimeter Buddha temple made by hand is granted times in comparison with factory production. On the other hand, modern artists also devote themselves find a unique concept in which ordinary people cannot do, such making impossible become possible. Pieter Padang, Minion creator, has brilliant idea to alter part of song lyric "I swear" become "underwear" when the Minion sing in Despicable Me. He granted huge sums for such idea.Striking contrast, labor working in the merchandise factory receive coin of dollar even they make a hundred of 15 cm Buddha temples a day. In any case, a musician playing "I swear" several times receives different earnings that Padang got because the musician re-plays the song without any creation. Moreover, government cannot equalize the price of creation of modern artist because there is no certain parameter to value it, art value is about taste.Having said that the huge sums of modern artists receives related to their struggle in the field of art, while the term of struggle might different with other field of job. I agree that government cannot take steps to make the salary between modern artists and other job similar because art price is about taste.
llm: The art world has long been plagued by a stark contrast between the financial fortunes of modern artists. While some creatives are lavished with exorbitant sums for their works, others struggle to make ends meet. This glaring disparity has sparked a contentious debate: should the government intervene to rectify this situation?On one hand, the current state of affairs is indeed unfair. A modern artist may receive a hefty paycheck for a single masterpiece, while laborers toil for years to earn a similar amount. This raises questions about the value we place on different types of work. It is arguable that the government should take steps to address this inequity, ensuring that all individuals, regardless of their profession, are fairly compensated for their efforts.On the other hand, critics of government intervention argue that the art market is subject to the forces of supply and demand, and that the prices of artworks are determined by what buyers are willing to pay. They contend that government meddling would disrupt the natural market equilibrium and potentially stifle artistic innovation. Moreover, it is challenging for the government to determine the value of artistic creations, as it is often subjective and influenced by factors like cultural significance, originality, and aesthetic appeal.In conclusion, while the government may have a role to play in addressing the financial disparities within the art world, its intervention should be approached with caution. A balanced solution could involve initiatives that provide support for struggling artists, such as grants, subsidies, or affordable studio spaces, rather than direct market manipulation. By adopting a nuanced approach, the government can help mitigate the unfair situation without stifling the creative industry.

question: People tend to work longer hours nowadays. Working long hours has a negative effect on themselves, their families and the society, so working hours should be restricted. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Working longer hours is becoming prevalent in these days. There is a saying in my native village, "Health is Wealth". I believe many of people including me are not really considering the importance of health. The need for increased working hours might be because of enhanced competitive environment and desire to acquire much money and promotion. However, people working for extended hours have been found having adverse effects on their health and personal life. In my opinion, a balance between personal and professional life should be created by restricting maximum number of working hours. First of all, many of us would agree to the fact that people; who prefer working longer hours, do not find time to focus on their health. By working too long, they often become tired, lazy and reluctant to carry out physical exercise in order to remain fit and healthy and eventually loose health and become sick. Moreover, they become extensively addicted to their work and become workaholic type persons. The repercussion are so severe that their families and friends remain deprived off their attention and in the end they end up losing balance between their family and personal life.Secondly, these workaholic people do not spend time for the contribution of society by actively participating in any social campaign. As they usually remain busy in their office so they do not find leisure time for such social activities. For instance, I would take my boss's example; he has been working for extended hours in office for many years. Recently, his health and personal life was drastically affected as he broke up with his wife and his family life has totally been in chaos and cries. He started regretting afterwards and now trying to manage his work but it seems to be too late for him.To conclude this, I would strongly emphasis and recommend, Government must include the clause of maximum number of working hours in its Labor Law and enforce to all companies for ensuring their employees do not spend extended hours in companies. This will help in uplift of society, and bring the lost equilibrium between personal and professional life of each individual person.
llm: The notion that people should work longer hours has become a pervasive trend in today's fast-paced society. However, I strongly agree that working extended hours has a detrimental impact on individuals, their families, and society as a whole, and therefore, working hours should be restricted.Research has consistently shown that people who work long hours are more likely to experience adverse effects on their physical and mental health, as well as their personal lives. Prolonged working hours can lead to chronic fatigue, making individuals feel lethargic and apathetic, ultimately resulting in a lack of motivation to engage in physical exercise, a crucial aspect of maintaining a healthy lifestyle. This sedentary lifestyle can exacerbate health problems, such as obesity, diabetes, and cardiovascular disease.Furthermore, working excessively long hours can lead to an unhealthy addiction to work, transforming individuals into "workaholics." This obsessive behavior can cause burnout, strain relationships with family and friends, and disrupt work-life balance. The consequences of this addiction can be far-reaching, affecting not only the individual but also their loved ones. Families may suffer from neglect, as parents or spouses devote excessive time to their jobs, leading to feelings of abandonment and resentment.Additionally, the societal implications of prolonged working hours are also noteworthy. Overworked employees are less productive, more prone to errors, and may experience decreased job satisfaction, ultimately affecting the overall quality of work. Moreover, the lack of leisure time can lead to a decline in community engagement, cultural participation, and social cohesion, which are essential for a healthy and thriving society.In conclusion, the negative effects of working long hours on individuals, families, and society are undeniable. Therefore, it is essential to restrict working hours to promote a better work-life balance, reduce health risks, and foster a more productive and harmonious society.

question: A successful person is one who has earned a lot of money. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: It's such a common definition of a successful person is one who has earned a lot of money, especially in nowadays society. Each individual visualize success differently. Still, my term of a successful man is one who has certain achievements in life rather than the one with a high income.Money is undeniably pivotal, but ways of earning it is also various. A person's great prosperity does not state that he has gained it ethically by himself. Nevertheless, a man can only achieve his accomplishment through hard-working, dedication and passion. Whether it is a personal or a social achievement, that man is laudable.More importantly, the more beneficial for the society his achievement is, the more successful he is considered. For instance, Thomas Edison is undeniably considered as one of the greatest inventors in the 20th century since his invention's productivity is countless useful for mankind. On the other hand, the fact of knowing a man's utilization of his money remains in the dark. Therefore, judging a person by his income is difficult, especially in the success aspect.In conclusion, using only money as a scale to measure a man's success is impossible despite the fact that it is the essential in basic needs. Yet, it is the common scene that a man can be publicly considered successful when his achievements, which can only accomplished by passion, dedication and ethics, are helpful not only for himself.
llm: The idea that a successful person is one who has earned a lot of money is a widely held notion in today's society. However, I disagree with this perspective, as I believe that success encompasses a broader range of achievements beyond mere financial gain.In my opinion, a truly successful individual is one who has attained certain accomplishments in life, such as personal growth, meaningful relationships, and contributions to the community. These achievements are not necessarily measured by one's bank account, but rather by the positive impact they have on others and the sense of fulfillment they bring to the individual. For instance, a person who has dedicated their life to a noble cause, such as working for a non-profit organization or volunteering for a worthy charity, can be considered successful, regardless of their financial compensation.It is undeniable that money plays a significant role in our lives, providing us with the means to sustain ourselves and pursue our passions. However, the ways of earning it are diverse, and not all successful individuals have amassed wealth through lucrative careers or business ventures. Some may have achieved success through hard work, dedication, and passion in their chosen field, regardless of the financial rewards.Ultimately, a person's accomplishments are a direct result of their efforts, perseverance, and commitment to their goals. A successful person is one who has strived to achieve their aspirations, overcome obstacles, and remained true to their values. While financial success may be a byproduct of these efforts, it is not the sole defining factor of a person's success. Therefore, I firmly believe that success encompasses a broader range of achievements than just financial gain, and that a successful person is one who has attained personal fulfillment and made a positive impact on the world.

question: Question: Today, the high sales of popular consumer goods reflect the power of advertising and not the real needs of the society in which there are sold. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Nowdays, people's choice of consumption is heavily affected by various of advertising on television, street, magazine etc. This argument may be true that people will be swayed by the advertising and buy things they do not need it for their life. For example, in most asian countries, advertisement company usually hire popular singers or actors to advertise the products to boosts the sales, and some people, especially adolescent may buy things from their favourite singer advertised to support their idol instead of to fill their needs.In addition, products usually look more gorgeous and with good quality in advertisement, people are more likely to buy goods impulsively without a second thought. A good advertisement can convince people to believe that it is what they want, even though it is not the real needs of the society. And there are always people purchase particular products swayed by advertising which makes it a trend to follow for other people who is unnecessarily need it.However, buying habit is a very personal things for individuals, the advertisement is not the only cause for people to buy, sometimes it depends on one's needs and ability of consumption. It is unlikely to buy things impulsively for adults who have concern of arranging disposable income. Most of them have to allocate the money if they doing other purchase. On the other hand, children and adolescents who is not economic independence is more possible to buy things impulsively without considering whether they need it or not, since they do not have financial pressure from life and ability to define what is necessary.In my opinion, I think buying habit is people's choice to make, not entirely affected by advertisements. But for children or adolescents who is not mentally develop, it might be hard for them not to swayed by advertising. So it is important that government needs to impose rules on particularly advertisement company (for example, toys company) to avoid youngster have bias thought on what they really need.
llm: The notion that high sales of popular consumer goods are driven by the power of advertising rather than real societal needs has been a topic of debate. While it is true that advertising plays a significant role in shaping consumer behavior, I only partially agree with this statement.In today's world, people's choice of consumption is heavily influenced by various forms of advertising, including those on television, streets, and magazines. Advertisers use persuasive techniques to create a perceived need for their products, often successfully convincing people to buy things they do not necessarily need. This can lead to a phenomenon where people prioritize material possessions over essential goods and services. For instance, the widespread desire for luxury brands and the latest gadgets can be attributed, in part, to the effective advertising strategies employed by these companies.However, it is essential to recognize that buying habits are highly personal and influenced by a multitude of factors, including individual needs and financial capabilities. While advertising can certainly sway people's purchasing decisions, it is not the sole determinant. Many people prioritize their spending based on their real needs, and advertising merely provides information to aid in their decision-making process. Furthermore, consumers are becoming increasingly discerning, with many individuals actively seeking out reviews, comparing products, and making informed choices that align with their values and requirements.In conclusion, while advertising undoubtedly has a significant impact on consumer behavior, it is not the only driving force behind the high sales of popular consumer goods. Personal needs and consumption abilities also play a crucial role in shaping purchasing decisions. Therefore, I only partially agree with the statement, recognizing the influence of advertising while acknowledging the complexity of individual consumer behavior.

question: Some people think that by paying taxes they made enough contribution to their society. TO what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Paying taxes is the obligation of citizens in almost every country. Some people believe that they have made enough contribution to the country by doing that. Personally, I tend to disagree with this view.To start with, all people who are able to work should pay tax to the government, as it is the most important source of government's revenue, which is mainly used to serve all citizens. For example, a large proportion of the tax is spent on national defence and in maintaining social stability, so that every one can work and live in a peaceful environment. The tax is also used to pay the salaries of workers working in public service sectors, such as teachers and police officers. Although these workers do not produce profit directly, what they do is for the well-being of the whole society.However, I would argue that citizens have other important responsibilities to fulfil apart from paying tax. As we know, there are impoverished or disabled people in every society, needing help and support from others. It is true that the government can provide some fund to ease their difficulties, but such financial help is usually far from enough. In such case, aids from more capable or wealthier citizens are particularly crucial, which are a great complement to government support. Another responsibility all citizens should take is to maintain social stability together with the police force. There are criminals in every society, and the number of policemen the government can hire is limited. So it is quite necessary for the local residents to take actions and ensure the safety of the communities, by doing things like reporting suspicious activities to the police department.In conclusion, it is a significant obligation of citizens to pay tax to the government. Other than that, they have other critical obligations to take, in order to make our society function in an ordered way.
llm: The notion that paying taxes is enough contribution to society is a debatable topic. While paying taxes is the obligation of citizens in almost every country, I would argue that citizens have other important responsibilities to fulfill apart from paying taxes.On the one hand, taxes play a vital role in supporting public goods and services that benefit society as a whole. The revenue generated from taxes is used to fund infrastructure, education, healthcare, and social welfare programs. In this sense, paying taxes is a necessary contribution to the well-being of society. However, I disagree with the idea that paying taxes is enough.There are impoverished or disabled people in every society who need help and support from others. These individuals often require assistance that goes beyond what the government can provide. Volunteering, donating to charity, and participating in community service are all essential ways that citizens can contribute to society. By engaging in these activities, citizens can make a tangible difference in the lives of those in need. Furthermore, active citizenship involves not only paying taxes but also participating in the democratic process, staying informed about local issues, and advocating for positive change.In conclusion, while paying taxes is an important responsibility of citizens, it is not enough to consider it the only contribution to society. Citizens have a range of responsibilities to fulfill, including volunteering, donating to charity, and participating in community service. By recognizing the value of these activities, we can work towards creating a more compassionate and engaged society.

question: School should teach children the academic subje cts which have a close relationship with their future careers, so other subjects like music and sports are not important. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: People have many different views about what subjects should be taught in school. Although I accept that students have to study many subjects in school, I disagree with the idea that unimportant subjects such as music and sports should be got rid of the program.Many people believe that students only need to study academic subjects like mathematics, physics because these subject are necessary for students' future. This is understandable when labor market now has high competition; students have to meet requirements regard of qualification. In addition, the unemployment rate is always high, so their parents want children to study these subjects which can help students have a job. Although those above reasons are acceptable, I would argue that there are many things much more important than having a job. Firstly, studying music, art or sports is also very important to students. This enables students to develop their potentials through discovering the natural world around them. Secondly, to get a job in labor market, not only do students require hard skills but also soft skills such as teamwork, presentation. For instance, through taking part in a sport, students can understand team spirit and learn lessons about teamwork skills. Therefore, these subjects might fulfil the students' ability. Finally, children's future do not depend heavily on the academic subjects they study in school, it is the result of their efforts and capacity.In conclusion, although the academic subjects play a primary role in nurturing children, it seem to me that the effects of learning music, sports are profound.
llm: The idea that schools should focus solely on teaching academic subjects closely related to future careers, thereby relegating subjects like music and sports to secondary importance, is a notion that garnishes significant debate. Many people believe that students only need to study academic subjects such as mathematics, physics, and engineering because these subjects are deemed necessary for securing well-paying jobs in the future. However, I strongly disagree with this perspective, as I believe there are many things far more important than merely having a job.Firstly, subjects like music and sports play a pivotal role in a child's holistic development. Music, for instance, enhances cognitive skills, memory, and spatial-temporal skills, all of which can indirectly benefit academic performance. Similarly, sports contribute to physical health, team building, and stress management - essential life skills that cannot be overlooked. By integrating these subjects into the curriculum, schools can foster well-rounded individuals equipped to handle the demands of life beyond their careers.Secondly, the value of education extends far beyond career preparation. Education is meant to enrich lives, foster curiosity, and create informed, empathetic members of society. Music and arts, in particular, offer perspectives and understanding of diverse cultures, histories, and human experiences, thereby broadening one's worldview. By sidelining these subjects, we risk producing a generation that, while professionally adept, lacks the depth and breadth of knowledge needed to navigate our complex world.Furthermore, many careers now value skills such as creativity, teamwork, and adaptability - skills that are often developed through extracurricular activities like music and sports. By dismissing these subjects, we may inadvertently disadvantage our students in their future professional pursuits.In conclusion, while academic subjects are undeniably crucial, it is misguided to believe that they are the sole purpose of education. Music, sports, and other often-overlooked subjects play vital roles in the development of well-rounded, informed, and happy individuals. Therefore, I strongly believe that schools should continue to value and teach a diverse range of subjects, ensuring that future generations are equipped with the knowledge, skills, and character needed to thrive in all aspects of life.

question: Some people believe that information available in the internet will end the era of newspapers and magazines. Do you agree or disagree? Give your own opinion and examples.
human: Digital media has been extremely popular among people around the globe. With this advancement, newspapers and magazines are struggling to justify their existence. Some believe that traditional paper media will come to an end very soon due to the increased usage of internet based media. But many other still thinks they are going to stay. I agree to the argument that newspapers and magazines will be history with the time. I will establish my view by analysing how internet presents the information about the current affair so fast and the accessibility to the historical news.A very important responsibility of media is to publish information about the current affairs as quickly as possible specially when there is a crisis. This helps readers to get updated and act accordingly. For example, when the aircraft MH 370 went missing, everyone wanted to know the details about this tragic incident. The friends and families of passengers and crews were impatient to know the truth. In such situations, newspapers and magazines can not respond as fast as digital media. Instead of waiting for next publication, people can get trustworthy information about the current incidents from internet within an hour or two. This explains why digital media will rule over paper and magazines.People often want to access news from past for various reasons like to prepare for research, satisfy interest, etc. For example, one research fellow may want to know how a small village named Oramaki in Japan was suffering after Second World War. It is very difficult to get this sort of information from past in newspapers and magazines as one has to know before where to look at. But internet provides efficient search facility where one can search the topic and get the details. This feature of digital media is not supported by newspapers and magazines.To conclude, the fast responding internet media with vast information will be replacing newspapers and magazines as new and information provider for valid reasons. Though considering the current infrastructure and mindset of people, paper media will continue for another few years.
llm: The advent of the internet has led to a significant shift in the way people consume information, with many believing that this will ultimately lead to the demise of traditional paper media, such as newspapers and magazines. Some believe that traditional paper media will come to an end very soon due to the increased usage of internet-based media. However, many others still think they are going to stay. In my opinion, I agree with the argument that newspapers and magazines will be history with time.The internet has made it possible for people to access a vast amount of information from anywhere in the world, at any time. This has led to a decline in the sales of newspapers and magazines, as people are no longer reliant on them for their daily dose of news and information. Moreover, online news websites and blogs have made it possible for people to stay updated on current events in real-time, making traditional paper media seem outdated and slow. Additionally, the environmental impact of paper media, such as deforestation and waste, has led many to opt for digital alternatives.Furthermore, the rise of social media has also contributed to the decline of traditional paper media. Many people now get their news and information from social media platforms, such as Twitter and Facebook, rather than from newspapers and magazines. This shift in consumer behavior has forced many traditional paper media outlets to go online, in an attempt to stay relevant. However, this shift has also led to a decline in the quality of journalism, as online news outlets often prioritize clicks and shares over in-depth reporting and investigative journalism.In conclusion, while some people may still prefer traditional paper media, I believe that the internet has marked the beginning of the end for newspapers and magazines. As technology continues to advance and more people turn to the internet for their news and information, it is likely that traditional paper media will become a relic of the past.

question: When choosing a job, the salary is the most important consideration. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: In many societies, choice of a job depends on the size of the salary offered. Nevertheless, while I admit that the salary is very pivotal factor, I claim that there are other equally vital aspects that need to be considered in this regard.To begin with, I agree that in order for people to cover their daily and general needs they need money as well. However, aspects such as: friendly colleagues, environment and work-place condition, sometimes, have even more impact on person's happiness and quality of life. People, for instance, who don't like their co-workers and working condition are considered less satisfied with their jobs, despite of a high salary. In this sense, it is also one very salient proof of the accuracy of my position.Further and even more importantly, most of the satisfaction of a job comes to people from their professional achievements, skills and the position they reach. In other words, career promotion or getting some kind of credit from the administration of a company or organization are, likely, more enjoyable achievements than getting a high salary. For example, people, who work in monotonous jobs, where no achievements or a new positions can be reached feel themselves more dissatisfied, even though they have a very good salaries.In conclusion, I disagree with the idea that salary outweighs any other motivators, as there are other even more important aspects such as: friendly co-workers, working conditions and professional achievements.
llm: When it comes to choosing a job, many people prioritize salary as the most important consideration. While a decent salary is undeniably crucial for a comfortable life, I disagree that it is the only factor to consider. In many societies, the size of the salary offered often influences an individual's decision, but I firmly believe that other aspects play a significant role in determining one's overall job satisfaction and quality of life.Firstly, a job with friendly colleagues can greatly enhance one's work experience. A supportive and collaborative work environment fosters a sense of belonging, reducing stress and increasing motivation. A harmonious workplace culture can lead to stronger relationships, improved communication, and a more positive attitude towards work. Conversely, a toxic work environment can lead to burnout, anxiety, and a decrease in job satisfaction, regardless of the salary.Secondly, the physical and psychological environment of the workplace is equally important. A well-designed and well-maintained workspace can boost productivity, concentration, and overall well-being. Moreover, a safe and healthy work environment is essential for preventing work-related injuries and illnesses. A job that offers a healthy work-life balance, flexible working hours, and opportunities for growth and development can also contribute significantly to an individual's happiness and job satisfaction.In conclusion, while a decent salary is essential for a comfortable life, it is not the only consideration when choosing a job. Friendly colleagues, a positive work environment, and favorable work-place conditions can have a more profound impact on a person's happiness and quality of life. Therefore, it is crucial to consider these aspects when evaluating job opportunities, rather than solely focusing on the salary offered.

question: Using a computer every day can have more negative than positive effects on children. Do you agree or disagree?
human: In today's world, computer is an essential part of everyday life. Around the globe, the effect is evident on children also. It is disagreed that computer can affect children in a negative way if they use a computer on a daily basis. This will be proven by analyzing how computer assists children to use vast resources available over internet to study effectively as well as develop some basic skills which help them in future careers.The best thing about internet is the availability of information in the form of text, image or video related to almost everything and through computer children can access internet to gather knowledge on the subjects they are studying or they are interested about. As an example, students preparing for delivering speech on a certain topic can browse through internet to learn each and every minute details of the subject matter. It's hard to get everything at a same place unless children are not familiar with computers. That is how, computer impacts children on a positive note.Nowadays, computers enable people to prepare presentations, draw complex graphs and pictures, document thesis in a simple though efficient way. When children are allowed to play around with computer from a very early age, they get acquainted with the previously mentioned skills and become expert before facing professional world. For instance, students who used to prepare Microsoft PowerPoint presentation for their school projects, get an edge over others at an early stage of their career. From this, it's clear that computer has a positive effect on the children.Following the demonstration of a computer's contribution in children's study and building skills which are to be used in their career afterwards, it is agreed that computer is a boon to children. However, parents should advise and guide their children properly so that they don't get misled.
llm: Using a computer every day is a widespread phenomenon in today's world, where technology has become an essential part of everyday life. The impact of computers is evident globally, and children are no exception. However, I disagree with the notion that using a computer daily can have more negative than positive effects on children.On the contrary, I firmly believe that computers have a profoundly positive impact on children's lives, especially when used daily. One of the primary advantages of computers is the vast resources available on the internet. The internet provides children with an unparalleled wealth of information, educational resources, and learning tools. By using computers daily, children can tap into this vast repository of knowledge, which can significantly enhance their learning experience.The internet offers a wide range of educational websites, online libraries, and learning platforms that cater to different age groups and learning styles. These resources can help children develop their language skills, improve their understanding of complex concepts, and explore their interests in a more engaging and interactive way. Moreover, computers also provide children with opportunities to develop essential skills such as critical thinking, problem-solving, and digital literacy, which are crucial for their future success in an increasingly technology-driven world.Furthermore, computers also enable children to access online educational resources that may not be available in their local schools or communities. This can be particularly beneficial for children from disadvantaged backgrounds or those living in remote areas, where access to quality education may be limited.In conclusion, while there may be some negative effects associated with excessive computer use, I firmly believe that the benefits of using a computer daily far outweigh the drawbacks for children. By leveraging the vast resources available on the internet, computers can provide children with a wealth of knowledge, skills, and opportunities that can help them succeed in life.

question: Children who are brought up in families that do not have large amounts of money are better prepared to deal with the problems of adult life than children brought up by wealthy parents. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: According to some people, child who is brought up in less well-off family is more quick-witted and can tackle with an adult life problems better than who is from affluent ones. However, I completely disagree with this position.To begin with, children from poorer families are prone to have bad habits such as: crime, thievery and thuggery. Moreover, these people will not have an access to a good education. As a result, they can be proselytized into bad isms. For example, most of the terroristic groups try to attract uneducated people, because the person with better education has a wider outlook, which will allow no brainwash. In this sense, people with lower level of education have more proneness to be attracted in such isms.Nevertheless, people who are born in well-off families have access to good education, which will have a positive impact on their later life. Secondly, children from rich families have better skills on how to use money, because they use it a lot of times. Finally, wealthy families can afford better health services and costly medicines, which will be very beneficial for the health of a child. For instance, many good medicines cost vast amounts of money, which cannot be afforded by poorer families.In conclusion, I disagree with the opinion that children who are brought up in less well-of families are, likely, more successful in the future life due to aforementioned reasons.
llm: The notion that children from less affluent families are better prepared to tackle the problems of adult life has been a subject of debate. According to some people, a child who is brought up in a less well-off family is more quick-witted and can tackle the problems of adult life better than one from an affluent family. However, I completely disagree with this position.To begin with, children from poorer families are more prone to developing bad habits, such as crime, thievery, and thuggery. Growing up in an environment where financial struggles are a daily reality can often lead to desperation and a lack of opportunities, causing some individuals to turn to illicit activities. Moreover, these individuals will often not have access to good education, which is a crucial tool for preparing one for the challenges of adulthood. Without a proper education, they may lack the skills and knowledge necessary to navigate the complexities of adult life.On the other hand, children from wealthy families are more likely to have access to quality education, extracurricular activities, and resources that can help them develop important life skills. While it is true that some children from wealthy families may be sheltered from the harsh realities of life, many are also taught the value of hard work, discipline, and responsibility. These traits are essential for overcoming the obstacles that inevitably arise in adulthood.Furthermore, children from affluent families are more likely to have a support system in place, which can provide them with a safety net in times of need. This support system can be a crucial factor in helping them overcome the challenges of adult life.In conclusion, while it is possible for children from less affluent families to develop the skills and resilience necessary to tackle the problems of adult life, I firmly believe that children from wealthy families are better prepared. With access to quality education, resources, and a support system, they are more likely to have the tools necessary to navigate the complexities of adulthood.

question: Many of the medical problems that people are experiencing in today's world are due to the fact that we have a very sedentary lifestyle. To what extend do you agree or disagree.
human: It is certainly true that modern people are facing up to a new health problems and ailments than before. Many people claim that it is because of sedentary lifestlyle. However, while I accept that sedentary lifestyle is one of the key factors, I believe that some other factors are having even a greater impact.To begin with, I agree that sedentary lifestyle lead to many serious health problems. The main reason why people are becoming so addicted to sitting at their homes even for the whole day is an advance technology. In earlier times, for instance, even the types of entertainment tools were not in large numbers and all of them required physical presence and as a result they had more outdoor activities. Nowadays people, especially inhabitants of cities, are spending most of their time on sitting in front of TV or other tools.Nevertheless, there are some other causes why people are experiencing serious medical problems. Firstly, the environment of the modern world polluted very significantly from greenhouse gas emissions and other gasses. Many people, for example, are suffering from allergy because of these gasses. Secondly, foods with a low quality such as fast foods, junk foods and any genetically modified ones are influencing to our health very negatively. Finally, life becoming more stressful due to some recent problems such as traffic gam, traffic accidents and others.Given these evidences, it can be seen that people are facing up with many recently appeared illnesses due to aforementioned reasons.
llm: The notion that a sedentary lifestyle is the primary cause of many medical problems people face today has gained significant attention in recent years. Indeed, modern people are experiencing a multitude of health issues that were less prevalent in the past. Proponents of this view argue that the lack of physical activity is the main culprit behind these problems. However, I tend to disagree with this stance, as I believe that other factors play an even more significant role in contributing to these health concerns.While a sedentary lifestyle can certainly lead to various health issues, such as obesity, diabetes, and cardiovascular disease, it is not the sole cause of these problems. Other factors, such as a poor diet, stress, and environmental pollution, also play a substantial role in the development of these health issues. For instance, the widespread consumption of processed and high-calorie foods, which are often high in salt, sugar, and unhealthy fats, can lead to weight gain and increase the risk of chronic diseases. Similarly, chronic stress, which is often caused by work-related pressures and the fast pace of modern life, can also contribute to a range of health problems, including anxiety, depression, and cardiovascular disease.Moreover, environmental pollution, particularly air pollution, has been linked to a range of health issues, including respiratory problems, cardiovascular disease, and even mental health concerns. In contrast, a sedentary lifestyle, while certainly a contributing factor, may not be the primary cause of these problems. Therefore, while it is true that a sedentary lifestyle can lead to various health issues, I believe that other factors, such as a poor diet, stress, and environmental pollution, have an even greater impact on our overall health.

question: Foreign language instruction should begin in kindergarten. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Educational institutions have different systems when it comes to introducing foreign languages to children. Some people believe that foreign language instruction should start in pre-school. However, those who disagree contend that this should be taught in later years. This issue has garnered some attention in the academe as it has an impact on the children's learning. I personally believe that it is important for children to be taught with a secondary language as early as kindergarten.To begin with, children might not be really comfortable with the use of a language other than their native tongue when they are in their kindergarten years. Learning at school must be convenient for them if they speak in a way that they are used to. Moreover, teachers think that foreign language most likely leads to confusion for children who are yet to start learning. Another important thing to consider is that the teacher should be well-trained in the use of this specific language, so quality education will be delivered. Nevertheless, it is undeniable that kids are amazing learners, and the best time to hone them is in their younger years. The introduction of foreign language will be new to them; however, their curiosity will drive them to learn and comprehend. In this way, grasping a new language will be natural to them. In addition, the positive impact of this strategy is beneficial to both learners and teachers. Teachers will not find it difficult to make students learn such new concept in their teenage years. It is certainly clear that the advantages of early introduction of foreign language outweigh its disadvantages.In conclusion, the use of foreign language instruction as early as kindergarten is supported by some people; however, there are those who disagree. I am totally convinced that if this endeavour is properly implemented by schools, this will most likely lead to improvement of learning ability among children.
llm: The debate on when foreign language instruction should begin has been a longstanding one, with some arguing that it should start in pre-school, while others contend that it should be introduced in later years.
